Title: Junior Software Engineer - Milano [DIG]
HTML:
Trasforma le tue aspirazioni professionali in una storia di successo, entra in PwC come Junior Software Engineer – Associate


Your Perspectives

In PwC Digital Innovation ci occupiamo di realizzare progetti e prodotti con l'utilizzo di tecnologie all'avanguardia che abilitano nuovi servizi per il mercato. I punti di forza delle nostre soluzioni sono l'elevata qualità e il ridotto time to market, ottenuti utilizzando le metodologie Scrum e DevOps. Se ti piace la tecnologia e sei interessato ad applicarla a diversi settori di mercato, entra nel nostro team con il ruolo di Associate e avrai l'opportunità di:


  • Utilizzare tecnologie moderne apprendendone di nuove;
  • Lavorare in un contesto giovane e dinamico;
  • Conseguire certificazioni sulle maggiori tecnologie di mercato;
  • Muoverti in un contesto organizzato, dove gli aspetti metodologici e di relazione assumono una rilevanza strategica con respiro internazionale e multiculturale;
  • Seguire un percorso di carriera che ti permetterà di acquisire competenze manageriali oltre che tecniche.


Your unique strengths

  • Possiedi una Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica;
  • Hai maturato un minimo di esperienza nell’ambito di progettazione e sviluppo software con l’utilizzo di almeno una delle seguenti tecnologie: Angular, Java Spring Boot, NodeJS, Flutter;
  • Sei appassionato di tecnologia e consideri il linguaggio di sviluppo un mezzo per arrivare al tuo obiettivo;
  • Hai sviluppato capacità di ascolto attivo, di sintesi e di problem solving;
  • Sei capace di lavorare in autonomia ove necessario;
  • Ti contraddistingui per intraprendenza, curiosità e spiccato senso di responsabilità professionale;
  • Possiedi una buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Set your expectation higher

PwC ti sorprenderà con un’opportunità di carriera che ti farà sentire al centro della società, dell’innovazione e del cambiamento. Il tuo talento e la tua curiosità avranno tutto lo spazio che meritano e, attraverso l’identificazione delle migliori risorse, contribuirai a garantire la qualità dei servizi che offriamo ai nostri clienti. In questo percorso di crescita sarai accompagnato da colleghi esperti e da una formazione continua e su misura grazie alla quale potrai mettere le tue competenze a disposizione dei clienti interni.


Feel at home

Ci prendiamo cura delle nostre persone, abbracciando le diversità e creando valore per i clienti, le persone e la comunità, nel rispetto dell'ambiente. GIVE YOUR LIFE A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE

Title: Data Scientist - Generative AI Specialist
Description:
DATA SCIENTIST – GENERATIVE AI SPECIALIST

Entra nel nostro mondo.

Trasforma insieme a noi.

Quale sarà la tua sfida?

Bip ha creato all’interno del proprio Competence Centre “xTech” il più nutrito gruppo di Data Scientist in Italia (fonte: statistiche LinkedIn), e dall’Italia coordina anche i propri gruppi di Data Scientist locali presso le proprie sedi estere.

Nell’ambito della continua crescita ed evoluzione di questo effervescente gruppo, che opera sui nostri clienti in tutti i settori, e ci ha consentito di introdurre l’Intelligenza Artificiale presso le realtà enterprise più importanti d’Italia, siamo alla ricerca sia di profili junior/intermediate (dai neolaureati a profili con almeno 2 anni di esperienza), sia profili middle-senior (dai 3 ai 6 anni di esperienza). La provenienza da società di consulenza direzionale o informatica sarà considerata un forte plus.

Il/La Generative AI Specialist in Bip evolve non solo le proprie competenze nei modelli di Generative AI, ma anche la comprensione dei fenomeni legati al Business dei nostri Clienti e le proprie capacità di tradurli in soluzioni e poi di comunicare e utilizzare i risultati degli stessi per migliorare ed efficientare i processi.

I/Le nostri/e Generative AI Specialists verranno introdotti in contesti progettuali dove per la maggior parte i dati sono non strutturati (testi, immagini, video, suoni) e il cui focus diventa la comprensione, il processamento e la generazione partendo da tali basi documentali altrimenti non processabili con le classiche tecniche di Data Science.

I contesti progettuali spaziano dall’utilizzo di modelli pre-addestrati (es. LLM) fino all’addestramento di nuovi modelli di Generative AI passando dal fine-tuning e absorption learning da modelli commerciali.

Oltre alle progettualità, ai/alle Generative AI Specialist sarà richiesto un contributo attivo per alimentare la Community con attività di ricerca, scouting, concept di nuove soluzioni e business development.

Sarai tu ad entrare nel nostro team?

Requisiti indispensabili:


Laurea Specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Informatica, Statistica o discipline affini (STEM);
Forte approccio quantitativo e brillanti doti analitiche;
Passione e competenza in ambito data exploration, analisi dati e creazione di modelli: il nostro team disegna e sviluppa sistemi a supporto di decisioni strategiche per il business;
Competenze statistiche, di Data Mining, Machine Learning, Deep Learning;
Solida conoscenza e comprovata esperienza in programmazione e scripting Python
Esperienza con strumenti di version control (es. Git);
Conoscenza approfondita di database relazionali e di costrutti SQL e SQL Programming;
Conoscenza di database non relazionali (es. elasticsearch, mongodb, redis);
Conoscenza di database vettoriali (es. ChromaDB, QDrant, Pinecone, ...)
Conoscenza e l’utilizzo di API Cloud di Intelligenza Artificiale di almeno uno tra i principali cloud provider (Google, Microsoft, AWS)
Conoscenza tecniche di processamento dati non strutturati;
Conoscenza approfondita di Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision e relative tecniche (Text Categorization, Entity Extraction, Generation, Object Detection, Object Segmentation)
Esperienza su Reti Neurali, Convolutional Neural Network, Transformers;
Conoscenza di tecniche di Generative AI e dei principali Large Language Models (LLM)
Esperienza con tecniche di allenamento e fine-tuning di reti neurali (esempio: superconvergenza, PEFT, LORA, …)
Conoscenza delle principali librerie di processamento dati non strutturati (tensorflow, torch, pytorch) e repository di modelli (huggingface)
Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di prompting (es. one/few-shot, chain-of-thought)
Indispensabile la conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese professionali


Plus:


Conoscenza di strumenti di containerizzazione (Docker, Kubernetes, etc)
Esperienza nello sviluppo e applicazione di modelli di Generative AI in contesti industriali
Esperienza nello sviluppo software e conoscenza approfondita del ciclo di vita del software
Conoscenza di framework di versionamento di dati e/o modelli (es.,  MLFlow, DVC)
Utilizzo di reti generative per la produzione controllata di contenuto (testo, immagini, video)
Sviluppo di Motori di Ricerca, Entity Extraction, Anomaly Detection su immagini
Conoscenza principali modelli di Explainable AI (SHAP, Lime, Anchors)
Esperienza con framework di lavoro AGILE (esempio: Scrum, Kanban).


Soft Skills:


Standing consulenziale
Ottime doti relazionali e comunicative
Orientamento al cliente e al raggiungimento degli obiettivi
Buona attitudine a lavorare in team
Precisione e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze


Perchè Bip?

People at the center of our culture

Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialità e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.

Lavorare in BIP è un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti. 

Challenge yourself

Avrai la possibilità di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attività e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l’autonomia e la capacità di assumerti responsabilità e metterti in gioco.

Unlocking your potential

Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all’avanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.

Work-life Integration

Troverai una policy che supporta lo smartworking fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Valorizziamo l’unicità e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutti abbiano pari opportunità di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.

Il nostro approccio alla diversità e all’inclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrità e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, più ampi.

Promuoviamo l’inserimento e l’integrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette – in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99 –.

Next Steps

Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prendere
mo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.

Se c’è un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all’interno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.

L’iter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner.

L’ordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.

In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunità future.

Se dovessi identificare ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

Su di Noi

Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l’esperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l’innovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti e professioniste, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze più all’avanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.

Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualità su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell’eccellenza, che è la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.


Show more
HTML:
DATA SCIENTIST – GENERATIVE AI SPECIALIST

Entra nel nostro mondo.

Trasforma insieme a noi.

Quale sarà la tua sfida?

Bip ha creato all’interno del proprio Competence Centre “xTech” il più nutrito gruppo di Data Scientist in Italia (fonte: statistiche LinkedIn), e dall’Italia coordina anche i propri gruppi di Data Scientist locali presso le proprie sedi estere.

Nell’ambito della continua crescita ed evoluzione di questo effervescente gruppo, che opera sui nostri clienti in tutti i settori, e ci ha consentito di introdurre l’Intelligenza Artificiale presso le realtà enterprise più importanti d’Italia, siamo alla ricerca sia di profili junior/intermediate (dai neolaureati a profili con almeno 2 anni di esperienza), sia profili middle-senior (dai 3 ai 6 anni di esperienza). La provenienza da società di consulenza direzionale o informatica sarà considerata un forte plus.

Il/La Generative AI Specialist in Bip evolve non solo le proprie competenze nei modelli di Generative AI, ma anche la comprensione dei fenomeni legati al Business dei nostri Clienti e le proprie capacità di tradurli in soluzioni e poi di comunicare e utilizzare i risultati degli stessi per migliorare ed efficientare i processi.

I/Le nostri/e Generative AI Specialists verranno introdotti in contesti progettuali dove per la maggior parte i dati sono non strutturati (testi, immagini, video, suoni) e il cui focus diventa la comprensione, il processamento e la generazione partendo da tali basi documentali altrimenti non processabili con le classiche tecniche di Data Science.

I contesti progettuali spaziano dall’utilizzo di modelli pre-addestrati (es. LLM) fino all’addestramento di nuovi modelli di Generative AI passando dal fine-tuning e absorption learning da modelli commerciali.

Oltre alle progettualità, ai/alle Generative AI Specialist sarà richiesto un contributo attivo per alimentare la Community con attività di ricerca, scouting, concept di nuove soluzioni e business development.

Sarai tu ad entrare nel nostro team?

Requisiti indispensabili:
  • Laurea Specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Informatica, Statistica o discipline affini (STEM);
  • Forte approccio quantitativo e brillanti doti analitiche;
  • Passione e competenza in ambito data exploration, analisi dati e creazione di modelli: il nostro team disegna e sviluppa sistemi a supporto di decisioni strategiche per il business;
  • Competenze statistiche, di Data Mining, Machine Learning, Deep Learning;
  • Solida conoscenza e comprovata esperienza in programmazione e scripting Python
  • Esperienza con strumenti di version control (es. Git);
  • Conoscenza approfondita di database relazionali e di costrutti SQL e SQL Programming;
  • Conoscenza di database non relazionali (es. elasticsearch, mongodb, redis);
  • Conoscenza di database vettoriali (es. ChromaDB, QDrant, Pinecone, ...)
  • Conoscenza e l’utilizzo di API Cloud di Intelligenza Artificiale di almeno uno tra i principali cloud provider (Google, Microsoft, AWS)
  • Conoscenza tecniche di processamento dati non strutturati;
  • Conoscenza approfondita di Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision e relative tecniche (Text Categorization, Entity Extraction, Generation, Object Detection, Object Segmentation)
  • Esperienza su Reti Neurali, Convolutional Neural Network, Transformers;
  • Conoscenza di tecniche di Generative AI e dei principali Large Language Models (LLM)
  • Esperienza con tecniche di allenamento e fine-tuning di reti neurali (esempio: superconvergenza, PEFT, LORA, …)
  • Conoscenza delle principali librerie di processamento dati non strutturati (tensorflow, torch, pytorch) e repository di modelli (huggingface)
  • Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di prompting (es. one/few-shot, chain-of-thought)
  • Indispensabile la conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese professionali


Plus:
  • Conoscenza di strumenti di containerizzazione (Docker, Kubernetes, etc)
  • Esperienza nello sviluppo e applicazione di modelli di Generative AI in contesti industriali
  • Esperienza nello sviluppo software e conoscenza approfondita del ciclo di vita del software
  • Conoscenza di framework di versionamento di dati e/o modelli (es.,  MLFlow, DVC)
  • Utilizzo di reti generative per la produzione controllata di contenuto (testo, immagini, video)
  • Sviluppo di Motori di Ricerca, Entity Extraction, Anomaly Detection su immagini
  • Conoscenza principali modelli di Explainable AI (SHAP, Lime, Anchors)
  • Esperienza con framework di lavoro AGILE (esempio: Scrum, Kanban).


Soft Skills:
  • Standing consulenziale
  • Ottime doti relazionali e comunicative
  • Orientamento al cliente e al raggiungimento degli obiettivi
  • Buona attitudine a lavorare in team
  • Precisione e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze


Perchè Bip?

People at the center of our culture

Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialità e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.

Lavorare in BIP è un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti. 

Challenge yourself

Avrai la possibilità di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attività e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l’autonomia e la capacità di assumerti responsabilità e metterti in gioco.

Unlocking your potential

Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all’avanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.

Work-life Integration

Troverai una policy che supporta lo smartworking fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Valorizziamo l’unicità e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutti abbiano pari opportunità di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.

Il nostro approccio alla diversità e all’inclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrità e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, più ampi.

Promuoviamo l’inserimento e l’integrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette – in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99 –.

Next Steps

Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prendere
mo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.

Se c’è un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all’interno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.

L’iter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner.

L’ordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.

In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunità future.

Se dovessi identificare ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

Su di Noi

Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l’esperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l’innovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti e professioniste, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze più all’avanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.

Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualità su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell’eccellenza, che è la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.

Title: Fullstack Developer (Python) - Milano
Description:
Il nostro cliente è una start-up innovativa facente parte di un prestigioso Gruppo operante nel settore del Legaltech, che sviluppa applicativi e servizi per il mercato Legale. Siamo alla ricerca di uno Sviluppatore Full-Stack talentuoso e motivato, con un'esperienza di qualche anno nello sviluppo di applicazioni web in Python, esperto nell'implementazione di architetture a microservizi e nella creazione di dashboard custom in ambienti cloud.

In modo particolare la risorsa ricercata si occuperà principalmente di:


Progettare e sviluppare applicazioni web full-stack in Python, utilizzando framework moderni sia per il backend che per il frontend.
Implementare e gestire architetture a microservizi, assicurando l'integrazione e la scalabilità dei servizi.
Creare dashboard customizzate per la visualizzazione dei dati, fornendo agli utenti finali strumenti intuitivi per l'analisi e l'interpretazione delle informazioni.
Lavorare in ambienti cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure), sfruttando servizi cloud-native per ottimizzare le prestazioni e la sicurezza delle applicazioni.
Collaborare con il team di progetto per definire i requisiti, le specifiche tecniche e i criteri di accettazione dei progetti.
Assicurare la qualità del codice attraverso revisioni periodiche, test automatizzati e implementazione delle migliori pratiche di sviluppo software.
Fornire supporto tecnico e manutenzione per le applicazioni esistenti, identificando e risolvendo eventuali problemi.


RequisitiIl candidato ideale ha almeno 3 anni di esperienza in ruolo analogo e presenta le seguenti caratteristiche:


Esperienza comprovata nello sviluppo Full-Stack di applicazioni web (min 3 anni), con una specifica competenza in linguaggio Python e framework correlati (Django, Flask, FastAPI) per il backend e di React per il frontend.
Esperienza nell'implementazione di architetture a microservizi e nella gestione di ambienti cloud.
Capacità di creare dashboard customizzate e interfaccia utente (UI) accattivanti e funzionali.
Familiarità con i database SQL e NoSQL, e capacità di integrare e gestire grandi volumi di dati.
Competenze nel CI/CD, containerizzazione (Docker, Kubernetes) e automazione dei processi di sviluppo.
Ottime capacità di problem solving e lavoro in team.
Preferibile Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria del Software o campo correlato.


L'azienda offre:


Un ruolo strategico all'interno di un team dinamico e in crescita, con la possibilità di lavorare su progetti tecnologicamente avanzati e innovativi
Ambiente di lavoro stimolante e costruttivo, con ampie opportunità di apprendimento e crescita professionale.
Pacchetto retributivo competitivo, inclusi bonus basati sulle prestazioni e benefit (in aggiunta rispetto alla RAL indicata in annuncio).
Possibilità Smartworking e flessibilità lavorativa.
Cultura aziendale inclusiva e orientata alla collaborazione.
Show more

Title: Manager Data Scientist
Description:
EY Technology Consulting- Manager Data Scientist

Be the transformative leader that the world needs. It’s yours to build.

In EY Consulting non troverai soltanto un lavoro, ma un’esperienza formativa che ti porterà ad essere il leader di cui abbiamo bisogno. Vogliamo essere la scintilla che dà vita alle tue ispirazioni e al tuo successo. Per questo motivo ti offriamo tutte le risorse, le competenze tecniche specifiche e le community tematiche, per sviluppare i tuoi interessi e le tue ambizioni.

Cerchiamo Transformation leader in grado di guidare trasformazioni complesse attraverso tecnologia, human e innovation, e capaci di coniugare conoscenze tecnologiche e visione del futuro.

Perché dovresti scegliere EY Consulting?

Da subito entrerai a far parte di team e settori diversificati, partecipando attivamente ai processi di trasformazione e di innovazione di aziende, società e Pubbliche Amministrazioni per creare un impatto sul Paese.

Costruirai la carriera che desideri grazie a percorsi di formazione su hard e soft skill, community e hub tecnologici, dove potrai quotidianamente provare, sperimentare e crescere.

Questa è la tua opportunità per sviluppare le tue competenze e per fare qualcosa di eccezionale per te, per noi, per il mondo. The exceptional EY experience, it’s yours to build.

Qual è il contesto in cui verrai inserito?

Come Manager Data Scientist farai parte della divisione AI&Data, entrerai a far parte del team dell'AI&Advanced Analytics che è basato a Milano, Roma, Bari, Cagliari e Trieste.

Ti occuperai di:


Gestione dei progetti end-to-end in ambito advanced analytics
Definizione e progettazione di soluzioni di Machine Learning e analisi dati per i clienti
Definizione e progettazione di sviluppo di modelli predittivi tramite tecniche di Machine Learning e/o Deep Learning per NLP/NLU, Computer Vision, Time Series e analisi dei grafi di conoscenza
Definizione di dashboard e insight per semplificare il processo decisionale degli stakeholder


Requisiti richiesti


Laurea in materie ingegneristiche o scientifiche
Gestione end-to-end di progetti analitici
Almeno 5 anni di esperienza in progetti nel settore industriale, preferibilmente in società di consulenza
Ottima conoscenza di Python e delle librerie per manipolazione dati e sviluppo modelli (pandas, tensorflow, scikit-learn, pytorch, ecc…)
Definizione e progettazione di soluzioni di Machine Learning e analisi dati per i clienti
Conoscenza di strumenti e linguaggi per la manipolazione dei dati: SQL, MongoDB, Neo4j, Spark, ecc..
Conoscenza di modelli predittivi tramite tecniche di Machine Learning e/o Deep Learning
Conoscenza di servizi e micro servizi cloud e di disegno architetturale
Conoscenza di graph DB
Esperienza in ambito di industrializzazione di modelli ML con approccio MLOPS e esperienza di costruzione di pipeline CI/CD


Cosa chiediamo:

Una forte voglia di cambiare il mondo, per il meglio In EY diamo luogo ad una trasformazione, mettendo il nostro purpose - Building a better working world - al centro di tutto ciò che facciamo, e siamo convinti di poter contribuire alla trasformazione del Paese con una forte e precisa idea di futuro e di innovazione.

Cosa offriamo:


Ambiente di lavoro internazionale, all’interno di team diversi e multidisciplinari.
Percorsi di formazione continua per valorizzare il tuo talento.
Hub tecnologici avanzati in cui sperimentare la trasformazione
Supporto di un Counselor, quale guida nella scelta delle esperienze più adatte alle tue ambizioni.
Benefit e programmi di welfare aziendale.
Tutti gli strumenti necessari per avere una carriera orientata alla crescita, alla sperimentazione e alla tecnologia più avanzata


Apri la tua carriera a nuovi scenari di crescita ed entra a far parte del team di EY Consulting.

The exceptional EY experience, it’s yours to build!
Show more

Title: DATA SCIENTIST– CATEGORIE PROTETTE L. 68/99 (ID-81801)
Company: AFOL Milano -Agenzia per la formazione, l'orientamento e il lavoro
Description:
TIPOLOGIA DI CONTRATTO: Tempo Determinato, Indeterminato, Tirocinio

SEDE DI LAVORO: MILANO, San Babila

La risorsa appartenente alle Categorie Protette con disabilità certificata ai sensi della L.68/99 sarà inserita nella Divisione Customer Experience.

Il Data Scientist sarà coinvolto nel Team Big Data, AI & ML e metterà a disposizione le proprie competenze focalizzandosi sulla specializzazione analytics.

L'obiettivo principale del professionista sarà l'evoluzione degli analytics su Google Data Platform (Looker, Data studio, Vertex AI) e della moderna BI su terabyte di dati. Inoltre lavorerà con team multidisciplinari per gestire e integrare i dati.

PROFILO IDEALE: Laurea magistrale Informatica/Marketing, esperienza pregressa, ottimo inglese e perfetta conoscenza del pacchetto Windows Office, Python - Scikit learn - Numpy

ORARIO DI LAVORO E CCNL: FULL e PART TIME– CCNL Metalmeccanico Industria.

Title: Software Engineer II - Continuity of Care (x/f/m)
Description:
What We Do

Join a team of passionate and hard working entrepreneurs to transform healthcare!

Working in the tech team at Doctolib involves building innovative products and features to improve the daily lives of care teams and patients. We work in feature teams in an agile environment, while collaborating with product, design, and business teams.

What You'll Do

We are looking for a Software Engineer II to make our Milan tech hub grow even more! Your mission will be working on the Continuity of Care technology.

We're looking for an all round role: you will help building the product with our Product Manager, coding, deploying and working with feedback from users. Here's an idea of your daily schedule:


60% on designing and implementing new features, according to the roadmap;
20% on tech tasks (stability, security, technical debt, you name it!);
20% on bug fixes in order to have a healthy platform.



Who You Are

If you don’t meet all the requirements below but believe this opportunity matches your expectations and experience, we still encourage you to apply!


You are comfortable with English (our team is international!);
You have a strong and solid fullstack development experience, preferably in a hyper-growth environment;
You are familiar and have experience working with large distributed systems;
You have already worked with Ruby and/or React: that would be a great plus!



What We Offer


Employee share plan for every Doctoliber
Supplementary Health Insurance
Partnership for retirement funds with Ciao Elsa
Parental care program (1 month off in addition to the legal parental leave and 0,5 days off per child when the school starts)
Wellbeing program (free mental health and coaching offer with our partner moka.care)
A flexible workplace policy offering both hybrid and office-based mode
Flexibility days allowing to work in EU countries and the UK 10 days per year
Sport Partnership with FitPrime
Reimbursement of public transportation



The interview process


Recruiter Interview
Feature Building Interview
System Design Interview
Behavioural Interview
Offer!



If you would like to find out more about tech life at Doctolib, feel free to read our latest Medium blog articles!

At Doctolib, we believe in improving access to healthcare for everyone - regardless of where you come from, what you look like. This translates into our recruitment process: Doctolib is an equal opportunity employer. We don't just accept diversity at Doctolib, we respect and celebrate it!

The more diverse ideas are heard, the more our product will truly improve healthcare for all. You are welcome to apply to Doctolib, regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or place of origin. If you have a disability, let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process smoother for you!

All the information transmitted via this form is processed by Doctolib for the purpose of managing applications. For more information on how Doctolib processes your application data, click here.

If you wish to exercise your rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data, you can write to us at hr.dataprivacy(at)doctolib.com.
Show more
HTML:
What We Do

Join a team of passionate and hard working entrepreneurs to transform healthcare!

Working in the tech team at Doctolib involves building innovative products and features to improve the daily lives of care teams and patients. We work in feature teams in an agile environment, while collaborating with product, design, and business teams.

What You'll Do

We are looking for a Software Engineer II to make our Milan tech hub grow even more! Your mission will be working on the Continuity of Care technology.

We're looking for an all round role: you will help building the product with our Product Manager, coding, deploying and working with feedback from users. Here's an idea of your daily schedule:

  • 60% on designing and implementing new features, according to the roadmap;
  • 20% on tech tasks (stability, security, technical debt, you name it!);
  • 20% on bug fixes in order to have a healthy platform.


Who You Are

If you don’t meet all the requirements below but believe this opportunity matches your expectations and experience, we still encourage you to apply!

  • You are comfortable with English (our team is international!);
  • You have a strong and solid fullstack development experience, preferably in a hyper-growth environment;
  • You are familiar and have experience working with large distributed systems;
  • You have already worked with Ruby and/or React: that would be a great plus!


What We Offer

  • Employee share plan for every Doctoliber
  • Supplementary Health Insurance
  • Partnership for retirement funds with Ciao Elsa
  • Parental care program (1 month off in addition to the legal parental leave and 0,5 days off per child when the school starts)
  • Wellbeing program (free mental health and coaching offer with our partner moka.care)
  • A flexible workplace policy offering both hybrid and office-based mode
  • Flexibility days allowing to work in EU countries and the UK 10 days per year
  • Sport Partnership with FitPrime
  • Reimbursement of public transportation


The interview process

  • Recruiter Interview
  • Feature Building Interview
  • System Design Interview
  • Behavioural Interview
  • Offer!


If you would like to find out more about tech life at Doctolib, feel free to read our latest Medium blog articles!

At Doctolib, we believe in improving access to healthcare for everyone - regardless of where you come from, what you look like. This translates into our recruitment process: Doctolib is an equal opportunity employer. We don't just accept diversity at Doctolib, we respect and celebrate it!

The more diverse ideas are heard, the more our product will truly improve healthcare for all. You are welcome to apply to Doctolib, regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or place of origin. If you have a disability, let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process smoother for you!

All the information transmitted via this form is processed by Doctolib for the purpose of managing applications. For more information on how Doctolib processes your application data, click here.

If you wish to exercise your rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data, you can write to us at hr.dataprivacy(at)doctolib.com.

Title: REACT WEB Developer (remoto)
Description:
Omicron S.r.l., Società In Forte Espansione Nell’area Della Consulenza Informatica e Nella Realizzazione D’importanti Progetti Ad Alto Contenuto Tecnologico, Ricerca

REACT WEB Developer (remoto)

3+ anni di esperienza di sviluppo soluzioni web con tecnologia React.

Spiccata attitudine alla problem solving

Esperienza pluriannuale su progetti Web React complessi

Capace di valutare e ideare soluzioni complesse

Ideare e sviluppare soluzioni e applicativi da zero

Esperienza desing system ( gradita conoscenza di Storybook o simili )

Ottima esperienza nel sviluppare frontend su base React ( responsive gestione Desktop / Tablet / APP )

Si Offre


Contratto a tempo determinato di 12 mesi con possibilità di rinnovo.
Retribuzione fissa commisurata alle effettive competenze maturate.


Sede di lavoro: remoto

L’offerta si intende rivolta a candidati ambosessi, nel rispetto del D.Lgs. n. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii. e dei Decreti Legislativi n. 215 e n. 216 del 2003 sulle parità di trattamento. I candidati sono invitati a leggere l’informativa privacy ai sensi degli artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. EU 679/2016

Title: Project Developer
HTML:
Il nostro cliente è un produttore indipendente di energia rinnovabile che sviluppa, finanzia, costruisce e gestisce progetti di energia solare, eolica onshore e offshore, idroelettrica e di idrogeno verde. Attivo in 20 Paesi in Europa, America Latina e Africa, il gruppo mira a diventare un leader indipendente nel settore dell'energia responsabile.

Fondata nel 2019, la filiale italiana fa parte del Gruppo francese e conta più di 1,5 GW in fase di autorizzazione e le prime costruzioni previste per il 2024. L'obiettivo è di avere 500 MW in funzione in Italia entro il 2025.



Per supportare questa rapida crescita, il nostro cliente sta reclutando un Project Developer da inserire nell'organico per rafforzarlo.


Qualifiche:


Laurea magistrale in Ingegneria ambientale o in Ingegneria elettrica con competenze ambientali.


Esperienza lavorativa precedente:


È richiesta una precedente esperienza in un ruolo simile. Costituisce titolo preferenziale una precedente esperienza nel campo della progettazione e dello sviluppo di impianti per la produzione di energia da fonti rinnovabili, nella valutazione e nella mappatura tematica degli aspetti ambientali e territoriali, nella redazione tecnica della documentazione necessaria per tutti gli iter autorizzativi (Ambientali ed Edilizi) e la conoscenza di tutte le fasi dell'iter autorizzativo di un progetto.


Compiti da svolgere:

  • Gestire e coordinare le attività del gruppo interno di sviluppo e progettazione al fine di rispettare le scadenze e la qualità, al fine di perseguire le autorizzazioni necessarie.
  • Coordinamento di professionisti esterni per lo sviluppo di studi specialistici ai fini di una valutazione completa dell'impatto ambientale dei progetti secondo la legislazione italiana;
  • Ottimizzare e coordinare, insieme al Development Manager, la soluzione ottimale per ogni progetto con relativa valutazione dei potenziali di impatto;
  • Elaborare integrazioni e controdeduzioni durante il processo di autorizzazione dei progetti;
  • Rappresentare l'azienda in tutte le occasioni di confronto con gli enti coinvolti nel processo di autorizzazione dei progetti;
  • Valutare e correggere gli studi effettuati da terzi;
  • Generare e aggiornare i rapporti operativi.




Competenze richieste:

  • Conoscenza delle normative (nazionali, regionali, provinciali, comunali, ecc.) necessarie per le procedure autorizzative degli impianti da fonti rinnovabili: PAS, AU, PAUR, VIA, VAS;
  • Conoscenza e capacità di utilizzo di software di progettazione grafica: Autocad, QGIS/ArcGIS, GPS e/o altri software;
  • Competenza e capacità di gestire le pratiche di connessione alla rete con il gestore della rete elettrica nazionale;
  • questioni ambientali e in particolare procedure di VIA e VAS;
  • Conoscenza e competenza nella progettazione di impianti di energia rinnovabile su larga scala (in particolare fotovoltaico ed eolico);
  • Lingua inglese B2; il francese sarebbe un plus;
  • Propensione al lavoro di squadra.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The Company:




Exsolvæ is a data consultancy based in Brussels, Belgium. We are dedicated to fostering a culture of knowledge sharing among data professionals.

Our goal is not only to excel in one discipline, but also to gain a comprehensive understanding of the challenges spread across the four pillars of our expertise:




Data Foundations: Data Engineering to Design, develop, and maintain data architecture and infrastructure, build data pipelines, etc.
BI, Data Analytics & Visualization: Design and implement data visualization solutions that enable to gain insights from the data.
Data Science & Artificial Intelligence: Implement & Develop algorithms in Deep Learning, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence.
Data Governance & Strategy: Strategic consultancy for acquisition and valorization of Data.




We provide a collaborative ecosystem for a new generation of pluri-disciplinary engineers who are eager to broaden their understanding of challenges across the data flow.




As a Solver in Data Science at Exsolvæ, you will be responsible for providing data-driven solutions to our clients' challenges in industries such as banking, insurance, and pharmaceutical manufacturing, ...




Job Responsibilities:




Analyzing complex data sets and extracting insights to inform decision making using software such as Python, R, and SQL.
Designing and implementing data-driven solutions using statistical and machine learning techniques.
Collaborating with clients to understand their needs and challenges, and providing recommendations.
Communicating findings and recommendations to clients in a clear and concise manner.
Continuously learning and staying up-to-date with the latest developments in the field of Data Science.
Mentoring junior team members and contributing to the development of the Data Science team.







Key Requirements:




A Master's or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
Strong experience in data analysis and machine learning techniques.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Proactive and able to work independently as well as part of a team.
A strong desire to learn and stay up-to-date with the latest developments in Data Science.
Fluent in English (Mandatory).
Fluency in Flemish and/or French (Mandatory).







Additional Preferred Qualifications:




Programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.
Data visualization tools such as Tableau and Matplotlib.
Machine learning libraries and frameworks such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
Cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure.
Data storage and management systems such as Hadoop, Spark, and NoSQL databases.
Collaboration and project management tools such as Jupyter and GitHub.







Advantages of the Position:




Long Term Contract (CDI)
The opportunity to work on a wide range of challenging and diverse projects in industries such as banking, insurance, and pharmaceutical manufacturing.
A collaborative and supportive work environment.
Continuous learning and professional development opportunities.
Attractive salary and benefits package.
The chance to be part of a meaningful project from the start.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
My client, a leading Data Specialist, is looking for a candidate to contribute to data analytics and machine learning projects.




Key Responsibilities:




Data Analysis & Modeling:




Perform advanced data analysis to derive actionable insights.
Develop, validate, and deploy machine learning models.
Conduct exploratory data analysis and statistical analysis.




Data Engineering:




Design and implement data pipelines using Spark (Databricks, EMR).
Manage and optimize data storage solutions with Delta Lake.




Database Management:




Utilize SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Work with cloud-based data warehouses such as AWS Redshift, AWS Athena, Snowflake, and GCP BigQuery.
Stream Processing:
Implement real-time data processing solutions using Kafka and Beam.
Workflow Orchestration:
Automate and manage workflows using Airflow and other orchestration tools.
Cloud & Infrastructure:
Deploy and manage applications on Kubernetes.




Required Skills & Qualifications:




Educational Background:




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.




Technical Skills:




Proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases.
Strong programming skills in Python and Scala.
Hands-on experience with AWS Athena, Snowflake, AWS Redshift, and GCP BigQuery.
Expertise in using Delta Lake for data storage and management.
Experience with Spark (Databricks, EMR) for big data processing.
Knowledge of real-time data processing tools like Kafka and Beam.
Familiarity with Airflow and other orchestration tools for workflow automation.
Experience with container orchestration using Kubernetes.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
BWC is looking a DevOps Automation Engineer for its client in Brussels, Belgium.

Its a full time - permanent contract with BWC.




Function description:

-The ML Engineer commits to help the team meet the code quality and testing standards expected to be able to serve AI models in production.

-Responsible for helping reduce the application footprint, guarantee resilience, and setup monitoring of the solution. 

-Focus is on the completion of the sprint backlog, containing all elements that the team must deliver and of which the sequence has been determined by the Product Owner based on the added value for the (internal or external) client.




Required experience / knowledge : At least 5 years of relevant experience

Technical experience

Knowledge of Python development and packaging
Excellent understanding of architecture (hardware, OS, networking, databases, middleware)
Knowledge of code quality standards and security procedures as well as development tools
Experience with integration using different technologies (distributes/mainframe) and infra components
Knowledge of agile methodology
Excellent analysis skills
Efficient communication skills
Ambitious towards the targets of his/her squad
Agile values: focussed, committed, open, respectful, courageous
Promote continuous improvement (market evolutions, working methods, …) to improve delivery speed of software and hardware, and to improve operational quality




Interested candidate please send the CV to :

Preeti@bigwater.consulting

Hr@bigwater.consulting

Title: Data Scientist - Europe
Description:
We are seeking a Data Scientist to work in the Branding position and contribute to building the global leader in contextual advertising.




WHO WE ARE




Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES




2014 · Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 · 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 · Fundraising round of 40M€ & +10 countries & +230 Seedtaggers

2022 · Fundraising round of 250M€ + expansion into the U.S market + 400 Seedtaggers




YOUR CHALLENGE




As a member of our data science team, your primary responsibility will be to develop network analysis technology.
You will delve into complex datasets to construct and refine models that accurately represent the interactions and dynamics within our network.
Collaborating closely with business teams, your focus will be on applying your technical skills to directly impact business outcomes.
You will lead the charge in architecting and implementing scalable machine learning algorithms tailored for network analysis, ensuring they are optimized for real-world application.
You will develop and deploy production-oriented data software.




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF




You have 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning
You possess strong software engineering skills with proven proficiency in programming languages like Python.
Your educational foundation is strong, with a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or a similar field with substantial quantitative rigor.
You possess a general understanding of machine learning principles and have demonstrated experience with key machine learning tools.
You are a proactive and entrepreneurial problem-solver, adaptable in dynamic environments and eager to drive business success through data-driven solutions




SEEDTAG PERKS




🚀 Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

💯 One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you’re a top performer (think of Brazil, Mexico..., 🏖️)

🍽️🚘 Access to a flexible benefits plan with restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten tickets and discounts on medical insurance

⌛ Real flexible schedule to balance work and personal life. You are free to choose where to work from.

🏠 Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K€ (external screen, chair, table...)

🏋 Gympass, you will have access to wellness apps with certified psychologists, nutritional plans, on-demand classes and much more.

🇬🇧🇪🇸🇫🇷 Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

📚 Odilo online school, where you can learn as much as you want

🍻 We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues!




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG




Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that’s the way it’s always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.




Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Fincons Group is an IT business consulting company that has been designing the digital future of leading companies on international markets for 40 years. Fincons Group built its reputation on foreseeing and interpreting new business models and the rapid evolution of IT systems by building a complete range of services: from research and consulting to design and development, from system integration of leading vendor software solutions right up to application management, supporting clients step by step along their digital transformation journey. Fincons is a multinational with over 2,600 people and several offices worldwide (in Italy, Switzerland, Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Belgium and the USA), but above all a Family Company where the founders play a strategic role with commitment and passion, grounding the company in the same principles of a united and caring family.

We firmly believe in the value of cooperation and in the contribution that every idea and intuition can bring. We believe that everyone’s effort can make a difference. Transforming knowledge into a strategic resource is our company mission, and we pursue it with the help of our most strategic asset: our people.



Fincons is looking for a Data Scientist


The following tasks will be performed by external service provider:

  • Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solutions;
  • Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience;
  • Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL);
  • Produces data models according to specific problems statements;
  • Scripting and programming;
  • Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc…);
  • Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.


All these activities require interactions with business stakeholders and with the IT teams as well as a strong participation in business and/or functional working groups, progress meetings and meetings with the stakeholders (IT and business).


Knowledge and skills

· Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools;

· Experience with languages like R, Python, PERL;

· Proficient in continuous code delivery and unit testing;

· Expertise in the ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio…);

· Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);

· Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores;

· Knowledge of R-Studio infrastructure is an asset;

· Experience in developing interactive R / Python dashboards using packages like Shiny, Dash or similar is an asset;

· Experience in developing R / Python functions to perform linear algebra calculations with data frames and arrays, ensuring efficient manipulation of data is an asset;

· Experience in using the following libraries (or equivalents) is an asset:

. Data Management: Pandas (tidyverse and dplyr for R), Numpy;

. Data Visualizations: at least one among Matplotlib, Seaborn or Plotly (ggplot2 for R);

· Capability to write clear and structured technical documents;

· Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously;

· Results-oriented mindset, focused on delivering;

· Good communication skills in English, both orally and in written form.


Specific expertise: at least 13 years in the IT Sector.


Knowledge of English is required.


Office: Brussels

Working 80% of the time on site


If interested, please apply!

Our personnel search is addressed to candidates of all genders.

The data will be processed and stored exclusively for the purposes of this or future selections, in compliance with the Federal Data Protection Law (LPD) and guaranteeing the rights referred to in art. 13 Legislative Decree 196/03 and EU regulation 679/2016 (GDPR)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
My client is a global logistics organisation that is searching for a Freelance Data Scientist.




The ideal candidate's favourite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.

Responsibilities

Analise raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modelling
Deep understanding of predictive modelling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)

Title: Data Scientist NLP
Description:
La Mutualité Chrétienne veut, avec sa nouvelle direction, jouer un rôle de premier plan dans la numérisation et l'utilisation de IA & Analytics pour optimiser ses services aux membres. Dans un environnement en mutation, où les services de notre groupe sont plus diversifiés et où la numérisation est une nécessité, la MC veut utiliser ses données de manière optimale afin de devenir plus personnelle. IA et les données à taille humaine, telle est notre devise !




C’est pourquoi nous avons lancé une nouvelle direction, DACE. Au sein de celle-ci, les données, la numérisation et l’ICT constituent un lieu de rencontre pour la création de nouvelles idées.




Description de fonction




Au sein de l'équipe Data Science, nous recherchons un collègue spécialisé dans le traitement automatique du langage naturel (NLP).

Vous avez de l'expérience dans l'analyse et le traitement de gros volumes de données textuelles non structurées à l'aide de techniques modernes de NLP, notamment : la tokenisation, la modélisation de sujets, l'analyse des sentiments, la modélisation Seq2seq, l'extraction d'entités, le mécanisme d'attention, les architectures Transformer et les incorporations de mots.

Vous avez de l'expérience avec au moins un framework ML (tensorflow, pytorch, keras, ...) utilisant une ou plusieurs des techniques ci-dessus.
Une connaissance de la modélisation de dialogue, de l' IA conversationnelle et une expérience avec les plateformes Cloud sont un plus.
Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec l'IT pour industrialiser les modèles créés.
Vous recherchez des données en dehors du groupe et vous les utilisez.




Profil




Vous êtes titulaire d'un master ou équivalent par expérience. De préférence en sciences de la santé, mathématiques, sciences appliquées, informatique, statistiques ou dans un domaine similaire.
Vous êtes capable de gérer et d'analyser de grands ensembles de données avec une rigueur analytique à l'aide de l'ensemble d'outils habituels de méthodes statistiques et d'apprentissage automatique.
Vous avez de l'expérience dans les algorithmes et les stratégies d'apprentissage guidé et non supervisé pour le traitement de données, l'exploration de données/texte, et vous pouvez les mettre en œuvre dans le contexte de l'entreprise.
Vous travaillez depuis plusieurs années (au moins 3-5 ans) dans une Data Science stack telle que Python sur Jupiter Notebooks avec Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, ...
Vous interrogez différentes formes de données: SQL, OLAP, JSON et XML
Vous pouvez travailler facilement avec des outils tels que Tensorflow et Keras.
Vous êtes fort dans l'analyse exploratoire, la recherche et la communication d'histoires à partir des données.
La connaissance des outils de visualisation de données tels que BO, Qlikview, D3.js ou Bokeh supporte votre narration.
Vous avez une bonne connaissance active du néerlandais ET du français.
Vous êtes prêt à vous déplacer à Bruxelles 1 jour par semaine.




Offre




Nous vous offrons un contrat temps-plein à durée indéterminée.

A la MC, votre travail a un impact sur la société. Chaque jour, vous faites la différence pour nos membres. Vous pouvez compter sur une enveloppe salariale diversifiée et compétitive, tout en préservant l'équilibre entre le travail et la vie privée. Mais cela ne s'arrête pas là. Car si vous le souhaitez, vous pouvez saisir de nombreuses opportunités. Nous vous proposons des formations et des possibilités d'évolution. Vous avez l'occasion de prendre des initiatives. Et vous collaborez à des projets riches en défis. Une chose est sûre: chez nous, vous pouvez vous développer. Comme pour tout collègue de la MC, une conclusion s'imposera bien vite à vous: chez nous, ça vit!

Show more

Title: Data scientist (meteorology)
Description:
Position: Meteorologist Data Scientist




Location Options: Italy / Estonia / Remote




About the Client: Our client, a pioneer in renewable energy innovation, focuses on optimizing wind power generation globally. They employ a range of Numerical Weather Prediction (NWP) models combined with cutting-edge machine learning techniques to improve both short and long-term wind forecasts, thereby enhancing the efficiency of wind farm operations.




Ideal Candidate Profile: Our client seeks a highly skilled Meteorologist Data Scientist to enhance their predictive modeling and methodologies. This role is perfect for someone with a blend of meteorological knowledge and data science prowess. If you have a passion for meteorology, data science, and machine learning, and aspire to make a notable impact in the renewable energy sector, they are eager to connect with you!




Primary Responsibilities:

Collaborate with engineering and data science teams to refine wind power forecasting models.
Analyze and interpret various NWP models to identify and rectify local wind anomalies.
Implement Model Output Statistics (MOS) corrections to enhance forecast accuracy and detail.
Employ machine learning techniques to model and downscale NWP grids locally, improving forecast resolution.
Enhance multi-model ensemble methods to optimize wind forecast precision.
Conduct thorough data validation and quality control on meteorological datasets.




Required Qualifications and Skills:

Advanced degree (Master’s or Ph.D.) in Meteorology, Atmospheric Science, Data Science, or a closely related field.
1-2 years of experience in weather forecasting, data science, or a related area.
Previous experience in the wind power segment of the renewable energy sector is advantageous.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
Experience with machine learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Proficient in data visualization tools like Matplotlib, Seaborn, or Plotly.
Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL database systems.
Strong understanding of NWP models.
Experience with MOS application.
Familiarity with different meteorological data sources and their practical uses.
Skilled in applying AI and machine learning techniques to weather forecasting.
Ability to develop statistical corrections to improve forecast precision.
Strong skills in data preprocessing, validation, and quality assurance.
Capable of developing, validating, and implementing predictive models.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Effective communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Proactive, innovative, and self-motivated.
Strong organizational and project management abilities.
Proficiency in English; knowledge of Italian is beneficial.




Benefits Include:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Inclusion in the Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP).
Opportunities to work with advanced technologies in the renewable energy field.
A collaborative and innovative work culture.
Potential for career growth and professional development.
Flexible working arrangements (locations include Italy, Tallinn - Estonia, and Remote options).




Join the Team: If you are driven to revolutionize renewable power forecasting through AI and data-driven solutions, apply now to be part of this dynamic team.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist | ML | Freelance/Contract | Brussels | Hybrid




Python, Data Science, Git, NLP/NLU




Are you a versatile Data Scientist / Developer with a strong command of Python, eager to apply your skills to machine learning projects?




For one of our key financial clients based in Brussels, Amoria Bond is currently looking for an experienced and collaborative ML focussed, Data Scientist to join their team of Machine Learning Engineers and Data Scientists, to help on a Chat bot deployment project.




Skills & experience:




Extensive experience in Python
Experience in Data Science and Machine Learning
Experience in with an LLM powered RAG solution
Experience in an NLP / NLU project
Fluent in English
Professional in Dutch or French.




Are you the specialist we are looking for? Send your CV and contact details to Kieran.Hyde@amoriabond.com and I will contact you as soon as I can!




Python, Data Science, Git, NLP/NLU




We will endeavour to respond to your application ASAP. However, there may be times when it is not possible to reply to all applications, due to high volumes of enquiries. This is sometimes the case for unsuccessful applications to one of our vacancies. Amoria Bond operates as an employment agency and employment business. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

Title: Data scientist
Description:
Data Scientist About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise :


Asset management
Energy transition services
Energy supply & global commodities
Risk management & market access


At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context : The role of the Data Scientist is to provide analysis, models and tools to the optimization and trading desks, using data science tools and state-of-the art quantitative models. The Team Manager of “Power & Emissions” QRM's team will be your direct manager. The data scientist will be working for the business platform BP Power Trading and Structuring & Origination. Role :

The data scientist will be focused on the activities related to the CWE power markets. He will leverage large amount of data using machine learning and state-of-the art quantitative models to deliver analysis and tools that have a concrete impact on the business, including :


Prediction of relevant power market signals
Asset optimization
Trading algorithm


The daily responsibilities include:


Contribute to the digitalization and data-driven trading decision of GEMS
Develop, improve and support our models and tools
Leverage complex data to provide market insight
Be in direct contact with traders and optimizers desks to understand their business needs and propose solutions
Be in direct contact with Quants and Market Analysts, to exchange about models, new ideas, in order to leverage on the knowledge from peers
Be in direct contact with the IS team to be aligned on coding best practices and IS architectures


Hard skills :


Must have:
Strong mathematical skills, expert in statistics, machine learning and optimization,
In-depth understanding of the energy business and power markets,
Demonstrated coding skills (Python) in order to develop autonomously prototypes & models,
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues,
Familiar with GIT, Microsoft suite,
Experience with data science techniques


Soft skills :


Must have:
Analyzing, practical thinking, entrepreneurship,
Planning, developing others,
Conceptual thinking, working together.


Education and professional background :


University degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Sciences,
Experience in short term power markets is a plus
3 to 15 years of experience in a similar role


Languages :


Fluent in English


Travels :


Working place is Brussels. Only limited travel needed in case of for example conferences.


If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals. All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE :

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Title: Data Scientist NLP
Description:
CM wilt een vooraanstaande rol spelen in de digitalisatie en het gebruiken van AI & analytics om haar dienstverlening te optimaliseren. In een veranderende omgeving, waar de diensten van onze groep diverser zijn en digitalisatie noodzakelijk is, wil CM haar data optimaal gebruiken om persoonlijker te worden. AI en data op mensenmaat, dat is ons motto!




Daarom zijn wij een nieuwe directie gestart, het DACE departement, waarbij data, digitalisatie en ICT samenkomen als ontmoetingsplaats voor de creatie van nieuwe ideeën.




Dit zoeken we




Binnen het Data Science team zoeken we een collega gespecialiseerd in Natural Language Processing (NLP).

Je hebt ervaring met het analyseren en verwerken van grote volumes ongestructureerde tekstdata aan de hand van moderne NLP technieken, waaronder: Tokenization, Topic modelling, Sentiment analyse, Seq2seq modelling, Entity extraction, Attention mechanism, Transformer architecturen en Word embeddings.

Je hebt ervaring met minstens één ML framework (tensorflow, pytorch, keras, ...) waarbij een of meerdere van bovenstaande technieken werd gebruikt.
Indien je kennis hebt van dialog modelling, conversational AI en ervaring met Cloud platformen is dat een plus.
Je werkt nauw samenwerken met IT om de gemaakte modellen te kunnen industrialiseren.
Je zoekt data buiten de groep en benut deze.




Dit ben jij




Je beschikt over een diploma op masterniveau of gelijkwaardig door ervaring. Bij voorkeur in gezondheidswetenschappen, wiskunde, toegepaste wetenschappen, computerwetenschappen, statistiek of een vergelijkbaar vakgebied.
Je bent in staat om grote datasets met analytische nauwkeurigheid te beheren en te analyseren met behulp van de gebruikelijke toolset van statistische en machine learning-methoden.
Je hebt ervaring in begeleide en niet-begeleide leeralgoritmes en -strategieën voor gegevensverwerking, data/textmining, en je kan deze implementeren in de bedrijfscontext.
Je werkt enkele jaren (minstens 3-5jr) in een Data Science stack zoals Python op Jupyter Notebooks met Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, …
Verschillende vormen van data ondervragen is voor jou een klein kunstje: SQL, OLAP, JSON en XML
Je kan vlot werken met tools zoals Tensorflow en Keras.
Je bent sterk in verkennende analyse, het vinden en communiceren van verhalen uit de data.
Kennis van data visualisatietools zoals BO, Qlikview, D3.js of Bokeh ondersteunen de storytelling.
Je hebt een actieve kennis van zowel Nederlands en Frans.
Je bent bereid je 1 dag per week naar Brussel te verplaatsen.




Dit bieden we je




We bieden jou een voltijds contract onbepaalde duur.

Bij CM heeft je werk een belangrijke maatschappelijke impact. Je maakt immers dagelijks het verschil voor onze leden. Zo kan je rekenen op een competitief en veelzijdig loonpakket. Bovendien krijg je de kans om werk en privé mooi in evenwicht te houden. Maar er is meer. Want wie dat wil, kan hier heel wat kansen grijpen. We bieden je tal van opleidingen en ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden. Je krijgt de ruimte om initiatieven te nemen. En je werkt mee aan uitdagende projecten. Wees er maar zeker van dat je nooit ter plaatse zult blijven trappelen. Zodat je als CM-collega al snel maar één conclusie zal kunnen trekken: Bij ons leeft het.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Remote)
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer (Remote)




Overview:

🚀 Step into the vanguard of the AI revolution!




Our commitment to a decentralized, open-source AI ethos empowers developers to forge scalable, trustworthy solutions that shape tomorrow.




Your Role:

👨‍💻 As a Machine Learning Engineer, immerse yourself in the realm of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Large Language Models (LLMs).




From refining OSS language models to orchestrating dataset preparation and deployment on cutting-edge NLP pipelines, your canvas is cloud infrastructure.




What We Value:

💡 Bring your expertise in machine learning, NLP, and deep learning to our table.




Command of PyTorch, proficiency in large-scale dataset processing, and fluency in Python are essential. Extra points for cloud computing acumen (AWS, GCP), Docker skills, and familiarity with platforms like Weight & Biases and VectorDB.




Why Join Us?




🌈 We're not just a workplace; we're a community of visionaries united by AI's transformative potential. From our mission-driven purpose to our collaborative culture and remote-friendly environment, we offer more than a job—we offer an odyssey of innovation.




Ready to Redefine AI? 🌟 Join us and become part of a ground-breaking journey!

Title: Machine Learning Specialist
Description:
Platform Manager and Senior Machine Learning Specialist




About the Client: Our client is an Italian company with an international presence, offering superior performance in short-term and day-ahead renewable power forecasting through their ML-empowered SaaS platform. They focus on delivering innovative, AI and data-driven solutions to the renewable forecasting industry.




Ideal Candidate Profile: The client seeks a highly skilled Platform Manager and Senior Machine Learning Specialist to lead their data platform. The ideal candidate will possess strong machine learning engineering skills, cloud infrastructure experience, and the ability to develop scalable solutions. This role also involves coordinating a team of developers and technical partners to achieve strategic objectives.




Primary Responsibilities:

Take full ownership of the cloud platform, ensuring routine maintenance, upgrades, and proactively addressing any issues.
Design, develop, and maintain highly scalable cloud solutions on Microsoft Azure.
Oversee and manage the cloud-based data platform, ensuring reliability, scalability, and performance.
Manage and optimize Kubernetes clusters for containerized applications.
Implement and maintain complex workflow orchestration.
Develop and maintain PostgreSQL databases and data storage solutions.
Maintain and improve MLOps procedures and CI/CD pipelines to ensure reliable and efficient production systems.
Develop and maintain APIs to facilitate seamless integrations.
Lead the implementation of new ML or business functionalities.
Lead a team of developers and technical partners, providing guidance, mentorship, and support.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into the SaaS platform.
Ensure best practices in data engineering, model deployment, and infrastructure management.
Provide technical direction for an ML/FS development team.




Required Qualifications and Skills:

Proven experience in machine learning engineering and cloud infrastructure management.
3-5 years of relevant experience.
Expertise in the ML/AI field, specifically within the Python stack.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.
Ability to design and develop scalable data solutions.
Excellent leadership and team coordination skills.
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Experience managing and optimizing Kubernetes clusters.
Proficiency in developing and maintaining PostgreSQL databases.
Expertise in maintaining and improving MLOps procedures and CI/CD pipelines.
Ability to develop and maintain APIs for seamless integrations.
Effective communication skills in English; knowledge of Italian is a plus.




Benefits Include:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Inclusion in the Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP).
Opportunities to work with advanced technologies in the renewable energy field.
A collaborative and innovative work culture.
Potential for career growth and professional development.
Flexible working arrangements (locations include Italy, Tallinn - Estonia, and Remote options).




Join the Team: If you are passionate about machine learning and cloud technologies and aspire to make a significant impact in the renewable energy industry, apply now to be part of this dynamic team.

Title: Data scientist - Brussels - On site
Description:
We are on the lookout for a/an Data scientist to join our team for working with European Institutions based in Bruselles in an On site position.

Get to know us - SEIDOR

At SEIDOR, we drive client transformation and competitiveness with cutting-edge technology and innovation , with a relentless focus on the human element and a commitment to nurturing talent and sustainable growth.

As a diverse and inclusive company that champions equal opportunity, we boast a team of over 8,000 professionals in our global presence across 45 countries in Europe, Latin America, the USA, the Middle East, Africa, and Asia.

We believe the digital world's challenges require not only the best technologies and partnerships but most importantly, the best people. That's where you come in – we need you to help us scale new heights.

For this position you would be working with our client from the European institutions.

Below are the details of your role and requirements.

Your role


Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solutions.
Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience.
Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL).
Produces data models according to specific problems statements.
Scripting and programming.
Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc…).
Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.



What’s in it for you?

From day one, you’ll find opportunities for personal and professional development within a supportive team environment. We offer:


A permanent role at a leading tech project firm (subcontractor also possible).
A hybrid work schedule, blending in-office collaboration with the convenience of working from home.
Continuous learning and development through SEIDOR Academy.
A package including salary and additional annual bonus, working equipment, phone and other benefits.
A dynamic international workplace with diverse teams.
A commitment to your well-being, work-life balance, and career growth.
Rapid advancement opportunities in a short period of time.
Engaging events and a comprehensive onboarding program.



At SEIDOR, your growth is our success, and we strive to make our workplace feel like home. Discover the nine core aspects of our culture that define us at SEIDOR:

https://www.seidor.com/en-es/talent

If this resonates with you, we'd love for you to apply to our opening, and we'll be in touch soon!

Requirements:

Who We Think You Are


Very good knowledge of the involved Mathematics and Statistics (Linear algebra, Calculus, Probability theory, Statistics, hypothesis testing, Optimization techniques, etc.).
Very good knowledge of programming in Python and/or R.
Very good experience with data manipulation: Analysis techniques, ability to clean, pre-process, and transform data.
Very good experience with data visualization using tools like Matplotlib, etc.
Very good knowledge of ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and techniques.
Hands-on experience with various machine learning algorithms, including supervised, unsupervised,and reinforcement learning.
Experience with model evaluation, selection and validation techniques.
Knowledge of deep learning and neural networks.
Experience with RDBMS like Oracle (latest version).
Understanding of NoSQL databases like MongoDB or Cassandra.
Knowledge of NLP techniques and libraries like NLTK, spaCy, or Transformers.
Awareness of involved ethical considerations in data collection and analysis.
Knowledge of applicable data privacy laws and regulations.
Ability to give business and technical presentations.
Ability to apply high quality standards.
Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in the domain of Data Science.
Good communication skills with technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to convey complex findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Storytelling with data: Presenting insights in a compelling and understandable way.
Analysis and problem-solving skills.
Capability to write clear and structured documents/reports.
Very good knowledge of English (both written and oral).
