Title: Data Scientist - Real World Evidence - Europe
Description:
Luminary Group is partnering with a leading life science company in their search for a talented and experienced Data Scientist with expertise in Real-World Evidence (RWE). As a Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting real-world data to generate valuable insights and support evidence-based decision making in the healthcare industry.

Responsibilities:


Identify and define analytical problems related to real-world evidence (RWE) and develop appropriate data-driven solutions
Design and implement data mining and statistical modeling techniques to analyze complex RWE datasets
Preprocess and clean large-scale real-world data to ensure quality and integrity
Apply machine learning algorithms and techniques to extract meaningful patterns and insights
Develop predictive models to forecast outcomes and trends based on real-world data
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to interpret and communicate analysis findings to stakeholders
Stay up-to-date with the latest research and advancements in data science and real-world evidence
Implement data visualization techniques to effectively communicate analysis results
Participate in the development of data-driven products and solutions for the healthcare industry



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in data science, computer science, statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred
Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist, preferably with a focus on real-world evidence (RWE) and the healthcare industry
Strong knowledge of data mining, statistical modeling, and machine learning algorithms
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation and analysis
Experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau or Power BI
Solid understanding of database systems and SQL for data querying and manipulation
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to find insights in complex datasets
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment
Experience with healthcare data and familiarization with healthcare data standards is a plus
Understanding of regulatory requirements and ethics related to data analysis in healthcare

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in the energy sector with a presence across the spectrum: from oil through to power, renewables and carbon. From 40 offices worldwide, we seek to add value across the energy supply chain, including deploying our scale and market understanding to help facilitate the energy transition. To date, we have committed over $2 billion of capital to renewable projects, and are identifying and developing low-carbon opportunities around the world.

Our people are our business. Talent is precious to us and we create an environment in which individuals can reach their full potential, unhindered by hierarchy. Our team comprises more than 65 nationalities and we are committed to developing and sustaining a diverse work force. Learn more about us here.

Job Description

The Data Scientist at Vitol has impact across the full workflow of data science: from working with business stakeholders to help define the project, to data collation and processing, exploratory analysis, model selection and tuning, and implementation of production models or custom visualizations. We extract value from data in many different ways, and experience exploring and extracting insights from data is just as important as the ability to build complex models. When driving business outcomes with data, a good visualization is often just as important as a small MAE. The data we work with is often complex and messy, and a successful Data Scientist at Vitol is always willing to roll up their sleeves and delve into the data in order to achieve results.

The data scientist will regularly engage directly with traders, brokers, analysts, and researchers across nearly all aspects of Vitol in order to understand the data that goes into internal models and the business problems that need to be solved, but the day to day collaboration will be within the small and highly agile Data Science team.

Responsibilities include:


Being an energetic and enthusiastic member of a team uniquely positioned to bring the power of data to bear on the inner workings of the energy industry
Exploring new datasets, extracting insights, and visualizing the results
Standardizing and structuring data in clear, extensible, easily understandable ways
Applying machine learning models in novel ways to heterogeneous data sets to help optimize Vitol’s diverse businesses
Helping review the code and experimental design of other Data Scientists to ensure a high level of production quality
Building data expertise with domain experts in specific aspects of Vitol’s operations
Aiding in the implementation of the above models and custom visualizations to help drive business value


Qualifications

Essential Qualifications


Degree in a STEM subject with a solid understanding of coding best practices
3-5+ years in industry working as a data scientist with machine learning models applied to real-world data
Extensive experience presenting complex data visually to a wide audience (plotly, bokeh, etc.)
Extensive experience exploring and extracting insights from heterogeneous multi-dimensional data sets
Fluency in Python (3) with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code in a collaborative development setting
Advanced coursework in math, statistics, and machine learning preferred
Demonstrable attention to detail


Desired Experience


Time series modelling (both machine-learning and econometric approaches)
Application of a wide range of machine learning methodologies to real life applications
Enterprise software development (code design, code review, version control, etc.)
Cloud-based data science workflows (esp. AWS) and understanding of AWS services
Experience in building ETL pipelines in Python and on AWS
Awareness of continuous integration and delivery concepts/technologies
Experience with MLOps, NLP and deep-learning are considered a plus


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


A self-motivated individual who thrives on seeing the results of their work make an impact in the business
Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing - passionate about using data to help tell a story
A keen sense for the art of the possible
Proven ability to be flexible and work hard, both independently collaboratively
Methodical and organized - in general, in experimental design, and in code!
Attention to detail with strong analytical, mathematical, and problem-solving skills
An interest in learning about the commodities space
Resourceful and able to think creatively and adapt in a dynamic and energetic environment
Team player, with an open non-political style and a high level of personal integrity
Desire to be a thought-partner in a fast-growing team, and make an impact at a business that sits at the heart of the world’s energy flows


What We Offer


Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Close collaboration with various business units across our key regions (eg. London, Singapore, Houston, Geneva)
A highly motivated DS team comprised of experienced individuals with a supportive attitude and great team spirit
Being part of the energy transition through increased emphasis on renewable & alternative energy sources at a pivotal moment in the industry
Strong management commitment to incorporating data science into the future of Vitol’s operations
Show more

Title: Data Scientist, Energy Analytics
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Master's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a PhD degree.


Preferred qualifications:


PhD in Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field.
5 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a PhD degree.
Experience in working or internship as an energy analyst, trader, system operator, etc., including experience applying advanced analytics to energy systems’ planning, control and learning problems within universities, national labs, electric utility companies.
Experience with the energy system data.
Experience with optimization (e.g., cvx, Gurobi), statistical (e.g., R, Python) software, and database languages (e.g., SQL).


About The Job

At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. Data Scientists work all across the organization to help shape Google's business and technical strategies by processing, analyzing, interpreting huge data sets, as well as coming up with new algorithmic and statistical approaches that improve performance and efficiency of Google-wide systems.

As an energy analyst, you will collaborate with Google’s Climate Operations team, Energy and Policy Strategists, Engineers and Product Managers to adjust Google's energy systems and practices based on your findings. You will apply an understanding of energy systems and market dynamics, optimization and statistical knowledge, as well as the coding experience, to develop methods to solve and assess the cutting edge problems related to carbon and efficiency aware compute shifting, grid integration, energy asset forecasting and scalable control. You will work broadly with different energy stakeholders across the organization and drive innovation of our energy systems stack, while improving its efficiency and global environmental impact.

As an Energy Analytics Data Scientist, you will think critically and strategically about Google’s fleet-wide energy assets, cloud as a technology, business and its operation, while thinking about its impact on the environment as a whole.

Responsibilities


Lead projects with energy system, market analysis and carbon impact analysis, modeling and optimization, drawing from multiple problem solving methods and energy domain expertise to choose the right tool and right level of complexity appropriate for the business challenges.
Engage broadly with the organization to identify, prioritize, frame, and structure complex and ambiguous challenges arising in the energy domain, where advanced analytics projects or tools can have the high impact.
Identify and communicate the challenges and opportunities that the group should be working on.
Articulate business questions and use mathematical techniques to arrive at an answer using data. Translate analysis results into business recommendations.
Help define the problem solving direction and influence the direction of the associated engineering and infrastructure work.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Show more
HTML:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a PhD degree.

Preferred qualifications:

  • PhD in Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • 5 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a PhD degree.
  • Experience in working or internship as an energy analyst, trader, system operator, etc., including experience applying advanced analytics to energy systems’ planning, control and learning problems within universities, national labs, electric utility companies.
  • Experience with the energy system data.
  • Experience with optimization (e.g., cvx, Gurobi), statistical (e.g., R, Python) software, and database languages (e.g., SQL).

About The Job

At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. Data Scientists work all across the organization to help shape Google's business and technical strategies by processing, analyzing, interpreting huge data sets, as well as coming up with new algorithmic and statistical approaches that improve performance and efficiency of Google-wide systems.

As an energy analyst, you will collaborate with Google’s Climate Operations team, Energy and Policy Strategists, Engineers and Product Managers to adjust Google's energy systems and practices based on your findings. You will apply an understanding of energy systems and market dynamics, optimization and statistical knowledge, as well as the coding experience, to develop methods to solve and assess the cutting edge problems related to carbon and efficiency aware compute shifting, grid integration, energy asset forecasting and scalable control. You will work broadly with different energy stakeholders across the organization and drive innovation of our energy systems stack, while improving its efficiency and global environmental impact.

As an Energy Analytics Data Scientist, you will think critically and strategically about Google’s fleet-wide energy assets, cloud as a technology, business and its operation, while thinking about its impact on the environment as a whole.

Responsibilities

  • Lead projects with energy system, market analysis and carbon impact analysis, modeling and optimization, drawing from multiple problem solving methods and energy domain expertise to choose the right tool and right level of complexity appropriate for the business challenges.
  • Engage broadly with the organization to identify, prioritize, frame, and structure complex and ambiguous challenges arising in the energy domain, where advanced analytics projects or tools can have the high impact.
  • Identify and communicate the challenges and opportunities that the group should be working on.
  • Articulate business questions and use mathematical techniques to arrive at an answer using data. Translate analysis results into business recommendations.
  • Help define the problem solving direction and influence the direction of the associated engineering and infrastructure work.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. Title: Data Scientist / Optimization Specialist
Description:
We are seeking a Data Scientist / Optimization Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will be an expert in optimization/operational-research and high-performance, with the ability to address complex business problems using mathematical optimization or machine learning techniques. They will play a crucial role in translating business challenges into mathematical optimization problems and then developing innovative computational solutions. We expect you to be autonomous and able to learn (methodologies, technologies, domains) and adapt to a fast-moving environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Identify and articulate business problems that can be addressed through optimization, by collaborating with cross-functional teams.
Develop and implement mathematical models to optimize business processes and decision-making.
Develop and implement computational efficient solutions.
When necessary, utilize high-performance computing infrastructures to analyze and solve optimization problems efficiently.
While not mandatory, familiarity with quantum computing is a plus, as the candidate should be capable of understanding and modeling problems in a compatible "canonic" form – to make the solutions quantum ready, when relevant.
While not mandatory, experience in insurance and/or financial services (on topics such as advanced pricing, underwriting, reserving, or reinsurance) will be considered highly valuable.







Qualifications:

Advanced degree in optimization, operational-research, mathematics, computer science, or a related field OR an actuarial degree.
Proven experience in applying optimization and operational research techniques to real-world business challenges.
Proficiency in programming languages such as C, C++ or Cuda, but also Python.
Flexibility and Growth Mindset: We are seeking individuals who thrive in a dynamic and evolving environment, where learning and embracing new challenges are essential. The ideal candidates should demonstrate a strong willingness to continuously expand their knowledge, adapt to new technologies, and take on diverse and evolving responsibilities.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Languages: English (mandatory) and French (appreciated).

Title: Data Scientist (80-100%)
Description:
University Digestive Health Care Center - Clarunis, Basel, Switzerland is the joint competence centre of Claraspital and Basel University Hospital for all patients in need of abdominal treatment. Clarunis combines the specialist knowledge, research activities and number of patients treated of both hospitals to furtherincrease and enhance the quality of diagnosis and treatment.

The Digital Surgery Lab ( https://digitalsurgerylab.ch ), based at the Department of Biomedical Engineering, University of Basel aims to revolutionize surgery and improve patient outcomes through digitalization and application of Artificial Intelligence.

To foster the project Data-Driven Surgery and coordinate the Surgical AI platform on behalf of the Department of Surgery at University Hospital Basel, we are hiring a

Data Scientist (80-100%) .

Data Scientist (80-100%)

Your positionTranslational teamwork with clinicians, computer scientists, and biomedical engineersManage the development of a data platform (Surgical AI platform) with external suppliersEstablish pipelines for data capturing, storing and archivingAnalysis of surgical datasets (image, video, audio, text) using deep learning

Your profilePhD in computer science or biomedical engineeringProject management skills and experienceA strong background in network architecture and machine/deep learningProficient in python programming and familiar with deep learning libraries (PyTorch, Tensorflow)

We offer youA challenging task in an interdisciplinary academic environmentA competitive salaryGenerous social benefitsOpportunities for academic and entrepreneurial career developmentCareer mentorship

Application / Contact

If you are interested, and ready to accept the challenge, we are looking forward to your online application.

For more information, please contact Dr. Joël Lavanchy, group leader and attending surgeon ( joel.lavanchy@clarunis.ch ).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist




Are you an experienced Data Scientist with at least fours years of experience as well as a strong educational background in mathematics, computer science, economics, or statistics? Along with demonstrated expertise in machine and deep learning, and proficiency in training, evaluating, and deploying neural networks across. Additionally, a solid background in NLP, LLM, and SQL databases, and experience in large vision models and graph neural networks. Then this could be your chance!




You will design and develop complete end-to-end machine learning pipelines for analytics use cases, utilizing large language models. Conduct feasibility studies to create, analyze, and implement innovative algorithms. Collaborate with other machine learning professionals and engage with stakeholders across various divisions.




You will be joining a professional and dynamic work environment where you will have the chance to further develop your skills. The role requires a proficient level of spoken and written German and English skills with the team members and stakeholders.




For more information on this Data Scientist position or any other Data positions we have available, send your CV to daniel.imre@nicollcurtin.com or you can call me at +41 43 215 45 15

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist m/w/d

80-100%,, Aarau

12.08.2024 - 31.12.2024 (mit der Option auf Verlängerung)




Für unseren Kunden, ein grosser Dienstleister aus der Energiebranche in Aarau, suchen wir eine:n motivierte:n Data Analyst/Business Intelligence Analyst




Ihre Aufgaben:

Identifizierung und Ableitung von Massnahmen zum Event-Tuning mit dem Ziel, die Eventqualität zu verbessern:

Analyse der auftretenden Monitoring-Events durchführen
Optimierungspotential zusammen mit den Stakeholdern identifizieren
Massnahmen zur Optimierung einleiten und deren Fortschritt überwachen
Erstellen von Management-Reports und – Auswertungen über Anzahl der Events und Häufigkeit des Auftretens einzelner Events
Erstellung von Checklisten
Reduktion der Anzahl der Events (GAP-Analyse durchführen, Review von Wissensartikeln und Durchführung von QS-Massnahmen)
Erstellen von Management-Reports mithilfe von Excel, und/oder PowerBI
Entwicklung und Unterstützung von Prozessen für das Event-Tuning, das Performance-Management und für das Capacity Management (Analyse der IST-Prozesse; Definieren von SOLL-Prozessen; Abstimmen der SOLL-Prozesse mit Stakeholdern)
Weiterentwicklung und Unterstützung beim Auf- und Ausbau der Performance und Capacity Tätigkeiten für die IT-Basisinfrastruktur(Analyse der IST-Situation; Definieren des Zielzustandes; Identifikation der Abweichungen (GAP-Analyse); Massnahmen einleiten und deren Fortschritt überwachen)

Ihr Profil:

Abgeschlossene Berufslehre im Bereich Informatik und/oder einen Abschluss an einer höheren Fachschule, einer Fachhochschule oder eine äquivalente Ausbildung
Mehrere Jahre praktische Erfahrung im operativen Betrieb von IT-Systemen und der Bearbeitung von Events und Incident
Gute bis sehr gute Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Event Management, Performance Management und Capacity Management
Analytische Fähigkeiten und rasche Auffassungsgabe, um Problemstellungen zu lösen
Teamplayer, offene Persönlichkeit
Kenntnisse in Excel, Kenntnisse in PowerBI und Prozessmodellierung mit BPMN von Vorteil
Deutsch fliessend, Englisch verhandlungssicher

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
As Google Cloud's premier partner in AI, Datatonic provides world-class businesses with cutting-edge data solutions in the cloud.

We help clients take leading technology to the limits by combining our expertise in machine learning, data engineering, and analytics. With Google Cloud as our foundation, we help businesses future-proof their solutions, deepen their understanding of consumers, increase competitive advantage and unlock operational efficiencies.

Our team consists of experts in machine learning, data science, software engineering, mathematics, and design. We share a passion for data & analysis, operate at the cutting edge, and believe in a pragmatic approach to solving hard problems.

THE ROLE

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll know how to engineer beautiful code in Python and take pride in what you produce. You'll be an advocate of high-quality engineering and best-practice in production software as well as rapid prototypes.

Whilst the position is a hands-on technical role, we'd be particularly interested to find candidates with a desire to lead projects and take an active role in leading client discussions. Your responsibilities will involve building trusted relationships with prospects, finding creative ways to use machine learning to solve problems, scoping projects, and overseeing the delivery of these engagements.

To be successful, you will need strong ML & Data Science fundamentals and will know the right tools and approach for each ML use case. You'll be comfortable with model optimisation and deployment tools and practices. Furthermore, you'll also need excellent communication and consulting skills, with the desire to meet real business needs and deliver innovative solutions using AI & Cloud.

Your responsibilities will include:


Taking vague requirements and translating them into models that solve real-world problems
Running machine learning experiments using a programming language with machine learning libraries.
Optimising solutions for performance and scalability.
Implementing custom machine learning code.
Data engineering, i.e. ensuring a good data flow between database and backend systems.
Data science, i.e. analysing data and coming up with use cases
MLOps, i.e. automating ML workflows with testing, reproducibility and metadata/feature storage; Designing ML architectures on Google Cloud


Requirements


1-3 years experience as an ML Engineer, ideally from a consulting background.
This candidate should be comfortable working with python as a backend language, delivering code in well-tested CI/CD pipelines.
Familiarity with cloud environments (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Experience with Software Engineering.
Good knowledge of SQL.
Knowledge of scaling up computations (GPUs, distributed computing, ..).
Familiarity exposing ML components through web services or wrappers (e.g. Flask in Python).
Strong communication and presentation skills.


Datatonic is an equal-opportunity employer. We're committed to building an inclusive team that welcomes a diversity of perspectives, people, and backgrounds regardless of race, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, disability, citizenship, veteran status, or any other protected status. Our current team is made up of folks from very different backgrounds, including a former librarian, oceanographer and comic bookstore owner! If you are on the fence about whether you meet our requirements, we encourage you to apply anyway. Please reach out to us directly at join@datatonic.com if you need assistance or accommodation due to disability.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
📢 Notre mission :




Ivy Partners est une société de conseil Suisse qui contribue à l’évolution des entreprises dans leurs enjeux stratégiques, technologiques et organisationnels.

Notre objectif aujourd’hui est d’offrir à nos collaborateurs une carrière qui contribuera positivement à leur épanouissement et à leur bien-être, en les faisant monter en compétences et en leur offrant de réelles perspectives d’évolution.







👩‍💻🧑‍💻 En tant que Data Scientist chez Ivy Partners, vous serez en charge de :




Analyser les demandes métiers et les convertir en cas d’usage data science
Définir et construire les solutions correspondant aux besoins.
Travailler en collaboration avec différents intervenants.
Identifier, modéliser et développer des projets de bout en bout.
Déployer, maintenir et améliorer les solutions.










🏅 À propos de vous !




Vous êtes notre petite pépite si techniquement :




Vous avez au moins 6 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist sur l’analyse de documents dans un but de classification.
Expertise en fouille de données à l'aide d'outils statistiques type SAS ou R.
Vous maitrisez Python.
Vous avez des connaissances en Machine learning, Deep learning, computer vision et OCR.
Expertise sur les bases de données NOSQL et MongoDB.
Vous aimez industrialiser et valoriser le résultat de votre travail.
Vous avez évolué dans un environnement agile, notamment Scrum et Safe.







Et si humainement :




Vous êtes organisé.e, rigoureux/se, autonome et avez un bon esprit d’équipe.
Vous êtes force de proposition pour des nouveautés et du changement.
Vous êtes à l’aise avec différents interlocuteurs et savez vulgariser.










🤝 Ivy Partners, c’est aussi :




La bienveillance | Soucieux de nos employés, nous leur garantissons un environnement favorable où chacun est valorisé et se voit offrir des formations et des perspectives d’évolution en Suisse ou à l’international.

La confiance | Travailler avec nous, c’est développer un partenariat fondé sur la confiance, le professionnalisme et la transparence à chaque instant.

L’innovation | Nous garantissons une transformation numérique efficace grâce à l’innovation technologique couplée à la créativité.

La responsabilité | Le collectif est à la base de tout ce que nous entreprenons, et nous prenons cette responsabilité au sérieux en mettant tout en œuvre pour avoir un impact positif.







🚀 Rejoindre Ivy, c’est prendre part à une aventure stimulante à chaque instant ! Merci d’envisager de nous rejoindre, nous sommes impatients d’en savoir plus sur vous !

Title: AI Engineer (LLM) (100% remote - Europe)
Description:
At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.

Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in AI, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D.
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python, C++, JavaScript or similar.

Title: Data Scientist (f/m)
Description:
Galenica AG

What You Can Do


Data: Work hands-on with different data sets to generate insights in early project state and shape data products with your passion to drive the business forward
Machine Learning: You are experienced enough to decide about the suitable analysis and can apply the appropriate machine learning solutions to various problems
Business Insight: Work in close partnership with internal teams, bridging the gap between advanced data analysis and business functions
Agile Methodology: Adapt and contribute to the agile development process, responding flexibly to changing project requirements and priorities
Knowledge Sharing: Stay abreast of the latest in developments in machine learning and share insights with the team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement


What You Have To Offer


Master's degree or PhD in economics, business informatics, computer science, engineering, or similar aswell as proven track record in advanced analytics and machine learning, preferably in the Swiss healthcare sector
Excellent analytical, conceptual and problem-solving skills in addition with advanced knowledge of statistical methods, data modeling and working with databases;experience with Neural Networks is a plus
You are fluent in Python and SQL, other scripting languages (e.g. R) and business intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI); experience with Cloud environments, especially Microsoft Azure, is an advantage
A team player with excellent communication skills, committed to contributing positively to our team's dynamics and project success
An adaptable and agile mindset, ready to contribute to evolving project needs and changing focus areas
Language proficiency in German or French, in addition to fluency in English, to ensure seamless communication within our diverse team.


As Data Scientist you tackle challenging problems to generate impact for Galenica through data & AI.

Contact

Your application will be processed by:

Galenica AG, Human Resources

Caroline Metzger

Specialist Recruiting

Tel. +41 58 851 94 22

For technical information, please contact:

Title: Data Scientist / Large Language Model (LLM) Specialist
Description:
We are in search of a talented researcher/machine learning specialist to join our team as a Data Scientist with a focus on Large Language Models (LLM). The ideal candidate will possess a high level of proficiency in data science and demonstrate a strong emphasis on leveraging large language models. This person should have a deep technical understanding of machine learning, complemented by solid programming skills. We expect you to be autonomous and able to learn. Be ready to regularly learn new things (methodologies, technologies, domains) and adapt to a fast-moving environment.







Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement cutting-edge machine learning algorithms and models, with a specific emphasis on large language models incl. agents, fine-tuning, new transformers-based architectures.
Stay updated and share advancement on the state of the art.
Participate in local academic partnerships, and ideally develop and drive them.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to (a) share expertise and advice, and (b) implement some of the advanced solutions developed to solve complex business challenges.
More generally, contribute to the innovation and advancement of machine learning capabilities within the organization.
While not mandatory, experience in insurance and/or financial services will be considered a valuable asset.







Qualifications:

A solid background as a researcher and/or data scientist, or a strong interest in technical excellence and machine learning innovation.
In-depth knowledge of machine learning, deep learning and data science is mandatory. In-depth knowledge of natural language processing and in particular large language models is highly appreciated.
Exposure to the LLM’s ecosystem and associated frameworks.
Proficiency of Python, Jupyter Notebook and popular neural network frameworks (Tensorflow and/or PyTorch), along with a good understanding of software engineering principles.
Experience in training Machine Learning models on large data sets.
Open to continuous improvement of Data Science skills: we are seeking individuals who thrive in a dynamic and evolving environment, where learning and embracing new challenges are essential. The ideal candidates should demonstrate a strong willingness to continuously expand their knowledge, adapt to new technologies, and take on diverse and evolving responsibilities.
Team player, fruitful interactions with the other team members and external stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Languages: English (mandatory) and French (appreciated).

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
What We Offer


Interact with our clients on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
Work in multidisciplinary teams and learn from motivated colleagues.
A chance to take responsibility for your work, develop yourself every day and take full ownership of your career.
Become part of a fast growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Perform data analysis in the field of customer and product analytics, marketing analytics, and (Gen)AI solutions.
Conduct analyses in typical analytical tools ranging from SAS, SPSS, Eviews, R, Python, SQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Access, Excel, etc.
Communicate analyses via compelling presentations.
Solve problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses and develop actionable recommendations from data and analysis.
Prepare and facilitating workshops.
Manage stakeholders and communicating with executives.



What You’ll Bring


Bachelor or Master (or Ph.D.) degree in a quantitative field with a focus on data analysis (e.g. econometrics, AI, mathematics, physics, and other exact sciences).
0-3 years of professional experience in the analytics domain.
Good knowledge of statistical concepts, accompanied by expertise with a set of analytical tools ranging from databases (e.g. SQL, BigQuery, noSQL) to programming languages (e.g. R, Python), and from data visualization (e.g. PowerBI) to machine learning and AI.
Understanding data engineering solutions is a plus.
Good knowledge of Git & Docker.
Professional fluency in English required with (Swiss) German as a strong plus.



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - R Programmer - 5967 URA
Description:
SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST R PROGRAMMER – 5967 URA

Our client, an innovative and dynamic bio-pharmaceutical company headquartered in Switzerland, covering multiple therapeutic areas, committed into delivering products on the market over the next 5 years, is looking a SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST R- Programmer for a 12 months contract (extendable) based in Basel.




Main Responsibilities:

Support statistics, programming and data management groups across Biometry to explore, review, understand and explain clinical data.
Oversee the creation of customized applications to allow dynamic exploration of clinical trial data and results at critical study milestones (especially following major database locks).
Use and promote reproducible research methods to ensure reports may be refreshed efficiently as data is updated.
Communicate results and educate others through insightful visualizations, reports, publications and presentations.
Create outputs that may be used for publication, regulatory submissions, internal decision-making, market tracking, or other uses.
Support statisticians with ad-hoc exploratory analyses following key database locks.
Champion new ways of working with and presenting clinical data and develop educational material to lead the adoption of these methods across Biometry.
Support data-monitoring initiatives including risk-based monitoring by preparing & sharing outputs /reports to Clinical Trial Teams.
Utilize a diverse array of data mining, analytics and modeling techniques to generate and test working hypotheses, deliver insights and support actionable recommendations to Clinical Teams.
Proactively search for trends in clinical data of ongoing studies, including deviations from assumptions.
Lead development of in-house R packages.
Monitor trends in usage of new technologies across the industry with a critical eye.
Contribute/review new standards, policies, templates and procedures.
Ensure processes are followed as defined in quality documents.
Ensure standards for documents, metadata and data are created, maintained and applied.




Qualifications and Experience:

Relevant Swiss working/residency permit and/or Swiss/EU-Citizenship required;
Master’s degree in the field of computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, with at least 5 years of relevant programming experience, of which at least 3 within a pharmaceutical company or a clinical research organization (CRO).
Experience extracting, cleaning, preparing, modeling and visualizing data; advanced knowledge of one or more statistical programming languages such as R, SAS, Python, Julia;
Advanced knowledge of R packages such as dplyr for data manipulation and ggplot2 for plotting.
Familiar with generation of interactive reports/dashboards, e.g., R Shiny, Dash, Spotfire, Tableau, QlikSense.
Extensive experience with creating reproducible reports through code versioning using RMarkdown or Notebooks.
Excellent knowledge of processes related to statistical analyses in clinical trials.
Knowledge and understanding of CDISC, especially SDTM and ADaM.
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, ability to manage/prioritize multiple projects.
Entrepreneurial mindset and self-direction, ability to spot trends, teach others and willingness to learn new techniques.
Must be able to work according to operating procedures, specifications and timelines.
Knowledge of international clinical research regulations and requirements (ICH-GCP) and 21 CFR Part 11.
Excellent presentation, interpersonal skills, and a positive communication style.

Title: Data Scientist - Market Models (f/m/d)
Description:
Switzerland, Basel

Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

We are looking for a new Data Scientist in the Market Modelling & Planning team to contribute to the development of novel market forecasting models and use them to provide meaningful business insights across all Business Units and functions of the organization (Sales, Marketing, Strategy, M&A…).

In this role you will use your data science and analytics skills to contribute both technically and conceptually to the development of our market forecasting models.

With your business acumen, strategy and communication skills, you’ll provide Business Units managers and directors with insights you’ll build through quantitative analysis.

You’ll act as a thought partner with the Head of Market Modelling & Planning to identify and take an active role in developing new modelling applications, enhance the analytical culture of the company and help shaping the strategic vision of the company.

If you have an unquenchable curiosity for insight hidden in data, if you’re not afraid of facing and solving open problems, if you have the desire to make a difference in a large company with analytics… we want to hear from you!

This Is What Should Be In Your Resume


3+ years practical experience in data or statistical analysis
Excellent communication capabilities (business writing, storytelling, presentations to individuals outside of your expertise field)
Proficient with Python, Numpy, Pandas
Proficient with standard analytical tools (Excel, SQL…)
Fluency in English (additional languages are a plus)
Experience in software development is a strong plus
Experience in data visualization tools is a plus


But This Is What Will Really Matter


Passion for problem solving and analytics
Curious and proactive when dealing with data
Structured strategic mindset, looking for the “big picture”
Ready to embrace complexity, face uncertainty and remove down-to-earth obstacles one by one
Not afraid of Python
Always eager to learn and grow. And teach your manager.


Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Reference: R61503

Apply

Title: Data Scientist, Energy Analytics
Description:
Minimum Qualifications


Master's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a PhD degree.


Preferred Qualifications


PhD in Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field.
5 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a PhD degree.
Experience in working or internship as an energy analyst, trader, system operator, etc., including experience applying advanced analytics to energy systems’ planning, control and learning problems within universities, national labs, electric utility companies.
Experience with the energy system data.
Experience with optimization (e.g., cvx, Gurobi), statistical (e.g., R, Python) software, and database languages (e.g., SQL).


About The Job

At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. Data Scientists work all across the organization to help shape Google's business and technical strategies by processing, analyzing, interpreting huge data sets, as well as coming up with new algorithmic and statistical approaches that improve performance and efficiency of Google-wide systems.

As an energy analyst, you will collaborate with Google’s Climate Operations team, Energy and Policy Strategists, Engineers and Product Managers to adjust Google's energy systems and practices based on your findings. You will apply an understanding of energy systems and market dynamics, optimization and statistical knowledge, as well as the coding experience, to develop methods to solve and assess the cutting edge problems related to carbon and efficiency aware compute shifting, grid integration, energy asset forecasting and scalable control. You will work broadly with different energy stakeholders across the organization and drive innovation of our energy systems stack, while improving its efficiency and global environmental impact.

As an Energy Analytics Data Scientist, you will think critically and strategically about Google’s fleet-wide energy assets, cloud as a technology, business and its operation, while thinking about its impact on the environment as a whole.

Responsibilities


Lead projects with energy system, market analysis and carbon impact analysis, modeling and optimization, drawing from multiple problem solving methods and energy domain expertise to choose the right tool and right level of complexity appropriate for the business challenges.
Engage broadly with the organization to identify, prioritize, frame, and structure complex and ambiguous challenges arising in the energy domain, where advanced analytics projects or tools can have the high impact.
Identify and communicate the challenges and opportunities that the group should be working on.
Articulate business questions and use mathematical techniques to arrive at an answer using data. Translate analysis results into business recommendations.
Help define the problem solving direction and influence the direction of the associated engineering and infrastructure work.


Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google's Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Show more
HTML:
Minimum Qualifications

  • Master's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a PhD degree.

Preferred Qualifications

  • PhD in Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • 5 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a PhD degree.
  • Experience in working or internship as an energy analyst, trader, system operator, etc., including experience applying advanced analytics to energy systems’ planning, control and learning problems within universities, national labs, electric utility companies.
  • Experience with the energy system data.
  • Experience with optimization (e.g., cvx, Gurobi), statistical (e.g., R, Python) software, and database languages (e.g., SQL).

About The Job

At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. Data Scientists work all across the organization to help shape Google's business and technical strategies by processing, analyzing, interpreting huge data sets, as well as coming up with new algorithmic and statistical approaches that improve performance and efficiency of Google-wide systems.

As an energy analyst, you will collaborate with Google’s Climate Operations team, Energy and Policy Strategists, Engineers and Product Managers to adjust Google's energy systems and practices based on your findings. You will apply an understanding of energy systems and market dynamics, optimization and statistical knowledge, as well as the coding experience, to develop methods to solve and assess the cutting edge problems related to carbon and efficiency aware compute shifting, grid integration, energy asset forecasting and scalable control. You will work broadly with different energy stakeholders across the organization and drive innovation of our energy systems stack, while improving its efficiency and global environmental impact.

As an Energy Analytics Data Scientist, you will think critically and strategically about Google’s fleet-wide energy assets, cloud as a technology, business and its operation, while thinking about its impact on the environment as a whole.

Responsibilities

  • Lead projects with energy system, market analysis and carbon impact analysis, modeling and optimization, drawing from multiple problem solving methods and energy domain expertise to choose the right tool and right level of complexity appropriate for the business challenges.
  • Engage broadly with the organization to identify, prioritize, frame, and structure complex and ambiguous challenges arising in the energy domain, where advanced analytics projects or tools can have the high impact.
  • Identify and communicate the challenges and opportunities that the group should be working on.
  • Articulate business questions and use mathematical techniques to arrive at an answer using data. Translate analysis results into business recommendations.
  • Help define the problem solving direction and influence the direction of the associated engineering and infrastructure work.

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Description:
Wir sind ein Team von Experten, die zusammen Software designen und entwickeln, die echten Mehrwert für unsere Kunden schafft. Dabei arbeiten wir mit agilen Entwicklungsmethoden und nutzen die neuesten Technologien.

Bei Netcetera teilen wir unser Fachwissen, fördern den Austausch und schätzen unterschiedliche Denkansätze. Wir glauben fest an die kontinuierliche berufliche Weiterentwicklung und bieten dir spannende Möglichkeiten deine Stärken voll einzubringen und zu wachsen. Denn das Wohlbefinden unserer Mitarbeitenden ist unser höchstes Ziel.

Respekt, Zuverlässigkeit, Engagement und Professionalität - Identifizierst du dich damit? Dann bewerbe dich jetzt und werde Teil unserer Community.

Requirements

Deine Aufgaben


Als erfahrener AI-Engineer entwickelst und führst du Software-Lösungen mit AI (hauptsächlich mit Large Language Models) beim Kunden ein
Du arbeitest im gesamten Software-Lebenszyklus aktiv mit - von der Analyse über Architektur, Umsetzung, Qualitätssicherung bis hin zur Integration und der Produktionsunterstützung
Du erarbeitest zusammen mit unseren Kunden Anforderungen, kalibrierst die Lösung gemeinsam mit dem Kunden und begleitest diesen mit deiner technischen Expertise
Du berätst unsere Kunden mit deinem technischen Wissen, wie Künstliche Intelligenz optimal eingesetzt werden kann
Du stellst mit Reviews und anderen geeigneten Massnahmen sicher, dass die Ergebnisse unsere hohen Qualitätsstandards erfüllen
Du förderst und forderst weniger erfahrene Engineers in deinem Team


Dein Profil


Du bringst praktische Erfahrung als Senior AI-Engineer, insbesondere in der Nutzung von Large Language Models (LLMs) sowie weiteren AI-Technologien und Konzepten mit
Du kommunizierst gerne mit Kunden und deinem Umfeld
Du verfügst über umfangreiche Erfahrung mit den gängigen Softwareentwicklungsmethoden
Geschickt setzt du deine Fach- und Methodenkompetenzen ein, um komplexe Aufgaben zu lösen und übernimmst gerne Verantwortung im Projekt
Du kannst dich auf Deutsch und Englisch spontan und klar in Wort und Schrift ausdrücken (Niveau C1 oder höher)
Du bringst einen Abschluss in Informatik oder einem informatiknahen Studiengang auf mindestens Niveau Bachelor mit


Für diese Vakanz berücksichtigen wir ausschliesslich Direktbewerbungen.

Benefits


Flexibilität: Wir bieten dir flexible Arbeitszeiten, Teilzeitoptionen, Home Office oder auch die Möglichkeit für unbezahlten Urlaub
Extra Urlaubstage: Deine Erholung ist uns wichtig. Bei uns hast du die Möglichkeit, nebst deinen regulären Urlaubstagen, eine zusätzlich bezahlte Urlaubswoche pro Jahr zu aktivieren
Elternurlaub: Wir heissen deinen Nachwuchs herzlich willkommen und unterstützen dich mit verlängertem Mutterschafts- resp. Vaterschaftsurlaub
Pensionskassenbeitrag: Wir bieten attraktive Pensionskassenlösungen in Bezug auf Beträge und Leistungen
Jährliches Ausbildungsbudget: Wir glauben fest an eine kontinuierliche Entwicklung und freuen uns, wenn du dein Wissen erweiterst. Jeder Netceterianer hat ein jährliches Budget, um in seine berufliche und persönliche Entwicklung durch Konferenzen, Kurse, Vorlesungen oder langfristige Weiterbildung zu investieren
Essen & Snacks: Wir beteiligen uns an den Kosten fürs Mittagessen und im Büro stehen dir Snacks und Getränke kostenlos zur Verfügung
Show more

Title: Data Scientist (80-100%)
Description:
Clarunis Universitäres Bauchzentrum Basel ist das gemeinsame Kompetenzzentrum des Claraspitals und des Universitätsspitals Basel für alle Patienten, die auf eine Behandlung im Bauchbereich angewiesen sind. Clarunis vereint das Fachwissen, die Forschungstätigkeit und die Zahl der behandelten Patienten beider Spitäler, um die Qualität der Diagnose und der Behandlung noch weiter zu steigern und zu verbessern.

Clarunis Universitäres Bauchzentrum Basel ist das gemeinsame Kompetenzzentrum des Claraspitals und desUniversitätsspitals Basel für alle Patienten, die auf eine Behandlung im Bauchbereich angewiesen sind.Clarunis vereint das Fachwissen, die Forschungstätigkeit und die Zahl der behandelten Patienten beiderSpitäler, um die Qualität der Diagnose und der Behandlung noch weiter zu steigern und zu verbessern.Das Forschungsgruppe Digital Surgery Lab (https://digitalsurgerylab.ch) am Department of BiomedicalEngineering der Universität Basel hat zum Ziel durch Digitalisierung und Künstliche Intelligenz die Chirurgiezu revolutionieren und die Behandlungsqualität für Patienten zu verbessern.Um das Projekt Data-Driven Surgery voranzubringen und den Aufbau einer Datenplattform (Surgical AIplatform) für das Departement Chirurgie des Universitätsspital Basel zu koordinieren, suchen wir nachVereinbarung eine/nData Scientist




Data Scientist (80-100%)




Ihre Aufgaben sind:

Transdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit mit Klinikern und Ingenieuren
Koordination der Entwicklung der Surgical AI platform mit externen Anbietern
Erstellen von Strukturen zum Erfassen, Aufbewahrung und Archivieren von Daten
Analyse medizinischer Datensätze (Bild, Video, Audio, Text) mittels deep learning




Sie bringen mit:

Doktorat in Computerwissenschaften oder Biomedical Engineering
Projektmanagement Fähigkeiten und Erfahrung
Ein starker Hintergrund in Netzwerkarchitektur und machine/deep learning
Kompetenz im Programmieren in Python und Erfahrung mit gängigen deep learning Bibliotheken (PyTorch, TensorFlow)




Wir bieten:

Eine anspruchsvolle Aufgabe in einem akademischen Umfeld
Zeitgemässe Anstellungsbedingungen
Grosszügige Sozialversicherungsleistungen
Möglichkeit zur akademischen oder unternehmerischen Weiterentwicklung
Mentoring




Fühlen Sie sich angesprochen und sind bereit, diese Herausforderung anzunehmen, dann freuen wir unsauf Ihre Online-Bewerbung an hr@clarunis.ch.




Weitere Auskünfte erteilt Ihnen gerne Dr. Joël Lavanchy, Forschungsgruppenleiter und Oberarzt(joel.lavanchy@clarunis.ch).

Show more

Title: Junior CRM Data Scientist 100%
Description:
Description

Together with CRM Manager, The Junior CRM Data Scientist (CRM & CI Executive) drives CRM strategy & company growth by leveraging full potential of consumer data. Bring analytic and technical expertise to support consumer-centric omnichannel journey in a multi-brand environment. Contribute into building personalized relationships with consumers by providing key data insights and trends, supporting market research initiatives, and enabling relevant personalized and targeted communications.

Responsibilities


Work in partnership with CRM Manager to drive CRM strategy and enable faster and better decision-making process, based on the consumer insights, for a variety of brands
Build consumer data expertise and own data quality, provide inputs and suggestions for data architecture improvements
Master usage of CRM & marketing systems (Braze, CDP, BI & BO) combined with Data Science skills
Generate actionable insights using machine learning models by working with consumer data from multiple data sources
Assist and train internal teams to enable easier and faster usage of available data
Analyze, recommend and create segments for consumer communication throughout different communication channels (e.g. E-mail, direct mail, SMS, paid media, etc.)
Support personalization tactics by developing data scripts for automated marketing campaigns
Gathers and analyzes complex datasets across various platforms to provide key insights on consumer behavior
Produce & deliver CRM KPIs and CRM Campaign reports
Update and maintain existing E-mail Marketing & Triggered Campaigns dashboards
Support smart segmentation through the mix of channels: E-mail, SMS, IAM & Facebook
Support with implementation of AI capabilities developed on CRM Systems


Qualifications


2+ years of experience as a Data Consultant, Consumer Insight Specialist or Business Analyst
University degree in a quantitative field of study e.g. economics, engineering, data science or marketing
Experience in creating CRM reports
Experience in working with Python
Good understanding of data landscapes and data algorithms
Expert proficiency Google Analytics
Excellence in Excel
Experience with integration of data from multiple data sources; ability to investigate and master new data sets quickly
Fluency in English, German is a plus
Strong plus having worked on Data Science projects


Qualifications

What We Offer


The chance to be part of a dedicated, talented, and highly skilled team and bring it to the next level
Lots of opportunities to grow - both personally and professionally
A modern workspace in the city of Zurich, competitive salary as well as very good fringe benefits


If this sounds like an exciting opportunity for you, we are looking forward to receiving your application via our online tool. Please make sure to prepare a CV, a cover letter and hand in your references / diplomas (all documents in PDF format).

Your Recruiting Team

Job: Online / E-Commerce

Primary Location: Europe, Middle East, Africa-CH-ZH-Zurich

Job Type: Standard

Schedule: Full-time

Shift: 1st (Day) Shift

Job Number: 245739

Title: ML Application Engineer
Description:
The ML Application Engineering Team

Our mission is to support our customers in solving their most complex engineering challenges. We collaborate closely with engineering and design teams within the automotive, aerospace and energy industries, understand their challenges and pains, and help them identify solutions to accelerate their conception processes. We leverage our platform, Neural Concept, and its components developed by our software engineers to unlock the value of the most complex Computer-Aided Engineering datasets and to create a direct impact on production design processes. Using 3D deep learning, we empower our customers to develop better products faster.




What you will do

As a key player in the team, your mission will be to establish trust and admiration from our customers by delivering high-quality technical work.




While working towards this goal:

You will run projects together with the customer’s engineering teams, develop tailored solutions and analyse data for each project using Python.
You will apply our deep-learning tools to different engineering/physics problems as well as deliver proofs-of-concept demonstrating how our technology creates value in computer-aided engineering workflows.
You will be in constant contact with customers to demonstrate the value of our platform and transmit the vision of the company.
You will train our customers to make the most out of their NC licences and work with them to develop web applications and APIs putting 3D deep learning in production to accelerate their design processes.
You will be part of our constant effort to further develop our deep-learning platform by collecting user feedback and relaying it to the product team.
You will have the opportunity to work with global leaders and top research departments across different industries towards a new engineering revolution.




Who you are

You have a good understanding of both Physics and ML (strict requirement)
You hold a Master’s or PhD in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or Physics
You have a strong experience with Python programming and experience with deep learning frameworks (strict requirement)
You like working with people and feel comfortable in the customer-facing role
You have excellent communication skills and like to work in a team
You are eager to solve real-world problems with machine learning
Industry experience in CAD / CFD / FEA modelling is a plus
You are fluent in English




You get

Work with a world-class technology team - our engineers are top-notch. We aim for excellence!
Work with people who care about you - we support each other and care about you so that you can thrive
A competitive salary and generous equity compensation plan - we are growing fast and want our employees to benefit from this growth
Flexible schedule with the possibility of home-office
The opportunity to contribute to changing the future of engineering - we believe that our product will contribute to changing the future of many industries.




Where you will be

Location: Lausanne (Switzerland), hybrid schedule

Travelling: We desire to be close to our customers and meet them regularly. This position might require up to 20% travelling to customer locations.

Start date: August - October 2024

Title: Manipulation Software Engineering Internship
Description:
ANYbotics is a fast-growing tech company dedicated to shaping the future of mobile robotics across multiple industries. Join our highly talented and motivated team of more than 130 people and work on cutting-edge robot technology.

The Opportunity

We are exploring the use of foundation models for online learning and task adaptation in robotic manipulation. Our robots operate in complex industrial environments that are subject to varying operating conditions. Under these settings our robots need to be adaptable yet reliable at all times. Hence we are looking for a graduate level intern that will explore the use of foundation models for manipulation in complex industrial environments.

Your typical day will revolve around parsing literature in the state of the art, writing code, working with open source foundation models and evaluating them in simulation environments for robotic manipulation. You will also have to develop novel algorithms for online learning and task adaption leveraging these foundation models. We are well aware that open source software and models are not always easy to work with and/or reliable. So the going will get tough, but the right person will be dedicated and focused on overcoming these barriers and passionate about having REAL IMPACT on one of the world's most advanced robotics platforms.

You will be closely working together with the Head of Manipulation, Sr. Director of Robotics and other senior engineers who will provide you with guidance and mentorship. The preferred starting date is August and the initial duration of the full-time paid internship is six months, with the possibility of extension.

Market & Our Technology

ANYbotics transforms industrial plants in the energy, process, and utility sector by introducing robotics to a wide range of novel applications that so far were beyond reach. Our customers are large asset operators and industrial service providers pioneering the use of robotics technology for inspection and maintenance. Our mobile robot ANYmal uses legs for extreme mobility in complex environments, camera- and LIDAR-based sensing for full autonomy and obstacle avoidance, and AI for high-quality and consistent inspection results. We develop numerous customized hardware systems, including the entire robotic platform, actuators, sensors, inspection payloads, charging systems, and all related ANYbotics mechanical hardware.

Your Profile


Currently a masters, Ph.D or recent graduate in computer science, robotics or related fields at a top ranked university (preferably in Switzerland or EU citizen)
Fluent in English
Experience with learning for robotics
Experience with object-oriented programming in C++ or Python
Familiarity with foundation models
Familiarity with robotic manipulation
Strong collaborative skills with the ability to work independently
Strong foundations in machine learning and deep learning
Foundational knowledge in control theory and/or computer vision



Please note that we are only able to consider applications from Schengen-Area citizens (or any student enrolled at ETH and EPFL who require compulsory internship). For residents outside of Switzerland, you will have to find your own accommodation in order to apply for the L or B work permit.

We offer you a very exciting and dynamic work environment, the opportunity to become part of a fast-growing company and an ambitious team that is on a mission to change the industrial inspection market, a chance to leverage your experience and bring in your own ideas, a fair market salary, an attractive employee stock ownership plan, and a job in the city of Zurich.
Show more
HTML:
ANYbotics is a fast-growing tech company dedicated to shaping the future of mobile robotics across multiple industries. Join our highly talented and motivated team of more than 130 people and work on cutting-edge robot technology.

The Opportunity

We are exploring the use of foundation models for online learning and task adaptation in robotic manipulation. Our robots operate in complex industrial environments that are subject to varying operating conditions. Under these settings our robots need to be adaptable yet reliable at all times. Hence we are looking for a graduate level intern that will explore the use of foundation models for manipulation in complex industrial environments.

Your typical day will revolve around parsing literature in the state of the art, writing code, working with open source foundation models and evaluating them in simulation environments for robotic manipulation. You will also have to develop novel algorithms for online learning and task adaption leveraging these foundation models. We are well aware that open source software and models are not always easy to work with and/or reliable. So the going will get tough, but the right person will be dedicated and focused on overcoming these barriers and passionate about having REAL IMPACT on one of the world's most advanced robotics platforms.

You will be closely working together with the Head of Manipulation, Sr. Director of Robotics and other senior engineers who will provide you with guidance and mentorship. The preferred starting date is August and the initial duration of the full-time paid internship is six months, with the possibility of extension.

Market & Our Technology

ANYbotics transforms industrial plants in the energy, process, and utility sector by introducing robotics to a wide range of novel applications that so far were beyond reach. Our customers are large asset operators and industrial service providers pioneering the use of robotics technology for inspection and maintenance. Our mobile robot ANYmal uses legs for extreme mobility in complex environments, camera- and LIDAR-based sensing for full autonomy and obstacle avoidance, and AI for high-quality and consistent inspection results. We develop numerous customized hardware systems, including the entire robotic platform, actuators, sensors, inspection payloads, charging systems, and all related ANYbotics mechanical hardware.

Your Profile

  • Currently a masters, Ph.D or recent graduate in computer science, robotics or related fields at a top ranked university (preferably in Switzerland or EU citizen)
  • Fluent in English
  • Experience with learning for robotics
  • Experience with object-oriented programming in C++ or Python
  • Familiarity with foundation models
  • Familiarity with robotic manipulation
  • Strong collaborative skills with the ability to work independently
  • Strong foundations in machine learning and deep learning
  • Foundational knowledge in control theory and/or computer vision


Please note that we are only able to consider applications from Schengen-Area citizens (or any student enrolled at ETH and EPFL who require compulsory internship). For residents outside of Switzerland, you will have to find your own accommodation in order to apply for the L or B work permit.

We offer you a very exciting and dynamic work environment, the opportunity to become part of a fast-growing company and an ambitious team that is on a mission to change the industrial inspection market, a chance to leverage your experience and bring in your own ideas, a fair market salary, an attractive employee stock ownership plan, and a job in the city of Zurich.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Profil du candidat


Y ou are graduated with a master's degree in computer science
You have very good development skills, particularly with Python, you master several framework (like Django, Flask, Dash…)
You have published at least 3 python projects successfully during your studies (github examples welcome)
You have very good skills on Docker, Kubernetes ;
You already work with Github or Azure DevOps ;
English proficiency is essential, and French is recommended
You have a high degree of autonomy
You are dynamic, methodical, rigorous and curious
You are an educator and gifted in communication
You are willing with a strong team spirit



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any other protected group status

Activités

Are you looking to grow your career in the vibrant world of energies trading?

You have a solid experience in Computer Science / Python? If yes, we have a great opportunity for you!

We are hiring a new Python Developer, to join our Citizen Development team. We would love to see your profile!

About us:

TotalEnergies has developed a strong expertise in oil and biofuels, natural gas and electricity trading. Trading entities are based in Geneva, Paris, Houston and Singapore.

Today, thanks to an international openness, a political and economic stability and strong competences in the financing of commodity trading and shipping, Switzerland has a leading position in international commodity trade.

This is why TotalEnergies installed naturally its European trading hub across oil and biofuels, natural gas and electricity in Geneva, which now bring together very large teams around trading activities: Trading & Shipping (T&S) and TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP).

T&S is a trading company in charge of all physical trading and shipping of crude oil and refined products on behalf of the TotalEnergies Company. It has been an active participant all over the supply chain as well as on the derivatives paper market in order to manage the market risk for a long time.

What You Will Do


Collect and analyse current and future needs in order to develop functional and technical specifications
Develop Python scripts to answer business needs, in accordance with good technical practices
Takeover the developments carried out by Citizen Developers
Deploy Python application with CI/CD pipelines with our DevOps tools (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, Prefect2, EKS, ArgoCD …)
Collaborate and assist businesses in the digitalization and automation of their tasks
Be the privileged link between business users and the IT department for Citizen Development
Actively animate the Citizen Developers community on Python
Contribute to the evolutions of existing applications (version upgrades, implementation of the Cloud…)
Participate in testing, training, maintenance and support activities
Ensure the sustainability and stability of the systems developed
Participate in optimizing server resources, maintenance of workflow and support activities 
Ensure the sustainability and stability of the systems developed 



Contexte et environnement

As part of the Trading’s Citizen Development, you will be working as a Python Developer within the Citizen Developments team, in close collaboration with business team (Market Research, Middle Office, Front Office …), throughout the application lifecycle: needs assessment, development, deployment, support, etc....

We are looking for a key element with good communication skills at ease with financial topics as our key mission is to empower users to gain productivity in their daily tasks by industrialising their projects.

Title: Data Scientist / Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
EMS hat 25 Produktionsstandorte in 16 Ländern, beschäftigt weltweit rund 3'000 Mitarbeiter und ist mit rund 140 Lernenden der grösste Berufsbildner im Kanton und Träger des Nationalen Bildungspreises.

EMS-GRIVORY ist Teil des Geschäftsbereichs Hochleistungspolymere der EMS-Gruppe und beschäftigt weltweit über 1000 Mitarbeiter. Das grösste Entwicklungs- und Produktionszentrum befindet sich in Domat/Ems in der Schweiz. Weitere Produktionsstätten liegen in Deutschland, China, Taiwan und den USA.

Data Scientist / Analyst (m/w/d)

Was erwartet SieMaterialdaten-Analysen (Konsistenzprüfung, Vorhersagen)Entwickeln und Aufbauen neuer Auswertungsprogramme in Bezug auf Eigenschaften unserer ProdukteUnterstützung der Gruppe Regulatory Affairs in Bezug auf Nachhaltigkeitsthemen (LCA, ISCC Plus, EcoVadis,...)Aufbau und Entwicklung von Modellen für die Berechnung von CO2-FussabdrückenBetreuen und Weiterentwickeln von Materialdatenbanken (Bsp.: CAMPUS) in der chemischen IndustrieMaterialdatenbank-Tuning und Troubleshooting im BetriebIdentifizieren von Hardware- und Softwarelösungen zur Effizienzsteigerung der F&E-MP

Was bringen Sie mitEin abgeschlossenes Studium in den Fachbereich Materialwissenschaften, Chemie oder vergleichbar mit Leidenschaft für Data ScienceWissen in Bezug auf polymere Werkstoffe und deren Materialeigenschaften wird vorausgesetztKenntnisse in der objektorientierten Programmierung (Bsp. VBA oder Python)Kenntnisse in Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) und in Berechnung von CO2-FussabdrückenDer Umgang mit grossen und komplexen Datenmengen ist für Sie eine LeidenschaftSie sind eine strukturierte und verantwortungsbewusste Personselbständig, zielorientiert, vorausdenkend, team- und konfliktfähig, sehr zuverlässigÜberzeugendes, souveränes Auftreten und durchsetzungsfähige PersönlichkeitGute Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse setzen wir voraus

Darauf können Sie sich freuenArbeiten inmitten schöner Natur- und ErholungsgebieteSpannende Aufgaben im internationalen Umfeld mit kurzen EntscheidungswegenViel Eigenverantwortung und attraktive FührungspositionenMarktgerechte Entlöhnung, fortschrittliche Sozialleistungen und eigene Pensionskasse mit guten LeistungenPersonalrestaurant, Gratisparkplätze

Title: Data scientist
Description:
Dans le cadre d’un poste permanent au sein d’une entreprise prestigieuse, située dans le Canton de Berne, nous recherchons un/e :

Data scientist

Vos missions


Exprimer de manière analytique les problématiques métiers.
Réaliser des analyses de données et mettre en avant les paramètres majeurs afin d’optimiser les process.
Mettre à disposition des outils de pilotage pour l’industrialisation et la production.



Vos compétences


Au minimum 3 - 5 ans d’expérience au sein d’une fonction similaire.
Bonnes connaissances ou formation dans les domaines data science et/ou machine Learning.
Connaissances des outils d’analyse de données tel que Python.
Diplôme d’ingénieur en microtechnique et/ou mécanique.
Excellentes communications et aisance relationnelle, analytique, rigoureux, à l’écoute.
Anglais - Bon niveau.



Si cette opportunité vous intéresse, n’hésitez pas à nous faire parvenir votre dossier complets (CV, diplômes et certificats).
