Title: Scientific Development Engineer
Description:
DECTRIS is a successful and growing hightech company that develops and manufactures X-ray and electron cameras to spark scientific breakthroughs around the world. While photographic cameras capture visible light, DECTRIS cameras count individual X-ray photons and electrons. Our 170+ employees are located in Switzerland, the United States and Japan.At DECTRIS, academic research meets agile industry practices. The company’s roots are deep in the scientific community and our scientists publish new research results every year. At the same time, our engineers, technicians, administrators, and commercial experts work hard to make sure our customers benefit from the latest technologies without delay.Since the beginning of 2022, our company has been on a journey towards self-organisation. We follow the principles of self-organised work according to Sociocracy 3.0.

Scientific Development Engineer

Your Tasks

Collaborating with scientists on the integration of scientific workflows into the DECTRIS CLOUDWorking closely with staff at and users of Synchrotrons and EM facilities to gain insights into their needsEffectively gather direct user feedback to learn about their behavior and pain pointsProvide meaningful input for the development team, product management, and support based on the end-user feedbackEnable growth into new markets by showcasing successful integration of new types of experiments performed through DECTRIS CLOUDYour Skills

Demonstrated expertise in working in a scientific environment at a Synchrotron or an EM facilityFamiliar with and interested in diving deep into scientific workflows in the Synchrotron or EM environmentExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsEnjoying to present work results to the scientific community and networking with scientistsPragmatic, solution-oriented, fail-fast-learn-early mindsetVery comfortable in writing software code in Python or similar language, also in front of scientific usersExcellent active listening skills and capable of extracting core messages out of large amounts of verbal and written informationHybrid work is possibleWillingness to travel frequently (~20%)We Offer

A successful and growing high tech company in an international, scientific environment.Joining the global leader in HPC X-ray detectors for science and industry. Our Developers design cutting-edge detectors to support the state of the art science and technology.An international work environment formed by more than 170 experienced engineers, scientists and other professionals. The company languages are German and English.Excellent, flexible working arrangements to enable professional development and personal life balance.An attractive working environment: modern infrastructure with wheelchair-accessible rooms, small fitness room, underground car park, subsidised meals, free snacks and drinks, various company events, internal and external training, home office options, after-work beers and other joint leisure activities.The DECTRIS Cloud Solutions Team, a corporate venture of DECTRIS, is at the forefront of digital innovation. We accelerate scientific discoveries by overcoming data-related challenges in scientific and industrial R&D. To that end, we develop cloud-based infrastructure and services in a SaaS layer to empower scientists around the world to efficiently get the most out of their data in a collaborative manner. DECTRIS CLOUD is now entering the market with the goal of scaling up fast.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/w/d) (80-100%)
Description:
At Accelleron, we go further. Building on the heritage of more than 100 years as ABB Turbocharging, you will join a team of true experts in an exciting international environment that share a commitment to excel, to be a trusted partner in supporting our customers in the gradual change towards sustainable industries with innovative technology, expertise and smart solutions. We are driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions as we welcome and celebrate individual differences.







Job description

Within the Digital Division of Accelleron, we are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join our newly formed AI team and contribute to the development of AI/ML-driven initiatives. As ML Engineer, you will play a crucial role in setting up and maintaining cloud infrastructure to facilitate model training, deployment, and lifecycle management. Your duties will involve a combination of hands-on coding, infrastructure setup, and collaboration with data scientists to support the development of cutting-edge machine learning solutions for use in our digital customer solutions and business services.




We are open for international applications with possibility to be hired in country you’re based in!







Your responsibilities:

Work closely with, and support data scientists in bringing blue-print models to production by writing clean and maintainable Python code, leveraging frameworks such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.
Spearhead the integration of pioneering neural network architectures into value-adding machine learning projects, fostering a culture of innovation within the team and continually pushing the boundaries of model performance and capability.
Ensure proper model deployment and lifecycle on our Azure infrastructure, setting up and managing cloud resources as necessary to ensure scalability and robustness.
Collaborate closely with both business stakeholders and experts on turbocharging to translate project requirements into value-adding machine learning solutions.







Your background:

Proven experience (3+ years) working as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role in a professional setting.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field.
Solid understanding of cloud computing concepts and experience with cloud platforms, preferably Azure.
Proficiency in Python programming language and experience with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch and TensorFlow.
Experience in SQL.
Strong knowledge of software development best practices including version control, code reviews, and automated testing.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
Effective communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.










Your benefits:

Attractive compensation & benefits
Employee Assistance Program
Remote Work Policy
Global parental leave program
Flexible working models







We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about Accelleron, take another look at our website accelleron-industries.com.




Accelleron Data Privacy Statement: accelleron-industries.com/privacy-notice/candidate

  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
  • Effective communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.




Your benefits:

  • Attractive compensation & benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Remote Work Policy
  • Global parental leave program
  • Flexible working models



We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about Accelleron, take another look at our website accelleron-industries.com.


Accelleron Data Privacy Statement: accelleron-industries.com/privacy-notice/candidate

Title: Python Developer
Description:
We are looking to recruit 2 Python Backend Engineers to work with one of our Life Science clients.




Onsite required: at least 3 days a week in Basel and EU/EFTA Citizen or valid Swiss work Permit




Role 1 : Backend Engineer Python and ORM

Role 2 : Backend Engineer Python for Workflow Management




Description of Team and department:

The team is closely associated with Biomedical Research within our client. They support scientists with solutions to identify hits in large libraries of samples from testing in cellular assays or with help of DNAencoded library technologies at any scale.

Their focus is on software solutions for streamlining scientific processes and workflows thinking start to end, which includes capturing and processing raw data, metadata and derived data generated by instruments during screening or obtained from intermediate analyses. They aim at applying and leveraging leading edge architecture and software technologies. Their goal is to combine use-case specific applications with optimised technical backend platforms to eventually compose final solutions for scientists to accelerate drug discovery.




General Role description:

Focus on backend implementation and integrate with other components provided by teammates. This requires a certain level of curiosity and high-level understanding where your work fits into the bigger picture of the solution, requiring a very collaborative spirit.




Required expertise for role 1)

1. Python core backend with Numpy and Pandas are required, Dask highly desired.

2. ORM such as SQLAlchemy for system integration




Required expertise for role 2)

1. Python with a focus on workflow management systems and DAG development (Apache Airflow),

concurrent tasks management at scale

2. Longer term this role is expected to work with the AWS stack, especially non-SQL high performance

stores, hence a general understanding of KV-stores, wide-column stores or graphs is therefore very

beneficial

Show more

Title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning, Gemini
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree.
2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.
2 years of experience with machine learning algorithms and tools (e.g., TensorFlow), artificial intelligence, deep learning, or natural language processing.


Preferred qualifications:


PhD in Machine Learning or a related field.
Experience with Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) and Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF).
Experience working with Large Language Models (LLMs).
Ability to grow under pressure in high-stakes, high-visibility environments.
Excellent data analysis skills.


About The Job

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

The team is working on all Multimodal efforts across Gemini. We launched image retrieval, image understanding and generation. This includes a significant amount of deep modeling such as Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF), and iterative process optimization (IPO) establishing data flywheel, etc. Part of the team is also involved in building necessary infrastructure and landing multimodal model capabilities and features.

In this role, you will have significant external impact, offering tremendous potential for growth and increased responsibility.

A conversational AI tool that enables users to collaborate with generative AI and help augment their imagination, expand their curiosity, and enhance their productivity.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with Research teams to understand technologies, adapting and integrating them into Gemini/Bard to drive continuous improvement.
Leverage Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF), and Preference Optimization (IPO) to quality hill climb.
Conduct in-depth data analysis to uncover insights, pinpoint opportunities, and inform the strategic development of a data flywheel.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Show more

Title: Scientist / Senior Scientist
Description:
As a preferred supplier for Roche Basel, we are looking for a motivated

Scientist / Senior Scientist

This is a full / part time position (80-100%) with a planned duration until 30.09.2025 and the option of extension. The earliest start date is in September 2024 and the latest in October 2024. Home Office: by arrangement.Playing a leading role in developing in silico experimental design and operation of a data-driven research groupUndertake rigorous advanced analytics exploration of data from disease areas of strategic relevanceReproducible reporting of emergent biological insights to stakeholdersFacilitating access to enterprise data and analysis tools for non-data scientistsPerforming, customising, and/or developing computational analyses/algorithms for raw data from sequencing-based assays, such as whole genome/exome sequencing, single-cell and bulk RNA-seq, and other data types (e.g. proteomics, genome-wide phenotypic screens)Pre-processing of raw datasets, high-level analysis, and visualisation to enable interpretation and deduce new biological insightsAnalyse large-scale datasets in collaboration with members of the group and internal collaboratorsValidation and optimisation of emerging computational research toolsFacilitating and supporting research collaborations with Roche experimental scientistsTool and application development and maintenance (e.g. Shiny)Development and implementation of novel and existing standardised workflows and pipelinesData management, standardised reporting, and maximising democratised access to data and analytics consistent with FAIR principlesContribute to creation and revision of peer development curriculum for workshops and small-group trainingAbility to work as part of matrix teams, taking leadership as well as participant roles as needed to ensure the success of individual teams and the organisation. Experience building and maintaining stakeholder relationships across an organisationAbility to analyse and integrate a broad range of complex scientific information into higher level understanding and novel concepts, then translate those concepts into actionable concrete outputs and testable hypotheses

Must Haves

A PhD in a relevant disciplineA minimum of 5 years of postdoctoral experience, which may include professional experience within industry settingsAbility to move across scientific domains, diseases, and biological scales with creativityProgramming/scripting skills in R and/or Python is required. Working knowledge of Linux/Unix, with experience in data processing in an HPC cluster environment and basic understanding of computer systems administration (*****)Experience of working alongside experimental ‘wet-lab' scientists, and managing several concurrent projects with changing priorities; (*****)Strong statistical, reporting, and data visualisation skills. Data, code, and project hygiene are essentialA strong genetics foundation including experience with Mendelian Randomisation, GWAS, and integrative analysis e.g. proteogenomic modelling, is expected (*****)Expertise in graph theory and application of network-based approaches to biological data including building disease models, multi-layer graph models, graph search tools and graph representational learning, Bayesian and/or logic networksExpertise in the integration and visualisation of multimodal data from human clinical and/or model systems (*****)Algorithm development, data mining, and statistical analysis of large datasets (including approaches such as Bayesian statistics, Markov models, simulation models, graph/network exploration methods, and machine learning)Experience in handling, integration, and visualisation of multimodal data (e.g. CITE-seq and spatial transcriptomics data) and/or data from proteomics or metabolomics studiesFluent EnglishNice to Have:

Knowledge of other programming platformsSignal transduction and perturbation modelling experienceApplication process

Interested? You can find more information here:

Infopackage . Please apply via the "Bewerben" button below and answer all questions, otherwise we will be unable to process your application. Please upload your CV in English or German only, along with your degree certificate and latest reference letter.#J-18808-Ljbffr
Show more

Title: AI Data Scientist Business Analyst 4-Ops
Description:
Job Description

Key Responsibilities:


Design and implement AI-driven applications and tools that automate processes to ensure on-time renewals, efficient customer service and workforce effectiveness.
Create machine learning models and algorithms to optimize renewal rates, along with data analysis and feature engineering for modeling.
Research, design, and develop deep learning models to streamline how renewal information is processed, including the application of large language models (LLMs) and digital assistants.
Develop generative AI solutions to automate tasks such as text generation and content creation.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions into existing systems and processes.
Monitor the performance of AI models and applications, continuously refining them to improve accuracy, efficiency, and reliability.Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization's financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.



Career Level - IC4

Responsibilities

Qualifications:


Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field.
Proven experience in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java and SQL.
Familiarity with Jupyter notebooks, data manipulation and visualization tools.
Ability to quickly learn and apply AI technologies to develop applications and integrate datasets.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills, with the ability to translate complex findings into actionable insights and recommendations.Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.



Qualifications

Disclaimer:

Certain US customer or client-facing roles may be required to comply with applicable requirements, such as immunization and occupational health mandates.

Range and benefit information provided in this posting are specific to the stated locations only

US: Hiring Range: from $73,800 - $178,200 per year. May be eligible for bonus and equity.

Oracle maintains broad salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions and locations, as well as reflect Oracle’s differing products, industries and lines of business.

Candidates are typically placed into the range based on the preceding factors as well as internal peer equity.

Oracle US offers a comprehensive benefits package which includes the following:


Medical, dental, and vision insurance, including expert medical opinion
Short term disability and long term disability
Life insurance and AD&D
Supplemental life insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)
Health care and dependent care Flexible Spending Accounts
Pre-tax commuter and parking benefits
401(k) Savings and Investment Plan with company match
Paid time off: Flexible Vacation is provided to all eligible employees assigned to a salaried (non-overtime eligible) position. Accrued Vacation is provided to all other employees eligible for vacation benefits. For employees working at least 35 hours per week, the vacation accrual rate is 13 days annually for the first three years of employment and 18 days annually for subsequent years of employment. Vacation accrual is prorated for employees working between 20 and 34 hours per week. Employees working fewer than 20 hours per week are not eligible for vacation.
11 paid holidays
Paid sick leave: 72 hours of paid sick leave upon date of hire. Refreshes each calendar year. Unused balance will carry over each year up to a maximum cap of 112 hours.
Paid parental leave
Adoption assistance
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Financial planning and group legal
Voluntary benefits including auto, homeowner and pet insurance



The role will generally accept applications for at least three calendar days from the posting date or as long as the job remains posted.

About Us

As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.

When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.

We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.

Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.

Disclaimer:

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.


Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

Title: Senior AI Engineer - Mobile Manipulation
Description:
ANYbotics is a fast-growing tech company dedicated to shaping the future of mobile robotics across multiple industries. Join our highly talented and motivated team of more than 130 people and work on cutting-edge robot technology.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a Senior (Manipulation) AI Engineer to join our manipulation effort. You will take Full Responsibility of the algorithmic development to deliver a state-of-the-art, robust, high performing and user friendly mobile manipulation platform for industrial inspection. This platform is intended to drive customer value by providing enhanced capabilities for inspecting and maintaining industrial equipment and infrastructure. The scope of your work includes the algorithmic design & development, software engineering and the software systems integration of manipulation capabilities for our autonomous legged robots ANYmal and ANYmal X.The complexity of our robotic systems requires a seamless collaboration across multiple disciplines including electrical, mechanical, software engineering and product management. We thrive on lively teamwork, leveraging the expertise of each member to ensure the success of our products. Hence, together as One Team with our Manipulation Hardware Systems Engineers, Product Designers, Manipulation Product Manager and other engineering teams you will build a unique mobile manipulation solution for industrial inspection while ensuring our robotics systems meet and exceed industry standards.

Market & Technology

ANYbotics transforms industrial plants in the (renewable) energy, process, and utility sector by introducing robotics to a wide range of novel applications that so far were beyond reach. Our mobile robot ANYmal uses legs for extreme mobility in complex environments, camera- and LIDAR-based sensing for full autonomy and obstacle avoidance, to perform jobs and deliver high-quality, consistent inspection results. We develop numerous customized hardware systems, including the entire robotic platform, actuators, sensors, inspection payloads, charging systems, and all related ANYbotics electrical hardware

About Us:

ANYbotics is a leading robotics company specializing in advanced autonomous systems. With a successful Series B financing round recently closed, we are poised for rapid growth and international expansion. Our mission is to revolutionize the robotics industry through cutting-edge technology and innovation. As we embark on this exciting journey, we are seeking a dynamic and experienced [] to join our team and help us shape the future of robotics.

Your Contributions


Take a major role in the design and development of novel software for mobile manipulation for industrial inspection
Develop robust and reliable mobile manipulation algorithms for complex industrial environments
Collaborate early and often with the product manager to ensure a high value, robust and reliable solution is being developed addressing all customer needs
Develop and maintain our manipulation software stack with associated tools, tests, libraries and databases
Work closely with hardware systems engineers to develop optimal solutions for our mobile manipulation platforms
Support a culture of fast learning and de-risking of new technologies while continuously finding creative ways to speed up the development process
Write precise and effective software documentation



Your Profile


Advanced engineering or science degree with a strong focus on robotics and machine learning
Excellent at AI systems for manipulation (ex: planning, perception, control and learning)
Excellent at developing software (C++ or Python) for learning based manipulation
Strong at generating innovative solutions to technical challenges
Strong at designing, implementing and improving machine learning based pipelines for manipulation
Good at state estimation and calibration of manipulation systems
Good at developing structured testing protocols for algorithm and methods
Interested in developing and maintaining infrastructure for working with robotic foundation models



Bonus Points


You are already experienced with modern C++ and/or ROS
You have already developed or worked with foundation models for robotics
You have worked with end to end learning for manipulation
You have proven track record of successfully deploying manipulation projects in industry



We offer you a very exciting and dynamic work environment, the opportunity to become part of a fast-growing company and an ambitious team that is on a mission to change the industrial inspection market, a chance to leverage your experience and bring in your own ideas, a fair market salary, an attractive employee stock ownership plan, and a job in the city of Zurich.
Show more

As we embark on this exciting journey, we are seeking a dynamic and experienced [] to join our team and help us shape the future of robotics.

Your Contributions

  • Take a major role in the design and development of novel software for mobile manipulation for industrial inspection
  • Develop robust and reliable mobile manipulation algorithms for complex industrial environments
  • Collaborate early and often with the product manager to ensure a high value, robust and reliable solution is being developed addressing all customer needs
  • Develop and maintain our manipulation software stack with associated tools, tests, libraries and databases
  • Work closely with hardware systems engineers to develop optimal solutions for our mobile manipulation platforms
  • Support a culture of fast learning and de-risking of new technologies while continuously finding creative ways to speed up the development process
  • Write precise and effective software documentation


Your Profile

  • Advanced engineering or science degree with a strong focus on robotics and machine learning
  • Excellent at AI systems for manipulation (ex: planning, perception, control and learning)
  • Excellent at developing software (C++ or Python) for learning based manipulation
  • Strong at generating innovative solutions to technical challenges
  • Strong at designing, implementing and improving machine learning based pipelines for manipulation
  • Good at state estimation and calibration of manipulation systems
  • Good at developing structured testing protocols for algorithm and methods
  • Interested in developing and maintaining infrastructure for working with robotic foundation models


Bonus Points

  • You are already experienced with modern C++ and/or ROS
  • You have already developed or worked with foundation models for robotics
  • You have worked with end to end learning for manipulation
  • You have proven track record of successfully deploying manipulation projects in industry


We offer you a very exciting and dynamic work environment, the opportunity to become part of a fast-growing company and an ambitious team that is on a mission to change the industrial inspection market, a chance to leverage your experience and bring in your own ideas, a fair market salary, an attractive employee stock ownership plan, and a job in the city of Zurich.

Title: Senior ML Ops Engineer for AI ML applications - Zurich - F/M/D
HTML:
At Synechron, we believe in the power of digital to transform businesses for the better. Our global consulting firm combines creativity and innovative technology to deliver industry-leading digital solutions. Synechron’s progressive technologies and optimization strategies span end-to-end Consulting, Design, Cloud, Data, and Engineering, servicing an array of noteworthy financial services and technology firms. Through research and development initiatives in our FinLabs we develop solutions for modernization, from Blockchain and Artificial Intelligence to Data Science models, Digital Underwriting, mobile-first applications and more. Over the last 20+ years, our company has been honored with multiple employer awards, recognizing our commitment to our talented teams. With top clients to boast about, Synechron has a workforce of 14 000 +, and has 51 offices in 20 countries within key global markets.

For more information on the company, please visit our websiteorLinkedIncommunity.

Why join Synechron ?

We are in constant searchfor talented and enthusiastic people who are passionate about working with our clients and being the best ambassadors for our company.

Job Description

Your mission:

To reinforce theSynechron Switzerland team,we are looking for a Senior ML Ops Engineer for AI ML applications.Our mission is for one of our clients, amajor/global financial institution in Zurich.

Your responsibilities:

    • Join a newly formed centralised MLOps team to build (& support) tools and setup automation that improve the efficiency and productivity of data scientists;
    • Work closely and support data scientists and engineers in delivering solutions that bring cost savings to the client;
    • Some example projects are:
      • (i) Automating the packaging of models and deployment into an environment, with traceability on model version, experimentation and control checks;
      • (ii) Enable continuous model monitoring to track model performance metrics (accuracy), detect performance and data drift, and generate anomaly and impact alerts where there is data quality or model degradation;
      • (iii) Establish security protection (malicious code execution, prompt injection attacks, data leakage, access control, encryption in transit/rest, IAM, etc.) in the ecosystem;
      • (iv). Assist in decoupling the AI model from the hosting IT application.

Qualifications

Your profile and skills:

  • Youjustifya Master’s degreeor equivalent in computer science, information systems, or another relevant field;
  • You possessminimum 6 to 8+years of practical experiencein the field of machine learning and AI;
  • You have asolid experience in the banking industry, with particular expertise in global financial institutions;
  • You are a polyglot developer, able to code (or learn quickly) multiple languages, such as Python, Java, Javascript, Html, Golang, etc;
  • You like to quickly pickup multiple technologies and use them in the correct manner;
  • You have strong knowledge on know CI/CD pipelines and Agile frameworks, preferably with the MLOps context;
  • You possess good familiarity with technologies such as: SciKit-Learn, TensorFlow, Torch, ChatGPT, Llama, LangChain (or equivalent), RAG, Model Security, Jupyter Notebook / JupyterLab, Unit Testing, Integration Testing, E2E Testing, ETL/ELT, Python Virtual Environment, Containerization with Docker/Podman, GitLab, Azure DevOps, Kubernetes, Azure Load Balancer, Communication Standards, Communication Security, Non-functional KPIs (performance, scalability…), Splunk, Graphana, Kubernetes Container Monitoring;
  • You produce secure and clean code that is stable, scalable, operational, and well-performing;
  • You understand the security principles in the banking systems, and be up to date with the latest standards (security, best practices) in IT;
  • You have good knowledge in SQL, NoSQL, Vector DB, Graph DB (is a plus);
  • You are ateam playerwith good communication and interpersonal skills;
  • You arecustomer-oriented, committed, with a hands-on mentality;
  • You speakEnglish (Germanwould be a plus);
  • You possess avalid Swiss work permit, or you areEU national and willing to relocate to Zurich.

Additional Information

What we offer you:

  • An enriching, dynamic, and stimulating professional experience;
  • Professional stability with a long-term contract;
  • Monthly support to finance your lunches;
  • A competitive salary package and referral bonuses;
  • The opportunity to be part of a multicultural, supportive, hardworking team driven by values;
  • Support, proximity, regular feedback, and exceptional events.
  • Up to 5 days of training per year;
  • Free and unlimited access to our global E-learning platform -> Over 16,000 modules available;
  • Annual license to access our banking/finance profession training platform to enhance your knowledge of various banking/financial professions and stay professionally updated;
  • A certified working environment - GREAT PLACE TO WORK.

If you believe you are the right candidate, please submit your application! We look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Postdoctoral Fellow (m/f/d) Cheminformatics Data Scientist – 2 years
Description:
Company Description

As a world market leader in crop protection, we help farmers to counter these threats and ensure enough safe, nutritious, affordable food for all – while minimizing the use of land and other agricultural inputs. Syngenta Crop Protection keeps plants safe from planting to harvesting. From the moment a seed is planted through to harvest, crops need to be protected from weeds, insects and diseases as well as droughts and floods, heat and cold. Syngenta Crop Protection is headquartered in Switzerland.

Job Description

We are currently seeking a 2-year fixed term Postdoctoral Fellowship contract in our chemistry department in Stein AG, Switzerland where you will be given the opportunity to develop new skills while working at the cutting edge of science and innovation. At Syngenta, our work matters; we are looking for the talents of today and tomorrow.

Responsibilities

We are seeking a dynamic individual to join our team and contribute to the enhancement of our High-Throughput Experimentation (HTE) platform through the implementation and integration in our software platform of cutting-edge experimental design algorithms. In this role, you will be responsible for:


Conducting a detailed analysis of existing methodologies for design of experiments, including design of experiments and Bayesian approaches, and providing a comprehensive summary of their features.
Developing a robust Python package that integrates all pertinent existing algorithms, ensuring seamless interaction with our internal reaction data management software platform.
Leveraging large-scale chemical reaction conditions datasets to create machine learning algorithms that enable intelligent selection of variables and their values as input to reaction optimization experimental design
Establishing the groundwork for customizable, on-demand machine learning models for reaction optimization that users can operate independently.
Crafting intuitive graphical user visualizations for straightforward interpretation of results by end-users.


As an integral part of our collaborative team, you will work closely with automation scientists and chemists who are the primary beneficiaries of your work, enhancing the platform through continuous iterative feedback.

You will find your place within a diverse team of Chemists and Computer Scientists, all of whom bring extensive knowledge in cheminformatics and software development.

Our organization is a fervent advocate for open-source software development and encourages the public sharing of our collaborative achievements.

Join us to advance your career and shape the future of experimental design in a stimulating and forward-thinking environment.

Qualifications


PhD in cheminformatics or machine learning
Demonstrated experience in chemical informatics, algorithms, and/or software design
Demonstrated working knowledge and application of statistics and data modeling to large scale life-sciences data.


What We Expect


Strong knowledge in chemical informatics, including methods to manipulate chemical structure information and representations (ideally using RDKit)
Mastering of chemical concepts (structure, reactivity, properties, some knowledge in experimental design is a plus)
Knowledge in programming (python)
Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques
Skills in data visualization and representation for analytics purposes is a plus
Fluency in spoken and written English language
Be an effective communicator, self-motivated, and able to drive insights into actions


Additional Information

What We Offer


Contribution to valuable and impactful work, in a stimulating environment -> #bringingplantpotentialtolife
Work in interdisciplinary teams
A superb working environment at our Global Research Center in Stein
Scientific and technical excellence
Scientific and technical support, including mentoring and tutoring
Continuous professional development and high scientific standards are foundations of our culture
State-of-the-art tools, access to professional infrastructure


Interested? We are looking for your online application. Please provide a Research Summary of 2-5 pages. Any applications submitted without a Research Summary will not be subject to further evaluation.

Please be aware that the job title may differ from the position title.

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We favor work life balance and enable flexible working.
Show more

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Join our renowned pharmaceutical client as a Backend Engineer Python (m/f/d) and contribute to groundbreaking projects in the vibrant city of Basel!




Responsibilities

Your team is closely associated with Biomedical Research within the organization
You support scientists with solutions to identify hits in large libraries of samples by testing in cellular assays or with the help of DNA-encoded library technologies at any scale
Your provide software solutions for streamlining scientific processes and workflows thinking from start to end, which includes capturing and processing raw data, metadata and derived data generated by instruments either during screening or by intermediate analysis
You aim at applying and leveraging leading edge architecture and software technologies
Your goal is to combine use-case specific applications with optimized technical backend platforms to eventually compose final solutions for scientists to accelerate drug discovery
You focus on backend implementation and integrate with other components provided by teammates
You display a good level of curiosity and high-level understanding where your work fits into the bigger picture of the solution, requiring a very collaborative approach

Requirements




We are looking for 2 types of expertise:




Expertise for role 1:

Python core backend with Numpy and Pandas are required, Dask highly desired
ORM such as SQLAlchemy for system integration

Expertise for role 2:

Python with a focus on workflow management systems and DAG development (Apache Airflow), concurrent tasks management at scale
General understanding of KV-stores, wide-column stores or graphs to work with AWS stack, especially non-SQL high performance stores

Benefits

5 weeks holiday / 40h week
Assumption of certification costs
Reka-Card with a 20% discount on up to CHF 2,400
Up to CHF 400 contribution to fitness subscription

Title: AI Inference Engineer (Edge) (100% Remote Europe)
Description:
At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.

Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Work on deploying machine learning models to edge devices using frameworks such as TVM, MLC, and IREE (MLIR).
Collaborate closely with researchers to assist in coding, training and transitioning models from research to production environments.
Integrate AI features into existing products, enriching them with the latest advancements in machine learning.
Excellent programming skills in Python, C and C++.
Experience with platforms such as TVM, MLC, and IREE (MLIR), which facilitate the deployment of models to specific GPU architectures.
Experience in NLP, computer vision, TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Experience with different aspects of Large Language Models (LLMs), such as fine-tuning techniques to tailor models to specific tasks and prompt engineering.
Extensive experience in training models using multi-GPU setups.
Demonstrated ability to rapidly assimilate new technologies and techniques.
A degree in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D.

Title: Research And Development Engineer
Description:
Summary / Role Purpose

The R&D Engineer II will be part of a team which is responsible for research, design, and implementation of iso-geometric analysis (IGA) pre-processing functionality in support of the LS-DYNA solver. This role requires an analytical and curious mind with strong interest in IGA, spline-technology, mesh generation, computational geometry and numerical methods. The primary job responsibilities will be to contribute to the development of spline technology and supporting functionality allowing for the efficient creation of surface and solid IGA models allowing for solution of complex industrial problems. The successful candidate can expect to be engaged in all stages of code and capability planning, research, creation and evolution of the IGA functionality, and to work closely with other members of the meshing software development team.

Minimum Education/Certification Requirements and Experience

BS in engineering, Computer Graphics, Computational Geometry or Mathematics, with 2 years’ experience, or MS
Expertise in IGA spline technology or related field.
Working knowledge of software development
Knowledge with Python and C/ C++

Preferred Qualifications and Skills

Solid understanding of geometry processing
Interest in mesh generation
Interest in advancing computer aided engineering and analysis
Strong analytical skills
Ability to overcome obstacles
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work collaboratively across teams and geographies

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (CH or EU)
Description:
Competitive package: Salary, Options (we want you to take ownership) & awesome benefits (in fact, you will be part of defining the benefit package!) 

 

Why to work for REOR20 

 

Floods are making headlines daily, posing a growing threat worldwide. Ready to join a fast-paced company at the forefront of flood intelligence? REOR20 is looking for dynamic individuals to be key players in our mission to help communities and insurers manage flood risks in the era of climate change.  

 

AI is the buzzword, but we’re taking it to the next level with physics-savvy AI. We’re gearing up to revolutionize the industry with our cutting-edge technology.  

 

Join us and be part of the storm that shields against flood disasters! 

 

About us 

 

REOR20 is not just another flood modeling company; we are a deep tech firm developing technology that, until recently, seemed like science fiction. Our innovative approach offers unparalleled flood risk understanding, pushing the boundaries of what is possible. 




At REOR20, we are pioneering the next generation of technology to deliver precise, timely flood hazard intelligence—something the industry has never seen before. Our groundbreaking approach merges high-fidelity computational engineering tools with innovative AI methodologies. 




Our products are the essential tools needed to win the battle against global flooding and the climate crisis. 




Our vision is clear: to become the global leader in flood hazard intelligence, setting the standard that others strive to meet. We are assembling our core engineering team to build and launch the first commercial-scale version of our product. Joining this team means engaging in a variety of tasks and taking on diverse responsibilities. 




REOR20 champions an open, flexible, and inclusive culture. We pursue excellence, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and embrace the diverse challenges across all aspects of our company.   




We offer excitement, fun, and a rewarding mission! 




At REOR20, we promise to keep pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. Join us, and you’ll always be at the forefront, contributing to a future where our groundbreaking solutions save lives, protect properties, and create a safer, more resilient world. 

 

The Position  

Join our innovative and dynamic startup as a Machine Learning Engineer and play a pivotal role in the development of our groundbreaking flood prediction technology. You will lead and own the end-to-end design, implementation, and deployment of advanced deep learning models. Leveraging your expertise in Machine Learning and Software Engineering, you will create and extend robust and scalable pipelines that drive our data processing, model training, and deployment infrastructure. Your work will ensure the optimal performance and reliability of our cutting-edge flood prediction systems, helping to mitigate the impact of floods worldwide. 

 

Key Responsibilities  

Design, develop, and implement state-of-the-art solutions along the entire model development life cycle, focusing on optimizing performance and scalability. 
Build and maintain the infrastructure for training and testing machine learning models, create and manage large datasets, and ensure robust and scalable data pipelines. 
Investigate and propose new tools and infrastructure to accelerate the development of our state-of-the-art flood models and to optimize all key steps of the model pipeline 
Collaborate with software engineers to deliver deployment ready models.  

 

You should apply if you have 

Excellent coding skills with proficiency in Python and extensive hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks (preferably PyTorch).  
Affinity for designing and optimize machine learning pipelines for scalability and performance 
Experience in large-scale data processing and cloud computing (e.g., AWS) is preferred 
Knowledge of MLOps best practices or large-scale model deployment is a plus 

 

Interested? 

Please apply via LinkedIn or send your application to info@reor20.com. 

 

Show more

Competitive package: Salary, Options (we want you to take ownership) & awesome benefits (in fact, you will be part of defining the benefit package!)

You will lead and own the end-to-end design, implementation, and deployment of advanced deep learning models. Your work will ensure the optimal performance and reliability of our cutting-edge flood prediction systems, helping to mitigate the impact of floods worldwide. 

 

Key Responsibilities  

  • Design, develop, and implement state-of-the-art solutions along the entire model development life cycle, focusing on optimizing performance and scalability. 
  • Build and maintain the infrastructure for training and testing machine learning models, create and manage large datasets, and ensure robust and scalable data pipelines. 
  • Investigate and propose new tools and infrastructure to accelerate the development of our state-of-the-art flood models and to optimize all key steps of the model pipeline 
  • Collaborate with software engineers to deliver deployment ready models.  

 

You should apply if you have 

  • Excellent coding skills with proficiency in Python and extensive hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks (preferably PyTorch).  
  • Affinity for designing and optimize machine learning pipelines for scalability and performance 
  • Experience in large-scale data processing and cloud computing (e.g., AWS) is preferred 
  • Knowledge of MLOps best practices or large-scale model deployment is a plus 

 

Interested? 

Please apply via LinkedIn or send your application to info@reor20.com.

Title: AI & Data Engineer:in (m/w/d, 80-100%)
Description:
Substring – the data company entwickelt seit 2000 digitale Lösungen zur Wertschöpfung aus Daten und bietet pragmatische, lösungsorientierte Beratung an. Die Firma ist auf vier Kernthemen spezialisiert:


Data Transformation: Unterstützung auf dem Weg zum datengetriebenen Unternehmen, inklusive Roadmap-Erstellung und Fähigkeitsausbau.
Data Platforms & Data Engineering: Entwicklung von Datenplattformen wie Data Lakes und Data Warehouses sowie Business Intelligence Lösungen.
Operative Datasystems: Entwicklung von Softwareystemen zur Datenverarbeitung und -analyse, von der Prototypenphase bis zur Implementierung mit DevOps & DataOps.
Artificial Intelligence: Entwicklung massgeschneiderter AI-Lösungen für Unternehmensoptimierung und enge Zusammenarbeit mit der Forschung.



Aufgaben

Deine Tätigkeiten:


Du trainierst Machine Learning Modelle für unsere Kunden inkl. des Aufbaus der dazugehörigen MLOps Pipeline.
Du führst Datenanalysen und Abklärungen rund um die Datenbestände der Kunden durch.
Du konzipierst und entwickelst Datenplattformen (Lakehouse, Data Warehouse, Data Lake) für unsere Kunden.
Du erstellsts Datenmodelle für analytische oder operative Tätigkeiten.



Unsere Wünsche an dich:


Kundenzentriert: Du arbeitest selbständig mit unseren Kund:innen und trägst die Verantwortung für deine Projekte.
Selbständig mit Teamgeist: Hoher Grad an Mitgestaltung, entsprechende Verantwortung und persönliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten. Wir fordern und fördern uns gegenseitig.
Daten-affin: Du hilfst unseren Kund:innen mit ihren Daten Mehrwerte zu generieren.
Lernbegierig und Lernfreudig: Du willst mit uns zusammen viel lernen und persönlich und professionell wachsen.
Du sprichst und schreibst Deutsch (C1 oder Muttersprache) und Englisch fliessend.



Qualifikation

Qualifikationen:


Du verfügst über eine relevante Berufserfahrung und/oder Studium im Bereich AI / Data Engineering.
Du bist versiert in Python und kennst dich mit dem Training von Machine Learning Modellen aus.
Du hast idealerweise Erfahrungen im Bereich Data-Pipelines, API, ETL/ELT gesammelt, bereits Datenmodelle entwickelt, Daten transformiert und Daten aufbereitet. Vielleicht hast du schon mit Technologien wie Apache Spark, Databricks, dbt, Azure Synapse oder anderen Tools gearbeitet.
Du bist mit den gängigen Cloud-Plattformen (von Vorteil Azure) vertraut und bringst idealerweise Erfahrung mit DataOps und MLOps mit. Know How von Infrastructure as Code ist von Vorteil
Mit Docker und Containerumgebungen konntest Du idealerweise bereits Erfahrung sammeln.
Agile Werte und Lean Methodologie kennst Du oder du kannst dich damit identifizieren.
MLOps / DataOps und Infrastruktur Themen und die Betreuung von mehreren Umgebungen bis zur Produktion gehören für dich dazu.
Kundenorientierung und eine gute Servicedienstleistung sind Dir sehr wichtig.



Benefits

Unser Angebot an dich:


Flexibles Arbeitsmodell mit viel Freiraum. Wir suchen mit dir gerne Lösungen um Work und Life unter einen Hut zu bringen.
Faire Entlöhnung (transparentes Lohnmodell) mit guten Sozialleistungen.
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten.
Teil eines Teams werden, das etwas bewegen möchte und spannende Digitalisierungsprojekte umsetzt.
Bei uns darfst Du sehr gerne mitgestalten, wir leben eine flache Hierarchie.



Sende uns deine Nachricht mitsamt CV oder deinem Linkedin Profil und deiner Motivation bei Substring mit anzupacken. Gerne auch Links zu Portfolio/Showcase wie Github, Projekte, Blog oder sonstwas um uns einen kleinen Einblick in deine Erfahrungen zu geben.

Du bist dir nicht sicher ob du dich bewerben sollst?

Auch wenn Du nicht alle Anforderungen erfüllst, freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung. Wir legen viel Wert auf ein gut funktionierendes Team, das sich gut versteht. Fehlende fachliche Kompetenzen kannst du Dir aneignen und wir sind bereit mit Dir den Weg zu gehen.
Show more

Title: (Global Oil Gas) Senior Data Scientist
Description:
This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

About the Company



This company engages in the exploration, production, transportation, and sale of crude oil and natural gas. It operates through the following segments: Upstream, Downstream, and Corporate. The Upstream segment includes crude oil, natural gas and natural gas liquids exploration, field development, and production. The Downstream segment focuses on refining, logistics, power generation, and the marketing of crude oil, petroleum and petrochemical products, and related services to international and domestic customers. The Corporate segment offers supporting services including human resources, finance, and information technology. The company was founded on May 29, 1933 and is headquartered in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

Job Summary

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join the Sales & Operations Planning Division's (S&OP) under the Global Optimizer Department. S&OP's primary responsibility is to optimize crude allocation and operations across global manufacturing facilities. This optimization aims to maximize revenue, increase profitability, and capitalize on international market opportunities.

The division serves as the gatekeeper for linear programming (LP) at wholly owned refineries and oversees the integrated global MPIMS model. This model is crucial for optimizing global crude allocation, exploring new international markets, and integrating operational options.

As a Data Scientist, your main role will involve analyzing and structuring large volumes of real-time and historical data. You will build algorithms and solutions around this data to facilitate decision-making within the company. Your work will be pivotal in supporting the company's forecasting and predictive digital strategy, contributing to the development of advanced solutions at the Downstream Digital Center.

Key Responsibilities:

Formulate and lead multifaceted analytic studies against large volumes of data.
Interpret and analyze data using exploratory mathematical and statistical techniques based on the scientific method.
Coordinate research and analytic activities utilizing various data points (unstructured and structured) and employ programming to clean, massage, and organize the data.
Experiment against data points, provide information based on experiment results, and offer previously undiscovered solutions to complex data challenges.
Lead all data experiments tasked by the Data Science Team.
Coordinate with Data Engineers to build data environments providing data identified by Data Analysts, Data Integrators, Knowledge Managers, and Intel Analysts.
Develop methodology and processes for prioritization and scheduling of projects.
Analyze problems and determine root causes.
Define company data assets (data models), Spark, SparkSQL, and HiveSQL jobs to populate data models.
Work closely with all business units and engineering teams to develop strategy for long-term data platform architecture.



Requirements:

Willingness to relocate to Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
Hold a Bachelor's degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or related fields. An advanced degree is preferred.
Have 5-7 years of professional experience in a related field.
Proficiency with one or more programming languages (Java, C++, Python, R, etc.).
Demonstrate experience applying data science methods to real-world data problems.
Experience in utilizing visualization tools to leverage the growing volume of available information.

Title: Data Scientist (80-100%)
Description:
Clarunis Universitäres Bauchzentrum Basel ist das gemeinsame Kompetenzzentrum des Claraspitals und des Universitätsspitals Basel für alle Patienten, die auf eine Behandlung im Bauchbereich angewiesen sind. Clarunis vereint das Fachwissen, die Forschungstätigkeit und die Zahl der behandelten Patienten beider Spitäler, um die Qualität der Diagnose und der Behandlung noch weiter zu steigern und zu verbessern.

Clarunis Universitäres Bauchzentrum Basel ist das gemeinsame Kompetenzzentrum des Claraspitals und desUniversitätsspitals Basel für alle Patienten, die auf eine Behandlung im Bauchbereich angewiesen sind.Clarunis vereint das Fachwissen, die Forschungstätigkeit und die Zahl der behandelten Patienten beiderSpitäler, um die Qualität der Diagnose und der Behandlung noch weiter zu steigern und zu verbessern.Das Forschungsgruppe Digital Surgery Lab (https://digitalsurgerylab.ch) am Department of BiomedicalEngineering der Universität Basel hat zum Ziel durch Digitalisierung und Künstliche Intelligenz die Chirurgiezu revolutionieren und die Behandlungsqualität für Patienten zu verbessern.Um das Projekt Data-Driven Surgery voranzubringen und den Aufbau einer Datenplattform (Surgical AIplatform) für das Departement Chirurgie des Universitätsspital Basel zu koordinieren, suchen wir nachVereinbarung eine/nData Scientist




Data Scientist (80-100%)




Ihre Aufgaben sind:

Transdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit mit Klinikern und Ingenieuren
Koordination der Entwicklung der Surgical AI platform mit externen Anbietern
Erstellen von Strukturen zum Erfassen, Aufbewahrung und Archivieren von Daten
Analyse medizinischer Datensätze (Bild, Video, Audio, Text) mittels deep learning




Sie bringen mit:

Doktorat in Computerwissenschaften oder Biomedical Engineering
Projektmanagement Fähigkeiten und Erfahrung
Ein starker Hintergrund in Netzwerkarchitektur und machine/deep learning
Kompetenz im Programmieren in Python und Erfahrung mit gängigen deep learning Bibliotheken (PyTorch, TensorFlow)




Wir bieten:

Eine anspruchsvolle Aufgabe in einem akademischen Umfeld
Zeitgemässe Anstellungsbedingungen
Grosszügige Sozialversicherungsleistungen
Möglichkeit zur akademischen oder unternehmerischen Weiterentwicklung
Mentoring




Fühlen Sie sich angesprochen und sind bereit, diese Herausforderung anzunehmen, dann freuen wir unsauf Ihre Online-Bewerbung an hr@clarunis.ch.




Weitere Auskünfte erteilt Ihnen gerne Dr. Joël Lavanchy, Forschungsgruppenleiter und Oberarzt(joel.lavanchy@clarunis.ch).

Title: Junior CRM Data Scientist 100%
Description:
Description

Together with CRM Manager, The Junior CRM Data Scientist (CRM & CI Executive) drives CRM strategy & company growth by leveraging full potential of consumer data. Bring analytic and technical expertise to support consumer-centric omnichannel journey in a multi-brand environment. Contribute into building personalized relationships with consumers by providing key data insights and trends, supporting market research initiatives, and enabling relevant personalized and targeted communications.

Responsibilities


Work in partnership with CRM Manager to drive CRM strategy and enable faster and better decision-making process, based on the consumer insights, for a variety of brands
Build consumer data expertise and own data quality, provide inputs and suggestions for data architecture improvements
Master usage of CRM & marketing systems (Braze, CDP, BI & BO) combined with Data Science skills
Generate actionable insights using machine learning models by working with consumer data from multiple data sources
Assist and train internal teams to enable easier and faster usage of available data
Analyze, recommend and create segments for consumer communication throughout different communication channels (e.g. E-mail, direct mail, SMS, paid media, etc.)
Support personalization tactics by developing data scripts for automated marketing campaigns
Gathers and analyzes complex datasets across various platforms to provide key insights on consumer behavior
Produce & deliver CRM KPIs and CRM Campaign reports
Update and maintain existing E-mail Marketing & Triggered Campaigns dashboards
Support smart segmentation through the mix of channels: E-mail, SMS, IAM & Facebook
Support with implementation of AI capabilities developed on CRM Systems


Qualifications


2+ years of experience as a Data Consultant, Consumer Insight Specialist or Business Analyst
University degree in a quantitative field of study e.g. economics, engineering, data science or marketing
Experience in creating CRM reports
Experience in working with Python
Good understanding of data landscapes and data algorithms
Expert proficiency Google Analytics
Excellence in Excel
Experience with integration of data from multiple data sources; ability to investigate and master new data sets quickly
Fluency in English, German is a plus
Strong plus having worked on Data Science projects


Qualifications

What We Offer


The chance to be part of a dedicated, talented, and highly skilled team and bring it to the next level
Lots of opportunities to grow - both personally and professionally
A modern workspace in the city of Zurich, competitive salary as well as very good fringe benefits


If this sounds like an exciting opportunity for you, we are looking forward to receiving your application via our online tool. Please make sure to prepare a CV, a cover letter and hand in your references / diplomas (all documents in PDF format).

Your Recruiting Team

Job: Online / E-Commerce

Primary Location: Europe, Middle East, Africa-CH-ZH-Zurich

Job Type: Standard

Schedule: Full-time

Shift: 1st (Day) Shift

Title: Senior Data Scientist – Client Platforms
Description:
Job Reference #
297565BR

Job Type
Full Time

Your role
Would you like to apply your diverse technical and people skills to help lead the way through UBS’ AI transition?

We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist to:


implement - AI for multiple use cases in the IB for our Sales functions, from LLM chat to knowledge graphs
lead – a small team of data scientists and data engineers through an exciting time for UBS and the world
innovate – solve for a huge variety of different revenue-generating and productivity issues we come across in our division - Global Markets in the IB
model – use the latest (and oldest) statistical, causal, ML and AI models to get results
code – use your extensive coding background to remains hands-on and deliver projects on our modern Azure, pyspark-based data infrastructure
understand – how the IB business works, what our stakeholders and clients really need, and how you can make a difference


Your team
You’ll be working in the Client Platforms Quants team in London or Zurich, focusing on analytics deliveries for Distribution. With our mandate in Global Markets, we provide high quality data and the understanding and insights that can be gained from them . This benefits our internal stakeholders (Sales, Trading and Management) and external Clients through improved service provision. As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll play an important role in the upcoming AI transformation at UBS, including sensible use of existing ML techniques and good old statistics to drive revenues and save costs.

Despite working in a big old bank, you will not find us in suits and ties. We work normal hours but strive to produce better than normal results by use of, you know, science. The team is fun with mixed experience. We welcome diversity and look forward to your application.

Your expertise


you are passionate about your work and care about people
PhD (ideal) or MSc equivalent in a technical field
extensive coding experience – history of hands-on development – python (ideal)
extensive analytics experience – recommendation models, client analytics, statistics, classical ML, and interest in latest AI research
moderate financial knowledge – experience in a Markets business, for example Equities or Credit trading or distribution
moderate cloud experience – we are on Azure
ability to solve the right problems and being able to justify your efforts to stakeholders
commercial instinct and practical implementation as opposed to ivory tower research


About Us
UBS is the world’s largest and the only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors..

We have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries.

Join us
At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.

From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?

Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Your Career Comeback
We are open to applications from career returners. Find out more about our program on ubs.com/careercomeback.
Show more
HTML:
Job Reference #
297565BR

Job Type
Full Time

Your role
Would you like to apply your diverse technical and people skills to help lead the way through UBS’ AI transition?

We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist to:

  • implement - AI for multiple use cases in the IB for our Sales functions, from LLM chat to knowledge graphs
  • lead – a small team of data scientists and data engineers through an exciting time for UBS and the world
  • innovate – solve for a huge variety of different revenue-generating and productivity issues we come across in our division - Global Markets in the IB
  • model – use the latest (and oldest) statistical, causal, ML and AI models to get results
  • code – use your extensive coding background to remains hands-on and deliver projects on our modern Azure, pyspark-based data infrastructure
  • understand – how the IB business works, what our stakeholders and clients really need, and how you can make a difference

Your team
You’ll be working in the Client Platforms Quants team in London or Zurich, focusing on analytics deliveries for Distribution. With our mandate in Global Markets, we provide high quality data and the understanding and insights that can be gained from them . This benefits our internal stakeholders (Sales, Trading and Management) and external Clients through improved service provision. As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll play an important role in the upcoming AI transformation at UBS, including sensible use of existing ML techniques and good old statistics to drive revenues and save costs.

Despite working in a big old bank, you will not find us in suits and ties. We work normal hours but strive to produce better than normal results by use of, you know, science. The team is fun with mixed experience. We welcome diversity and look forward to your application.

Your expertise

  • you are passionate about your work and care about people
  • PhD (ideal) or MSc equivalent in a technical field
  • extensive coding experience – history of hands-on development – python (ideal)
  • extensive analytics experience – recommendation models, client analytics, statistics, classical ML, and interest in latest AI research
  • moderate financial knowledge – experience in a Markets business, for example Equities or Credit trading or distribution
  • moderate cloud experience – we are on Azure
  • ability to solve the right problems and being able to justify your efforts to stakeholders
  • commercial instinct and practical implementation as opposed to ivory tower research

About Us
UBS is the world’s largest and the only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors..

We have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries.

Join us
At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.

From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?

Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Your Career Comeback
We are open to applications from career returners. Find out more about our program on ubs.com/careercomeback.

Title: ML Application Engineer
Description:
The ML Application Engineering Team

Our mission is to support our customers in solving their most complex engineering challenges. We collaborate closely with engineering and design teams within the automotive, aerospace and energy industries, understand their challenges and pains, and help them identify solutions to accelerate their conception processes. We leverage our platform, Neural Concept, and its components developed by our software engineers to unlock the value of the most complex Computer-Aided Engineering datasets and to create a direct impact on production design processes. Using 3D deep learning, we empower our customers to develop better products faster.




What you will do

As a key player in the team, your mission will be to establish trust and admiration from our customers by delivering high-quality technical work.




While working towards this goal:

You will run projects together with the customer’s engineering teams, develop tailored solutions and analyse data for each project using Python.
You will apply our deep-learning tools to different engineering/physics problems as well as deliver proofs-of-concept demonstrating how our technology creates value in computer-aided engineering workflows.
You will be in constant contact with customers to demonstrate the value of our platform and transmit the vision of the company.
You will train our customers to make the most out of their NC licences and work with them to develop web applications and APIs putting 3D deep learning in production to accelerate their design processes.
You will be part of our constant effort to further develop our deep-learning platform by collecting user feedback and relaying it to the product team.
You will have the opportunity to work with global leaders and top research departments across different industries towards a new engineering revolution.




Who you are

You have a good understanding of both Physics and ML (strict requirement)
You hold a Master’s or PhD in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or Physics
You have a strong experience with Python programming and experience with deep learning frameworks (strict requirement)
You like working with people and feel comfortable in the customer-facing role
You have excellent communication skills and like to work in a team
You are eager to solve real-world problems with machine learning
Industry experience in CAD / CFD / FEA modelling is a plus
You are fluent in English




You get

Work with a world-class technology team - our engineers are top-notch. We aim for excellence!
Work with people who care about you - we support each other and care about you so that you can thrive
A competitive salary and generous equity compensation plan - we are growing fast and want our employees to benefit from this growth
Flexible schedule with the possibility of home-office
The opportunity to contribute to changing the future of engineering - we believe that our product will contribute to changing the future of many industries.




Where you will be

Location: Lausanne (Switzerland), hybrid schedule

Travelling: We desire to be close to our customers and meet them regularly. This position might require up to 20% travelling to customer locations.

Start date: August - October 2024
