Title: Manipulation Software Engineering Internship
Description:
ANYbotics is a fast-growing tech company dedicated to shaping the future of mobile robotics across multiple industries. Join our highly talented and motivated team of more than 130 people and work on cutting-edge robot technology.

The Opportunity

We are exploring the use of foundation models for online learning and task adaptation in robotic manipulation. Our robots operate in complex industrial environments that are subject to varying operating conditions. Under these settings our robots need to be adaptable yet reliable at all times. Hence we are looking for a graduate level intern that will explore the use of foundation models for manipulation in complex industrial environments.

Your typical day will revolve around parsing literature in the state of the art, writing code, working with open source foundation models and evaluating them in simulation environments for robotic manipulation. You will also have to develop novel algorithms for online learning and task adaption leveraging these foundation models. We are well aware that open source software and models are not always easy to work with and/or reliable. So the going will get tough, but the right person will be dedicated and focused on overcoming these barriers and passionate about having REAL IMPACT on one of the world's most advanced robotics platforms.

You will be closely working together with the Head of Manipulation, Sr. Director of Robotics and other senior engineers who will provide you with guidance and mentorship. The preferred starting date is August and the initial duration of the full-time paid internship is six months, with the possibility of extension.

Market & Our Technology

ANYbotics transforms industrial plants in the energy, process, and utility sector by introducing robotics to a wide range of novel applications that so far were beyond reach. Our customers are large asset operators and industrial service providers pioneering the use of robotics technology for inspection and maintenance. Our mobile robot ANYmal uses legs for extreme mobility in complex environments, camera- and LIDAR-based sensing for full autonomy and obstacle avoidance, and AI for high-quality and consistent inspection results. We develop numerous customized hardware systems, including the entire robotic platform, actuators, sensors, inspection payloads, charging systems, and all related ANYbotics mechanical hardware.

Your Profile


Currently a masters, Ph.D or recent graduate in computer science, robotics or related fields at a top ranked university (preferably in Switzerland or EU citizen)
Fluent in English
Experience with learning for robotics
Experience with object-oriented programming in C++ or Python
Familiarity with foundation models
Familiarity with robotic manipulation
Strong collaborative skills with the ability to work independently
Strong foundations in machine learning and deep learning
Foundational knowledge in control theory and/or computer vision



Please note that we are only able to consider applications from Schengen-Area citizens (or any student enrolled at ETH and EPFL who require compulsory internship). For residents outside of Switzerland, you will have to find your own accommodation in order to apply for the L or B work permit.

We offer you a very exciting and dynamic work environment, the opportunity to become part of a fast-growing company and an ambitious team that is on a mission to change the industrial inspection market, a chance to leverage your experience and bring in your own ideas, a fair market salary, an attractive employee stock ownership plan, and a job in the city of Zurich.
Show more

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Profil du candidat


Y ou are graduated with a master's degree in computer science
You have very good development skills, particularly with Python, you master several framework (like Django, Flask, Dash…)
You have published at least 3 python projects successfully during your studies (github examples welcome)
You have very good skills on Docker, Kubernetes ;
You already work with Github or Azure DevOps ;
English proficiency is essential, and French is recommended
You have a high degree of autonomy
You are dynamic, methodical, rigorous and curious
You are an educator and gifted in communication
You are willing with a strong team spirit



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any other protected group status

Activités

Are you looking to grow your career in the vibrant world of energies trading?

You have a solid experience in Computer Science / Python? If yes, we have a great opportunity for you!

We are hiring a new Python Developer, to join our Citizen Development team. We would love to see your profile!

About us:

TotalEnergies has developed a strong expertise in oil and biofuels, natural gas and electricity trading. Trading entities are based in Geneva, Paris, Houston and Singapore.

Today, thanks to an international openness, a political and economic stability and strong competences in the financing of commodity trading and shipping, Switzerland has a leading position in international commodity trade.

This is why TotalEnergies installed naturally its European trading hub across oil and biofuels, natural gas and electricity in Geneva, which now bring together very large teams around trading activities: Trading & Shipping (T&S) and TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP).

T&S is a trading company in charge of all physical trading and shipping of crude oil and refined products on behalf of the TotalEnergies Company. It has been an active participant all over the supply chain as well as on the derivatives paper market in order to manage the market risk for a long time.

What You Will Do


Collect and analyse current and future needs in order to develop functional and technical specifications
Develop Python scripts to answer business needs, in accordance with good technical practices
Takeover the developments carried out by Citizen Developers
Deploy Python application with CI/CD pipelines with our DevOps tools (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, Prefect2, EKS, ArgoCD …)
Collaborate and assist businesses in the digitalization and automation of their tasks
Be the privileged link between business users and the IT department for Citizen Development
Actively animate the Citizen Developers community on Python
Contribute to the evolutions of existing applications (version upgrades, implementation of the Cloud…)
Participate in testing, training, maintenance and support activities
Ensure the sustainability and stability of the systems developed
Participate in optimizing server resources, maintenance of workflow and support activities 
Ensure the sustainability and stability of the systems developed 



Contexte et environnement

As part of the Trading’s Citizen Development, you will be working as a Python Developer within the Citizen Developments team, in close collaboration with business team (Market Research, Middle Office, Front Office …), throughout the application lifecycle: needs assessment, development, deployment, support, etc....

We are looking for a key element with good communication skills at ease with financial topics as our key mission is to empower users to gain productivity in their daily tasks by industrialising their projects.

Title: Data Scientist / Analyst (m/w/d)

EMS hat 25 Produktionsstandorte in 16 Ländern, beschäftigt weltweit rund 3'000 Mitarbeiter und ist mit rund 140 Lernenden der grösste Berufsbildner im Kanton und Träger des Nationalen Bildungspreises.

EMS-GRIVORY ist Teil des Geschäftsbereichs Hochleistungspolymere der EMS-Gruppe und beschäftigt weltweit über 1000 Mitarbeiter. Das grösste Entwicklungs- und Produktionszentrum befindet sich in Domat/Ems in der Schweiz. Weitere Produktionsstätten liegen in Deutschland, China, Taiwan und den USA.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

Title: Data Scientist / Data Analyst 80 - 100 %
Company: Amt für Informatik und Organisation des Kantons Bern (KAIO)
Description:
Suchst du eine spannende Herausforderung in einem kleinen innovativen und motivierten Team? Reizt es dich zu Analyse-, Konzeptions- und Testzwecken tief in die Datenwelt einzusteigen? Dann bist du bei uns richtig!

Ihre Aufgaben


Als Data Analyst bist du die erste Ansprechperson, wenn es um Datenanalysen und Reportings zu landwirtschaftlichen Daten geht
Adhoc-Anfragen durch unser Management und den Fachverantwortlichen bringen dich nicht aus der Ruhe und die Analyse von Daten fesselt dich – diese dann auch verständlich und gut erklärt zu präsentieren ist Deine Passion
Du bist der Hüter der unternehmensinternen Daten und stellst eigenverantwortlich sicher, dass diese korrekt, aktuell und leicht verfügbar sind
Bietest gerne Unterstützung bei der Verbesserung der Performance und der Zugriffe auf Datenquellen und Analysetools und Mitwirkung bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer Dateninfrastruktur
Dein Know-how bringst du bei der Gestaltung neuer Datenbankstrukturen sowie in der Weiterentwicklung bestehender Datenarchitekturen ein


Ihr Profil


Abgeschlossene IT-Ausbildung (Studium / Berufsausbildung)
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Data Scientist
Sicherer Umgang mit Datenbanken (MS-SQL, PostgreSQL) und Standarddatenformaten (XML, JSON und weitere Formate) und gute Kenntnisse in Datenbankstrukturen und Architekturen
Kenntnis in statistischen Verfahren
Erfahrung mit der SQL-Softwareentwicklung in einem agilen Umfeld (inklusive Scrum), Grundlegende Programmiernisse SQL
Strukturierte, analytische Vorgehensweise
Gute kommunikative Fähigkeiten, fliessende Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse, Französisch von Vorteil sowie eine hohe Kunden- und Serviceorientierung
Selbständige Arbeitsweise, hohes Engagement, Wissensdurst und Teamgeist


Wir bieten Ihnen


Eine vielseitige, entwicklungsfähige Aufgabe in einem innovativen, motivierten Team und einem sehr dynamischen Umfeld
Für eine ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance bieten wir Teilzeitarbeit, flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung (Jahresarbeitszeit) inkl. die Möglichkeit von Home Office und mind. 25 Ferientage
Finanzielle und / oder zeitliche Beteiligung bei zielgerichteter Weiterbildung
Die Stelle ist vorläufig befristet auf 2 Jahre mit Option auf Umwandlung in eine unbefristete Festanstellung
Show more
HTML:
Suchst du eine spannende Herausforderung in einem kleinen innovativen und motivierten Team? Reizt es dich zu Analyse-, Konzeptions- und Testzwecken tief in die Datenwelt einzusteigen? Dann bist du bei uns richtig!

Ihre Aufgaben

  • Als Data Analyst bist du die erste Ansprechperson, wenn es um Datenanalysen und Reportings zu landwirtschaftlichen Daten geht
  • Adhoc-Anfragen durch unser Management und den Fachverantwortlichen bringen dich nicht aus der Ruhe und die Analyse von Daten fesselt dich – diese dann auch verständlich und gut erklärt zu präsentieren ist Deine Passion
  • Du bist der Hüter der unternehmensinternen Daten und stellst eigenverantwortlich sicher, dass diese korrekt, aktuell und leicht verfügbar sind
  • Bietest gerne Unterstützung bei der Verbesserung der Performance und der Zugriffe auf Datenquellen und Analysetools und Mitwirkung bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer Dateninfrastruktur
  • Dein Know-how bringst du bei der Gestaltung neuer Datenbankstrukturen sowie in der Weiterentwicklung bestehender Datenarchitekturen ein

Ihr Profil

  • Abgeschlossene IT-Ausbildung (Studium / Berufsausbildung)
  • Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Data Scientist
  • Sicherer Umgang mit Datenbanken (MS-SQL, PostgreSQL) und Standarddatenformaten (XML, JSON und weitere Formate) und gute Kenntnisse in Datenbankstrukturen und Architekturen
  • Kenntnis in statistischen Verfahren
  • Erfahrung mit der SQL-Softwareentwicklung in einem agilen Umfeld (inklusive Scrum), Grundlegende Programmiernisse SQL
  • Strukturierte, analytische Vorgehensweise
  • Gute kommunikative Fähigkeiten, fliessende Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse, Französisch von Vorteil sowie eine hohe Kunden- und Serviceorientierung
  • Selbständige Arbeitsweise, hohes Engagement, Wissensdurst und Teamgeist

Wir bieten Ihnen

  • Eine vielseitige, entwicklungsfähige Aufgabe in einem innovativen, motivierten Team und einem sehr dynamischen Umfeld
  • Für eine ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance bieten wir Teilzeitarbeit, flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung (Jahresarbeitszeit) inkl. die Möglichkeit von Home Office und mind. 25 Ferientage
  • Finanzielle und / oder zeitliche Beteiligung bei zielgerichteter Weiterbildung
  • Die Stelle ist vorläufig befristet auf 2 Jahre mit Option auf Umwandlung in eine unbefristete Festanstellung

Title: AI Data Scientist Business Analyst 4-Ops
Description:
Job Description

Key Responsibilities:


Design and implement AI-driven applications and tools that automate processes to ensure on-time renewals, efficient customer service and workforce effectiveness.
Create machine learning models and algorithms to optimize renewal rates, along with data analysis and feature engineering for modeling.
Research, design, and develop deep learning models to streamline how renewal information is processed, including the application of large language models (LLMs) and digital assistants.
Develop generative AI solutions to automate tasks such as text generation and content creation.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions into existing systems and processes.
Monitor the performance of AI models and applications, continuously refining them to improve accuracy, efficiency, and reliability.Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization's financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.



Career Level - IC4

Responsibilities

Qualifications:


Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field.
Proven experience in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java and SQL.
Familiarity with Jupyter notebooks, data manipulation and visualization tools.
Ability to quickly learn and apply AI technologies to develop applications and integrate datasets.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills, with the ability to translate complex findings into actionable insights and recommendations.Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.



Qualifications

Disclaimer:

Certain US customer or client-facing roles may be required to comply with applicable requirements, such as immunization and occupational health mandates.

Range and benefit information provided in this posting are specific to the stated locations only

US: Hiring Range: from $73,800 - $178,200 per year. May be eligible for bonus and equity.

Oracle maintains broad salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions and locations, as well as reflect Oracle’s differing products, industries and lines of business.

Candidates are typically placed into the range based on the preceding factors as well as internal peer equity.

Oracle US offers a comprehensive benefits package which includes the following:


Medical, dental, and vision insurance, including expert medical opinion
Short term disability and long term disability
Life insurance and AD&D
Supplemental life insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)
Health care and dependent care Flexible Spending Accounts
Pre-tax commuter and parking benefits
401(k) Savings and Investment Plan with company match
Paid time off: Flexible Vacation is provided to all eligible employees assigned to a salaried (non-overtime eligible) position. Accrued Vacation is provided to all other employees eligible for vacation benefits. For employees working at least 35 hours per week, the vacation accrual rate is 13 days annually for the first three years of employment and 18 days annually for subsequent years of employment. Vacation accrual is prorated for employees working between 20 and 34 hours per week. Employees working fewer than 20 hours per week are not eligible for vacation.
11 paid holidays
Paid sick leave: 72 hours of paid sick leave upon date of hire. Refreshes each calendar year. Unused balance will carry over each year up to a maximum cap of 112 hours.
Paid parental leave
Adoption assistance
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Financial planning and group legal
Voluntary benefits including auto, homeowner and pet insurance



The role will generally accept applications for at least three calendar days from the posting date or as long as the job remains posted.

About Us

As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.

When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.

We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.

Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.

Disclaimer:

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.


Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

Title: AI Inference Engineer (Edge) (100% Remote Europe)
Description:
At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.

Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Work on deploying machine learning models to edge devices using frameworks such as TVM, MLC, and IREE (MLIR).
Collaborate closely with researchers to assist in coding, training and transitioning models from research to production environments.
Integrate AI features into existing products, enriching them with the latest advancements in machine learning.
Excellent programming skills in Python, C and C++.
Experience with platforms such as TVM, MLC, and IREE (MLIR), which facilitate the deployment of models to specific GPU architectures.
Experience in NLP, computer vision, TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Experience with different aspects of Large Language Models (LLMs), such as fine-tuning techniques to tailor models to specific tasks and prompt engineering.
Extensive experience in training models using multi-GPU setups.
Demonstrated ability to rapidly assimilate new technologies and techniques.
A degree in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D.
Show more

Title: Research And Development Engineer
Description:
Summary / Role Purpose

The R&D Engineer II will be part of a team which is responsible for research, design, and implementation of iso-geometric analysis (IGA) pre-processing functionality in support of the LS-DYNA solver. This role requires an analytical and curious mind with strong interest in IGA, spline-technology, mesh generation, computational geometry and numerical methods. The primary job responsibilities will be to contribute to the development of spline technology and supporting functionality allowing for the efficient creation of surface and solid IGA models allowing for solution of complex industrial problems. The successful candidate can expect to be engaged in all stages of code and capability planning, research, creation and evolution of the IGA functionality, and to work closely with other members of the meshing software development team.

Minimum Education/Certification Requirements and Experience

BS in engineering, Computer Graphics, Computational Geometry or Mathematics, with 2 years’ experience, or MS
Expertise in IGA spline technology or related field.
Working knowledge of software development
Knowledge with Python and C/ C++

Preferred Qualifications and Skills

Solid understanding of geometry processing
Interest in mesh generation
Interest in advancing computer aided engineering and analysis
Strong analytical skills
Ability to overcome obstacles
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work collaboratively across teams and geographies
Show more

Title: Python Developer (m/f/d)
Description:
Join our renowned pharmaceutical client as a Backend Engineer Python (m/f/d) and contribute to groundbreaking projects in the vibrant city of Basel!

ResponsibilitiesYour team is closely associated with Biomedical Research within the organizationYou support scientists with solutions to identify hits in large libraries of samples by testing in cellular assays or with the help of DNA-encoded library technologies at any scaleYour provide software solutions for streamlining scientific processes and workflows thinking from start to end, which includes capturing and processing raw data, metadata and derived data generated by instruments either during screening or by intermediate analysisYou aim at applying and leveraging leading edge architecture and software technologiesYour goal is to combine use-case specific applications with optimized technical backend platforms to eventually compose final solutions for scientists to accelerate drug discoveryYou focus on backend implementation and integrate with other components provided by teammatesYou display a good level of curiosity and high-level understanding where your work fits into the bigger picture of the solution, requiring a very collaborative approachRequirements

Expertise For Role 1

We are looking for 2 types of expertise:

Required

Python core backend with Numpy and Pandas are required, Dask highly desiredORM such as SQLAlchemy for system integrationExpertise for role 2:

Python with a focus on workflow management systems and DAG development (Apache Airflow), concurrent tasks management at scaleGeneral understanding of KV-stores, wide-column stores or graphs to work with AWS stack, especially non-SQL high performance storesBenefits

5 weeks holiday / 40h weekAssumption of certification costsReka-Card with a 20% discount on up to CHF 2,400Up to CHF 400 contribution to fitness subscription

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (CH or EU)
Description:
Competitive package: Salary, Options (we want you to take ownership) & awesome benefits (in fact, you will be part of defining the benefit package!) 

 

Why to work for REOR20 

 

Floods are making headlines daily, posing a growing threat worldwide. Ready to join a fast-paced company at the forefront of flood intelligence? REOR20 is looking for dynamic individuals to be key players in our mission to help communities and insurers manage flood risks in the era of climate change.  

 

AI is the buzzword, but we’re taking it to the next level with physics-savvy AI. We’re gearing up to revolutionize the industry with our cutting-edge technology.  

 

Join us and be part of the storm that shields against flood disasters! 

 

About us 

 

REOR20 is not just another flood modeling company; we are a deep tech firm developing technology that, until recently, seemed like science fiction. Our innovative approach offers unparalleled flood risk understanding, pushing the boundaries of what is possible. 




At REOR20, we are pioneering the next generation of technology to deliver precise, timely flood hazard intelligence—something the industry has never seen before. Our groundbreaking approach merges high-fidelity computational engineering tools with innovative AI methodologies. 




Our products are the essential tools needed to win the battle against global flooding and the climate crisis. 




Our vision is clear: to become the global leader in flood hazard intelligence, setting the standard that others strive to meet. We are assembling our core engineering team to build and launch the first commercial-scale version of our product. Joining this team means engaging in a variety of tasks and taking on diverse responsibilities. 




REOR20 champions an open, flexible, and inclusive culture. We pursue excellence, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and embrace the diverse challenges across all aspects of our company.   




We offer excitement, fun, and a rewarding mission! 




At REOR20, we promise to keep pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. Join us, and you’ll always be at the forefront, contributing to a future where our groundbreaking solutions save lives, protect properties, and create a safer, more resilient world. 

 

The Position  

Join our innovative and dynamic startup as a Machine Learning Engineer and play a pivotal role in the development of our groundbreaking flood prediction technology. You will lead and own the end-to-end design, implementation, and deployment of advanced deep learning models. Leveraging your expertise in Machine Learning and Software Engineering, you will create and extend robust and scalable pipelines that drive our data processing, model training, and deployment infrastructure. Your work will ensure the optimal performance and reliability of our cutting-edge flood prediction systems, helping to mitigate the impact of floods worldwide. 

 

Key Responsibilities  

Design, develop, and implement state-of-the-art solutions along the entire model development life cycle, focusing on optimizing performance and scalability. 
Build and maintain the infrastructure for training and testing machine learning models, create and manage large datasets, and ensure robust and scalable data pipelines. 
Investigate and propose new tools and infrastructure to accelerate the development of our state-of-the-art flood models and to optimize all key steps of the model pipeline 
Collaborate with software engineers to deliver deployment ready models.  

 

You should apply if you have 

Excellent coding skills with proficiency in Python and extensive hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks (preferably PyTorch).  
Affinity for designing and optimize machine learning pipelines for scalability and performance 
Experience in large-scale data processing and cloud computing (e.g., AWS) is preferred 
Knowledge of MLOps best practices or large-scale model deployment is a plus 

 

Interested? 

Please apply via LinkedIn or send your application to info@reor20.com. 

 

Show more

Title: AI & Data Engineer:in (m/w/d, 80-100%)
Description:
Substring – the data company entwickelt seit 2000 digitale Lösungen zur Wertschöpfung aus Daten und bietet pragmatische, lösungsorientierte Beratung an. Die Firma ist auf vier Kernthemen spezialisiert:


Data Transformation: Unterstützung auf dem Weg zum datengetriebenen Unternehmen, inklusive Roadmap-Erstellung und Fähigkeitsausbau.
Data Platforms & Data Engineering: Entwicklung von Datenplattformen wie Data Lakes und Data Warehouses sowie Business Intelligence Lösungen.
Operative Datasystems: Entwicklung von Softwareystemen zur Datenverarbeitung und -analyse, von der Prototypenphase bis zur Implementierung mit DevOps & DataOps.
Artificial Intelligence: Entwicklung massgeschneiderter AI-Lösungen für Unternehmensoptimierung und enge Zusammenarbeit mit der Forschung.



Aufgaben

Deine Tätigkeiten:


Du trainierst Machine Learning Modelle für unsere Kunden inkl. des Aufbaus der dazugehörigen MLOps Pipeline.
Du führst Datenanalysen und Abklärungen rund um die Datenbestände der Kunden durch.
Du konzipierst und entwickelst Datenplattformen (Lakehouse, Data Warehouse, Data Lake) für unsere Kunden.
Du erstellsts Datenmodelle für analytische oder operative Tätigkeiten.



Unsere Wünsche an dich:


Kundenzentriert: Du arbeitest selbständig mit unseren Kund:innen und trägst die Verantwortung für deine Projekte.
Selbständig mit Teamgeist: Hoher Grad an Mitgestaltung, entsprechende Verantwortung und persönliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten. Wir fordern und fördern uns gegenseitig.
Daten-affin: Du hilfst unseren Kund:innen mit ihren Daten Mehrwerte zu generieren.
Lernbegierig und Lernfreudig: Du willst mit uns zusammen viel lernen und persönlich und professionell wachsen.
Du sprichst und schreibst Deutsch (C1 oder Muttersprache) und Englisch fliessend.



Qualifikation

Qualifikationen:


Du verfügst über eine relevante Berufserfahrung und/oder Studium im Bereich AI / Data Engineering.
Du bist versiert in Python und kennst dich mit dem Training von Machine Learning Modellen aus.
Du hast idealerweise Erfahrungen im Bereich Data-Pipelines, API, ETL/ELT gesammelt, bereits Datenmodelle entwickelt, Daten transformiert und Daten aufbereitet. Vielleicht hast du schon mit Technologien wie Apache Spark, Databricks, dbt, Azure Synapse oder anderen Tools gearbeitet.
Du bist mit den gängigen Cloud-Plattformen (von Vorteil Azure) vertraut und bringst idealerweise Erfahrung mit DataOps und MLOps mit. Know How von Infrastructure as Code ist von Vorteil
Mit Docker und Containerumgebungen konntest Du idealerweise bereits Erfahrung sammeln.
Agile Werte und Lean Methodologie kennst Du oder du kannst dich damit identifizieren.
MLOps / DataOps und Infrastruktur Themen und die Betreuung von mehreren Umgebungen bis zur Produktion gehören für dich dazu.
Kundenorientierung und eine gute Servicedienstleistung sind Dir sehr wichtig.



Benefits

Unser Angebot an dich:


Flexibles Arbeitsmodell mit viel Freiraum. Wir suchen mit dir gerne Lösungen um Work und Life unter einen Hut zu bringen.
Faire Entlöhnung (transparentes Lohnmodell) mit guten Sozialleistungen.
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten.
Teil eines Teams werden, das etwas bewegen möchte und spannende Digitalisierungsprojekte umsetzt.
Bei uns darfst Du sehr gerne mitgestalten, wir leben eine flache Hierarchie.



Sende uns deine Nachricht mitsamt CV oder deinem Linkedin Profil und deiner Motivation bei Substring mit anzupacken. Gerne auch Links zu Portfolio/Showcase wie Github, Projekte, Blog oder sonstwas um uns einen kleinen Einblick in deine Erfahrungen zu geben.

Du bist dir nicht sicher ob du dich bewerben sollst?

Auch wenn Du nicht alle Anforderungen erfüllst, freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung. Wir legen viel Wert auf ein gut funktionierendes Team, das sich gut versteht. Fehlende fachliche Kompetenzen kannst du Dir aneignen und wir sind bereit mit Dir den Weg zu gehen.
Show more
HTML:
Substring – the data company entwickelt seit 2000 digitale Lösungen zur Wertschöpfung aus Daten und bietet pragmatische, lösungsorientierte Beratung an. Die Firma ist auf vier Kernthemen spezialisiert:

  • Data Transformation: Unterstützung auf dem Weg zum datengetriebenen Unternehmen, inklusive Roadmap-Erstellung und Fähigkeitsausbau.
  • Data Platforms & Data Engineering: Entwicklung von Datenplattformen wie Data Lakes und Data Warehouses sowie Business Intelligence Lösungen.
  • Operative Datasystems: Entwicklung von Softwareystemen zur Datenverarbeitung und -analyse, von der Prototypenphase bis zur Implementierung mit DevOps & DataOps.
  • Artificial Intelligence: Entwicklung massgeschneiderter AI-Lösungen für Unternehmensoptimierung und enge Zusammenarbeit mit der Forschung.


Aufgaben

Deine Tätigkeiten:

  • Du trainierst Machine Learning Modelle für unsere Kunden inkl. des Aufbaus der dazugehörigen MLOps Pipeline.
  • Du führst Datenanalysen und Abklärungen rund um die Datenbestände der Kunden durch.
  • Du konzipierst und entwickelst Datenplattformen (Lakehouse, Data Warehouse, Data Lake) für unsere Kunden.
  • Du erstellsts Datenmodelle für analytische oder operative Tätigkeiten.


Unsere Wünsche an dich:

  • Kundenzentriert: Du arbeitest selbständig mit unseren Kund:innen und trägst die Verantwortung für deine Projekte.
  • Selbständig mit Teamgeist: Hoher Grad an Mitgestaltung, entsprechende Verantwortung und persönliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten. Wir fordern und fördern uns gegenseitig.
  • Daten-affin: Du hilfst unseren Kund:innen mit ihren Daten Mehrwerte zu generieren.
  • Lernbegierig und Lernfreudig: Du willst mit uns zusammen viel lernen und persönlich und professionell wachsen.
  • Du sprichst und schreibst Deutsch (C1 oder Muttersprache) und Englisch fliessend.


Qualifikation

Qualifikationen:

  • Du verfügst über eine relevante Berufserfahrung und/oder Studium im Bereich AI / Data Engineering.
  • Du bist versiert in Python und kennst dich mit dem Training von Machine Learning Modellen aus.
  • Du hast idealerweise Erfahrungen im Bereich Data-Pipelines, API, ETL/ELT gesammelt, bereits Datenmodelle entwickelt, Daten transformiert und Daten aufbereitet. Vielleicht hast du schon mit Technologien wie Apache Spark, Databricks, dbt, Azure Synapse oder anderen Tools gearbeitet.
  • Du bist mit den gängigen Cloud-Plattformen (von Vorteil Azure) vertraut und bringst idealerweise Erfahrung mit DataOps und MLOps mit. Know How von Infrastructure as Code ist von Vorteil
  • Mit Docker und Containerumgebungen konntest Du idealerweise bereits Erfahrung sammeln.
  • Agile Werte und Lean Methodologie kennst Du oder du kannst dich damit identifizieren.
  • MLOps / DataOps und Infrastruktur Themen und die Betreuung von mehreren Umgebungen bis zur Produktion gehören für dich dazu.
  • Kundenorientierung und eine gute Servicedienstleistung sind Dir sehr wichtig.


Benefits

Unser Angebot an dich:

  • Flexibles Arbeitsmodell mit viel Freiraum. Wir suchen mit dir gerne Lösungen um Work und Life unter einen Hut zu bringen.
  • Faire Entlöhnung (transparentes Lohnmodell) mit guten Sozialleistungen.
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten.
  • Teil eines Teams werden, das etwas bewegen möchte und spannende Digitalisierungsprojekte umsetzt.
  • Bei uns darfst Du sehr gerne mitgestalten, wir leben eine flache Hierarchie.


Sende uns deine Nachricht mitsamt CV oder deinem Linkedin Profil und deiner Motivation bei Substring mit anzupacken. Gerne auch Links zu Portfolio/Showcase wie Github, Projekte, Blog oder sonstwas um uns einen kleinen Einblick in deine Erfahrungen zu geben.

Du bist dir nicht sicher ob du dich bewerben sollst?

Auch wenn Du nicht alle Anforderungen erfüllst, freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung. Wir legen viel Wert auf ein gut funktionierendes Team, das sich gut versteht. Fehlende fachliche Kompetenzen kannst du Dir aneignen und wir sind bereit mit Dir den Weg zu gehen.

Title: AI/ML Engineer - Biomedical AI (m/f/d)
Description:
Site Name: Heidelberg - Office, Switzerland - Zug

Posted Date: May 16 2024

At GSK we see a world in which advanced applications of Machine Learning and AI will allow us to develop transformational medicines using the power of genetics, functional genomics and machine learning. AI will also play a role in how we diagnose and use medicines to enable everyone to do more feel better and live longer. It is an ambitious vision that will require the development of products at the cutting edge of Machine Learning and AI.

To help us make this future a reality, we are looking for Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Engineers that have a track record in developing and validating state-of-the-art machine learning models for solving challenging real-world scientific problems. AI/ML Engineers at GSK are outstanding scientists and engineers with in-depth knowledge in modern machine learning and a keen interest in making a positive impact in healthcare.

To strengthen our team in Europe, we are looking for skilled AI/ML Engineers that will drive the development of state-of-the-art biomedical AI algorithms. This role will be focused on researching, designing, implementing, and delivering cutting-edge prediction models across a range of challenging biomedical tasks using state-of-the-art high performance computing facilities and the vast and detailed biomedical data sources available at GSK.

The AI/ML team is built on the principles of ownership, accountability, continuous development, and collaboration. We hire for the long term, and we are motivated to make this a great place to work. Our leaders will be committed to your career and development from day one. We strongly encourage applications from people with diverse and underrepresented backgrounds and perspectives.

You will:



Design and implement AI/ML-driven solutions along the entire model development life cycle.
Research and develop state-of-the-art machine learning models, including deep learning models, to optimize model performance on a range of biomedical prediction tasks.
Deliver robust, tested and performant code in an agile environment.
Liaise with experts in biology, medicine and experimentation to ensure optimal collection of data to train biomedical machine learning models.



Basic Qualifications:

We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:



Bachelor´s, Masters or Doctorate degree in a quantitative or engineering discipline (computer science, computational biology, bioinformatics, engineering, among others); OR equivalent work experience delivering state-of-the-art AI/ML solutions.
Experience in at least one major deep learning framework (PyTorch, TensorFlow).
Experience with machine learning literature and state-of-the-art modelling approaches.
Previous experience in developing and delivering robust software solutions, including demonstrated advanced programming expertise in Python.
Experience in software engineering and machine learning best practices, including version control, continuous integration (CI) and continuous development (CD), containerization, and shell scripting.



Preferred Qualifications

If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:



Background or interest in biology or medicine is a plus but not required.
Fluency in English. Knowledge of German is not required for this position.
Experience in design, development and deployment of commercial AI/ML software.
Contributions to relevant open-source projects.
Relevant scientific publications in AI/ML (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AAAI, among others), computational biology or bioinformatics venues.
Knowledge or interest in disease biology, molecular biology and medicine.
Experience working with biomedical data (e.g., genomics, transcriptomics, proteomics, electronic health records, clinical images)



Why GSK?

Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.

GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together – so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns – as an organisation where people can thrive. We prevent and treat disease with vaccines, specialty and general medicines. We focus on the science of the immune system and the use of new platform and data technologies, investing in four core therapeutic areas (infectious diseases, HIV, respiratory/ immunology and oncology).

Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it’s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves – feeling welcome, valued, and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.

If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or +1 801 567 5155 (outside US).

GSK is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit GSK’s Transparency Reporting For the Record site.

Title: Senior Research Engineer (NLP & NLU)
Description:
To strengthen our Research and Development (R&D) organization, innovate and improve our Natural Language Understanding (NLU) products, we need experienced researchers with focus on Machine Learning (ML), Large Language Model (LLM) and Natural Language Understanding (NLU). 

You will be collaborating with other R&D team in Speech Technology, Dialog Management and the software engineering team. This position will be based in Zurich, Switzerland. 




Principal responsibilities

Work within the NLU R&D team to advance the state of the art in natural language technologies. 
Document and communicate effectively the design and implementation proposals, and the intermediate and final development results in team internal meetings, and in wider R&D or divisional meetings, when requested. 
Define and implement test cases and metrics processes aimed at qualifying the new developments within the team adopted development and testing processes.




Knowledge, Skills and Qualifications:

Required Skills:

Publications in at least one the following conferences: WWW, AAAI, KDD, IJCAI, CoNLL, NAACL, ACL, EMNLP, ICLR, ICML, NeurIPS, ISWC. Full papers are preferred
Strong Computer Science background
Familiarity with deep-learning architectures such as deep neural networks, recurrent neural networks, convolutional neural networks etc.
Familiarity with regression, classification, named entity recognition, evaluation metrics, supervised and unsupervised learning
Expertise with at least one Deep Learning framework (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow) and NLP libraries (e.g., Spacy, NLTK, Huggingface, Gensim, Duckling, Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib, Seaborn)




Desired Skills:

You are able to play up your ability to work in a group and also perform research independently 
Experience in collaborative software development
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English




Education:

PhD in Natural Language Processing / Natural Language Understanding or related field




Work Permit:

Permit to work in Switzerland (EU-28 or equivalent) required




What we offer:

ability to have an impactful voice working on one of the most fast-growing industry
a wide range of advanced equipment
possibility to publish and attend in high impact conferences
option to work from home and on flexible schedules
snacks in the office
english speaking, casual and fun office environment
office located near the Zurich main train station

Title: (Global Oil Gas) Senior Data Scientist
Description:
This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

About the Company



This company engages in the exploration, production, transportation, and sale of crude oil and natural gas. It operates through the following segments: Upstream, Downstream, and Corporate. The Upstream segment includes crude oil, natural gas and natural gas liquids exploration, field development, and production. The Downstream segment focuses on refining, logistics, power generation, and the marketing of crude oil, petroleum and petrochemical products, and related services to international and domestic customers. The Corporate segment offers supporting services including human resources, finance, and information technology. The company was founded on May 29, 1933 and is headquartered in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

Job Summary

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join the Sales & Operations Planning Division's (S&OP) under the Global Optimizer Department. S&OP's primary responsibility is to optimize crude allocation and operations across global manufacturing facilities. This optimization aims to maximize revenue, increase profitability, and capitalize on international market opportunities.

The division serves as the gatekeeper for linear programming (LP) at wholly owned refineries and oversees the integrated global MPIMS model. This model is crucial for optimizing global crude allocation, exploring new international markets, and integrating operational options.

As a Data Scientist, your main role will involve analyzing and structuring large volumes of real-time and historical data. You will build algorithms and solutions around this data to facilitate decision-making within the company. Your work will be pivotal in supporting the company's forecasting and predictive digital strategy, contributing to the development of advanced solutions at the Downstream Digital Center.

Key Responsibilities:

Formulate and lead multifaceted analytic studies against large volumes of data.
Interpret and analyze data using exploratory mathematical and statistical techniques based on the scientific method.
Coordinate research and analytic activities utilizing various data points (unstructured and structured) and employ programming to clean, massage, and organize the data.
Experiment against data points, provide information based on experiment results, and offer previously undiscovered solutions to complex data challenges.
Lead all data experiments tasked by the Data Science Team.
Coordinate with Data Engineers to build data environments providing data identified by Data Analysts, Data Integrators, Knowledge Managers, and Intel Analysts.
Develop methodology and processes for prioritization and scheduling of projects.
Analyze problems and determine root causes.
Define company data assets (data models), Spark, SparkSQL, and HiveSQL jobs to populate data models.
Work closely with all business units and engineering teams to develop strategy for long-term data platform architecture.



Requirements:

Willingness to relocate to Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
Hold a Bachelor's degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or related fields. An advanced degree is preferred.
Have 5-7 years of professional experience in a related field.
Proficiency with one or more programming languages (Java, C++, Python, R, etc.).
Demonstrate experience applying data science methods to real-world data problems.
Experience in utilizing visualization tools to leverage the growing volume of available information.
Show more

Title: Cientista de Dados
Description:
Vem ser Ituber_

O Itaú é a marca mais valiosa do Brasil, a melhor empresa para trabalhar segundo o Great Place to Work e o maior banco da América Latina. Nós impactamos diariamente mais de 60 milhões de clientes em 18 países.

Somos feitos de pessoas e acreditamos na pluralidade de origens, culturas, crenças, experiências, raças, deficiências, gêneros, orientações afetivo-sexuais e gerações que ampliam as perspectivas e contribuem para um clima de respeito e valorização das diferenças.

Não queremos você apenas por achar que tem a nossa cara. Queremos ter um pouco da sua também!




Estamos buscando pessoas que queiram se desenvolver e aprender constantemente, compartilhando, colaborando, inovando e entregando valor para todos os nossos clientes.

Aqui a gente não sabe tudo, a gente vai de turma_




O que estamos buscando?

Capacidade de incentivar e construir ambientes de trabalho colaborativos envolvendo gestores, pares e parceiros;
Liderança para desenvolver equipes de cientistas de dados;
Habilidade na comunicação executiva verbal e visual;
Perfil inovador, dinâmico e colaborativo;
Motivação em aprender novas tecnologias.




Como será o seu dia a dia?

Gerenciar e servir com alta disponibilidade os modelos de Machine Learning para as operações e negócios;
Garantir implantação, operação e evolução dos modelos de Machine Learning;
Apoiar os projetos avançados de modelagem garantindo sua qualidade e entregas;
Participar de agendas estratégicas de dados contribuindo para a evolução técnica da área;
Fazer a gestão das atividades e desenvolvimento das pessoas da equipe.




No que você precisa mandar bem?

Linguagem de programação Python ou R;
Conhecimento nas principais técnicas de preparação de dados, algoritmos de agrupamento;
Conhecimentos em Data Science
Machine learning
Habilidades com apresentação







Ao se tornar um Ituber você tem_

· Vale Transporte

· Vale Refeição (Restaurantes) / Vale Alimentação (Supermercados)

· Convênio médico e odontológico

· Seguro de Vida

· PLR – Participação nos Lucros e Resultados (Mediante resultados do banco)

· Previdência privada

· Descontos exclusivos em nossos produtos financeiros

· Licença maternidade estendida & paternidade

· Auxílio Creche / Babá (para papais e mamães)

· Incentivo a estudos

· GymPass ou TotalPass (contamos com Bio Ritmo em alguns polos)

· Acesso aos Clubes Itaú (Guarapiranga / Itanhaém e São Sebastião)

· + Algumas vantagens que você pode conhecer durante o processo




*Estimulamos candidaturas de pessoas com deficiência em todas as nossas posições, sendo assim, sinta-se à vontade para se candidatar em vagas sinalizadas como exclusivas ou não para pessoas com deficiência. Somos comprometidos com a inclusão e valorizamos a diversidade.




#VemProItaú #VemSerItuber

Show more
HTML:
Vem ser Ituber_

O Itaú é a marca mais valiosa do Brasil, a melhor empresa para trabalhar segundo o Great Place to Work e o maior banco da América Latina. Nós impactamos diariamente mais de 60 milhões de clientes em 18 países.

Somos feitos de pessoas e acreditamos na pluralidade de origens, culturas, crenças, experiências, raças, deficiências, gêneros, orientações afetivo-sexuais e gerações que ampliam as perspectivas e contribuem para um clima de respeito e valorização das diferenças.

Não queremos você apenas por achar que tem a nossa cara. Queremos ter um pouco da sua também!


Estamos buscando pessoas que queiram se desenvolver e aprender constantemente, compartilhando, colaborando, inovando e entregando valor para todos os nossos clientes.

Aqui a gente não sabe tudo, a gente vai de turma_

  • Apoiar os projetos avançados de modelagem garantindo sua qualidade e entregas;

  • Fazer a gestão das atividades e desenvolvimento das pessoas da equipe.

  • Linguagem de programação Python ou R;

  • Conhecimentos em Data Science
  • Machine learning

Title: SENAI | Cientista de Dados I - Inteligência de Mercado - São Paulo - SP | Nº 407-2024
Description:
Processo seletivo para a cidade de São Paulo - SP


Inscrições até o dia 11/07/2024 *****


Cargo: CIENTISTA DE DADOS I

Área de Atuação: Inteligência de Mercado

Tipo de Contratação: CLT - Prazo Indeterminado ou Determinado*

Horário de Trabalho: De Segunda a Sexta das 08h às 17h

Salário: R$ 8.181,49 (mensal) - 40h semanais

Modalidade: Presencial


A ser informado no momento da admissão
Que Você Precisa Ter


Ensino Superior Completo em Ciência da Computação; Economia; Estatística; Engenharias e Áreas Exatas - Com vivência nas temáticas de Data Science e Analytics.

Experiência profissional com Programação em Phyton/PySpark, em atividades de integração, manipulação e tratamento de dados.

Desejável

Familiaridade com o ambiente Azure (Data Factory, Purview, Databricks, Synapse, Azure ML, entre outros recursos).

Conhecimento e experiência em técnicas de Web Crawling e Web Scraping para aquisição de dados;

Conhecimento e experiência na Construção e consumo de APIs:


Que Esperamos De Você


Programação em Python, R e SQL – nível básico;

Conhecimento em processamento de dados e modelagem estatística – nível básico;

Conhecimento de conceitos estatísticos necessários para implementar soluções de inteligência artificial, machine learning, análise exploratória, data mining, técnicas de regressão, modelos probabilísticos (árvore de decisão, random forest, entre outros) e clustering – nível básico;

Elaboração de relatórios dinâmicos – nível básico;

Conhecimento de Ambientes de Computação em Nuvem – nível básico;

Conhecimento em extração, processamento e visualização de dados – nível básico;

Conhecimentos de tecnologias de Big Data (Hadoop, Spark entre outros) – nível básico;

Soft Skills

Comunicação Assertiva

Compreensão do negócio

Pensamento crítico

Colaboração

Curiosidade

Mindset de aprendizado contínuo.


Que Você Irá Fazer


Apoiar a implantação de um conjunto de técnicas estatísticas de análise para transformar dados brutos em informações relevantes, usando linguagens de programação, softwares estatísticos e de visualização de dados. Aplicar data mining, modelagem de dados, processamento de linguagem natural e algoritmos de machine learning para extrair e analisar informações de grandes conjuntos de dados estruturados e não estruturados, sob supervisão. Contribuir para o desenvolvimento de atividades de interpretação e análise de dados, relatando as descobertas aos stakeholders.

Prepare-se Para As Possíveis Etapas

Triagem

Análise curricular

Avaliação técnica

Avaliação prática

Avaliação comportamental

Entrevista


Sujeito a alterações conforme a necessidade


Leia Com Atenção As Orientações a Seguir

Toda comunicação com os candidatos para participação nas etapas será realizada EXCLUSIVAMENTE por E-MAIL, por isso, pedimos que mantenham seus dados atualizados na plataforma.

Após a inscrição na vaga, o candidato deverá ficar atento às mensagens recebidas, inclusive, verificar a lixeira ou caixa de spam, pois as etapas não serão remarcadas.

As etapas poderão ser realizadas em formato presencial ou online (a critério do SESI SENAI-SP) e poderão ser agendadas com até 24 horas antes da realização.

Se no momento da inscrição, houver alguma intercorrência, falha ou necessidade de alteração nos dados de contato/currículo ou não recebimento da confirmação por e-mail, o(a) candidato(a) deverá acionar o suporte da plataforma Recrut.Ai.

O acesso à internet, o equipamento para realização da entrevista (caso ocorra de forma online) e o acompanhamento das datas de realização das etapas enviadas por e-mail é de responsabilidade do candidato.

Havendo falhas no sistema, no equipamento ou a não visualização do e-mail com o agendamento da etapa por parte do candidato, não haverá possibilidade de nova data para a realização.

É permitida somente uma única inscrição por candidato.

Todos os inscritos no processo seletivo receberão o feedback positivo ou negativo, durante ou após o término da seleção.

Diversidade & Inclusão

Entendemos que equipes com diversidade trazem melhores resultados na entrega, no clima organizacional e na representatividade de nossos clientes internos e externos.

Venha enriquecer o nosso ambiente de trabalho!

Quer saber mais ? Acesse os links abaixo:

INFORMAÇÕES GERAIS

FAQ

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
A Atos é uma empresa líder mundial em transformação digital, oferecendo serviços de transação de alta tecnologia, consultoria, integração de sistemas, cloud e serviços gerenciados. Além disso, anunciada como parceira mundial de TI nos Jogos Olímpicos e Paraolímpicos!




Presente em mais de 70 países e com aproximadamente 120.000 especialistas ao redor do mundo, nossa empresa está no novo ranking Digital 100 da Forbes, uma lista das principais empresas de capital aberto que moldam o mundo digital nas áreas de Tecnologia da Informação (TI), hardware, mídia, e-commerce e telecomunicações.




Quem estamos buscando?




Profissional especializado na análise e interpretação de grandes conjuntos de dados para identificar tendências, padrões e insights valiosos que podem ser utilizados para orientar decisões estratégicas e resolver problemas complexos em uma variedade de setores e áreas de negócio, para atuar em São Paulo,SP.




Informações importantes:

Alocação: Preferencialmente Híbrida (Região Central de São Paulo - SP)

Duração: 06 meses - com possibilidade de extensão ou alocação em outros projetos ATOS

Modalidade: CLT




Requisitos:




Experiência em IAGen, Python e Azure.




Entendemos a diversidade como um fator valioso. Por isso, independentemente da sua identidade ou expressão de gênero, orientação sexual, religião, etnia, idade, neurodiversidade, status de deficiência, cidadania ou qualquer outro aspecto que o torne único, se inscreva!

Title: Cientista de Dados Sr
HTML:
Natura é formada por duas marcas de beleza icônicas: Avon e Natura, cada uma com missão e espírito únicos, mas conectadas pelo propósito comum de construir, juntas, o caminho para um futuro melhor. Presentes em mais de 100 países e com mais de 200 milhões de consumidores, e entendendo que promover beleza PARA o mundo é, também, deixar um legado, as empresas ajudam a transformar a sociedade a partir da forma como desenvolvem seus negócios, promovendo a valorização da inclusão e da diversidade, a proteção do meio ambiente e a geração de oportunidades e renda às mulheres.



Cientista de Dados Sr

Localidade: NASP - Av. Alexandre Colares, 1188 - Parque Anhanguera, São Paulo - SP, 05106-000


O que estamos buscando?

O profissional que trabalha com ciência de dados deve estar próximo ao negócio, entendendo

as maiores dificuldades e problemas propostos. É responsável por desenvolver modelos

preditivos, utilizando aprendizagem de máquina, algoritmos e estatística para gerar

oportunidades e identificar tendências. É o profissional que tem acesso e conhecimento de todo

o “guarda-chuva” de ciência de dados, pois precisa extrair e tratar os dados, identificar padrões

e disponibilizar ao negócio a respostas dos modelos preditivos, de maneira clara e objetiva,

assim como colaborar com os engenheiros de dados e engenheiros de machine learning.


Principais Responsabilidades:

• Desenvolver modelos e análises que nos ajudarão a resolver os desafios essenciais de Natura &Co.

• Criar produtos de dados que personalizem a experiência dos consumidores, para obter maior produtividade e engajamento com as empresas do grupo.

• Projetar, analisar e apresentar resultados dos modelos estatísticos e análise de dados junto com as áreas de negócio (Finanças, Planejamento, gestão comercial, etc)


Quais os Requisitos?

• Comunicação

• Pensamento crítico

• Curiosidade

• Conhecimento de negócio


Nossos Benefícios

PLR;

Transporte fretado ida/volta. Estacionamento e restaurante no local;

Modelo de Trabalho Híbrido na localização indicada (3x na semana presencial);

Sua sexta-feira termina às 15:00 #sextou;

O dia do seu aniversário é na sua casa + Vale-presente Natura;

Produtos Natura, Avon e The Body Shop com 40% off. (calma! são 10 produtos por mês para cada um e-commerce);

Berçário para os filhos de até 3 anos das mães e pais colaboradorxs nas localidades do NASP e Cajamar;

Licença maternidade 6 meses + Licença paternidade 40 dias;

Presente no dia das mães (para a sua e para você, se também for mãe);

Gympass;

Assistência médica;

Assistência Psicológica (Psicologia Viva - 4 Sessões Gratuitas por mês);

Assistência odontológica;

Seguro de vida;

Auxílio home office (modelos híbrido e remoto);

Vale Refeição para os dias de Home Office (modelos híbrido e remoto).



A Natura &Co celebra e abraça a diversidade em todas as suas formas e pluralidades! Convidamos as #Mulheres, pessoas #Negras, profissionais com deficiência (#PCD), pessoas pertencentes às comunidades #LGBTQIA+ #Gestantes e profissionais de #QualquerIdade a se candidatarem a esta vaga!

Caso queira saber mais informações sobre como utilizamos seus dados pessoais para fins de recrutamento, consulte o Aviso de Privacidade do Grupo Natura &Co para Candidatas/os, acesse :https://static.rede.natura.net/html/07-2023/global/natura-co/natura-co-global-aviso-para-candidatas-a-vagas.pdf

Title: CIENTISTA DE DADOS SR - POLÍTICAS DE CRÉDITO
Description:
req56203 - CIENTISTA DE DADOS SR - POLÍTICAS DE CRÉDITO

Sobre o Bradesco:

Pensamos em estratégias que sejam capazes de criar oportunidades para a realização das pessoas e para o desenvolvimento sustentável de empresas e sociedade. Ao longo de oito décadas, com pioneirismo e inovação, contribuímos com a democratização do acesso aos serviços bancários no Brasil e fomos além, nos tornamos um dos maiores grupos financeiros da América Latina.

Suas atividades com a gente envolvem:

Gerar subsídios que apoiam a equipe na tomada de decisão estratégica do Departamento de Crédito.

Manter ferramentas de controle e manipulação de banco de dados.

Desenvolver estudos para mensuração de resultados e comparativos para os clientes Pessoa Jurídica.

Maximizar a relação risco-retorno das decisões.

Desenvolver estudos que auxiliam na tomada de decisão estratégica para concessão e manutenção de crédito para clientes PJ.

Criar relatórios com base nos KPIs estabelecidos para acompanhamento mensal de indicadores de performance e estratégias.

Automatizar rotinas de atividades utilizando programação (VBA/SQL/Python/SAS) nas diversas plataformas de origem dos dados.

Elaborar materiais executivos em PowerPoint para apresentação de resultados dos estudos e estratégias.

Interagir e prestar suporte às áreas parceiras do Departamento de Crédito.

Para essa oportunidade você precisa:

Autonomia para realizar atividades de tratamento de bases de dados.

Experiência com linguagens de programação, como SQL, Python ou SAS.

Habilidade para explorar novas informações disponíveis nos ecossistemas de bases.

Conhecimento em gerenciamento de banco de dados.

Conhecimento em Finanças e produtos bancários.

Experiência em gestão de informação com mineração e estratificação de dados.

Habilidade no desenvolvimento de estratégias de crédito visando risco versus retorno.

Capacidade de elaborar apresentações e relatórios executivos.

O que nós oferecemos:

Remuneração -> Aderente às melhores práticas de mercado

PLR (Participação nos Lucros e Resultados) -> Aderente às melhores práticas de mercado*

Saúde -> Plano de saúde, odontológico e seguro de vida, além de descontos em farmácias.

Auxílios -> Refeição, alimentação e transporte.

Previdência –> Plano opcional e exclusivo para funcionários, com participação financeira da Organização Bradesco.

Bem-estar -> O programa interno Viva Bem Bradesco conta com diversas iniciativas para prevenção de doenças e promoção de hábitos, atitudes e comportamentos saudáveis, além de oferecer orientação e aconselhamento para resolução de problemas pessoais, familiares, legais e financeiros.

Capacitação -> Por meio da Universidade Corporativa Bradesco, a Unibrad, investimos no aprendizado pessoal e profissional do nosso time, promovendo soluções de aprendizagem e parcerias com instituições de ensino.

Isenção de tarifas –> Cesta de serviços bancários exclusiva, com descontos e condições especiais em diversos produtos e serviços da Organização Bradesco.

Mães, Pais e Filhos -> Auxílio creche/babá, licença paternidade e licença maternidade estendida, além de acompanhamento assistencial da gestação até o pós-parto.

Habilidade para explorar novas informações disponíveis nos ecossistemas de bases.

Conhecimento em gerenciamento de banco de dados.

Conhecimento em Finanças e produtos bancários.

Experiência em gestão de informação com mineração e estratificação de dados.

Habilidade no desenvolvimento de estratégias de crédito visando risco versus retorno.

Capacidade de elaborar apresentações e relatórios executivos.

O que nós oferecemos:

Remuneração -> Aderente às melhores práticas de mercado

PLR (Participação nos Lucros e Resultados) -> Aderente às melhores práticas de mercado*

Saúde -> Plano de saúde, odontológico e seguro de vida, além de descontos em farmácias.

Auxílios -> Refeição, alimentação e transporte.

Previdência –> Plano opcional e exclusivo para funcionários, com participação financeira da Organização Bradesco.

Bem-estar -> O programa interno Viva Bem Bradesco conta com diversas iniciativas para prevenção de doenças e promoção de hábitos, atitudes e comportamentos saudáveis, além de oferecer orientação e aconselhamento para resolução de problemas pessoais, familiares, legais e financeiros.

Capacitação -> Por meio da Universidade Corporativa Bradesco, a Unibrad, investimos no aprendizado pessoal e profissional do nosso time, promovendo soluções de aprendizagem e parcerias com instituições de ensino.

Isenção de tarifas –> Cesta de serviços bancários exclusiva, com descontos e condições especiais em diversos produtos e serviços da Organização Bradesco.

Mães, Pais e Filhos -> Auxílio creche/babá, licença paternidade e licença maternidade estendida, além de acompanhamento assistencial da gestação até o pós-parto.

Title: Cientista de Dados Pleno - Crédito
Description:
Somos o PAN

Ágeis, flexíveis e criativos, exploramos possibilidades com disposição e desejo de fazer acontecer. Sempre prontos para encarar novos desafios, nutrimos líderes que, além de ter garra, são abertos e empáticos, veem na proximidade das relações, o elo entre cada um.

Nossa missão, se faz cumprida quando transformamos a vida dos outros através dos nossos conhecimentos. Nossos pilares de cultura, reforçam nossa postura idealizadora e com desejo de fazer acontecer: T rabalho em equipe, O usadia empreendedora e P rotagonismo com profundidade.

Dominamos nossos processos e trazemos melhorias para quem deseja ter uma vida financeira mais inteligente.

Principais desafios:

O Cientista de Dados será corresponsável pelo desenvolvimento de soluções de inteligência preditiva, tendo como principais atividades:


Auxiliar e Desenvolver modelos preditivos, robustos e escaláveis, para apoiar a tomada de decisão da área de crédito;
Conduzir pesquisas para compreender as causas dos principais problemas de negócios e propor soluções data-driven ;
Explorar os diversos conjuntos de informações disponíveis para determinar pontos fracos do portfólio, tendências e oportunidades de negócios;
Propor métodos de análise e monitoramentos inteligentes e recomendar melhorias para os processos decisórios existentes;
Atuar no processo de deploy de serviços preditivos – MLOps – de acordo com a melhores práticas;
Aplicação sistemática de metodologias de análise de dados que promovam a descoberta de actionable insights ;
Interação com principais drivers da concessão e manutenção de crédito: credit score , endividamento, capacidade de pagamento, entre outras features relevantes;
Uso de processos e métricas de risco de crédito regulamentares (BaCen e SOX) e/ou definidas pelo apetite de risco do banco.


Quais as principais competências para a posição?


Formação acadêmica dentre os cursos de Matemática Aplicada, Física, Estatística, Computação Científica e Engenharias;
Já ter atuado com as ferramentas computacionais de análise de dados, plataformas cloud e apresentação de resultados (Python, R, SQL, Office, Tableau, AWS, Github, entre outros);
Contato com as pipelines de dados, desenvolvimento de algoritmos, stacking de modelos e deploy de serviços;
Capacidade de trabalhar com fontes distintas de dados, incluindo dados não estruturados;
Atuação com as principais implementações dos algoritmos de ML para problemas de clusterização, regressão, classificação, além de possuir habilidade no design de redes neurais artificiais e construção de modelos de séries temporais;
Conhecimento sobre as técnicas estatísticas de modelagem paramétrica de distribuição de variáveis aleatórias e suas propriedades, testes de hipóteses e seus usos;
Aplicação de técnicas de análise e tratamento de vieses nas bases de dados e features de interesse;
Compreensão sobre a aplicação de métodos de matemática e engenharia financeira necessários para a moderna gestão de portfólios de crédito;
Perfil analítico e foco na solução de problemas complexos considerando múltiplos cenários e relações de risco vs. retorno;
Comunicação clara e objetiva das análises, modelos e descobertas para as áreas de negócios.


Modelo de atuação: Híbrido (4 dias presencial no escritório e 1 dia de home office).

Benefícios do PAN:


Bônus / PLR 🤑
Vale Refeição 🍔
Vale Alimentação 🍝
13º de Vale Alimentação 🤌
Convênio Médico (internação em apartamento para titular e dependentes) 🏥
Convênio Odonto/Ortodôntico 😁
Ambulatório Médico no escritório 🚑
Telemedicina Dr. Alper (Einstein Conecta) ilimitado. 🩺
Seguro de Vida ❤
Descontos em mais de 10 mil farmácias 💊
4 Sessões de psicoterapia por mês 🤝
Licença familiar estendida (Responsável 6 meses e corresponsável 30 dias) 👨‍🍼🤱
Auxílio Creche / Babá 🎒
AcomPANha (programa de acompanhamento para gestantes) 🫃🤰
Gympass/Totalpass 💪
Auxílio tecnologia assistivas (reembolso de 85% para colaboradores com deficiência) 🦻🦽
Day Off Aniversário 🎉
Day Off Tempo de Casa 🕛
Programa de reconhecimento por tempo de casa 🏆
Programas de desenvolvimento 📚
Gamificação em certificações e desenvolvimento (BitPANs) 🎫
Massagem e Auriculoterapia 💆‍♀️💆‍♂️
Salão de beleza no escritório 💇‍♂️💅
PAE (Orientação Jurídica, Financeira, Psicológica e Social) 🧑‍🎓
Serviço Social 🤗
Portal de descontos em diversos segmentos (Allya) 🤑
Campanha de vacinação (colaborador e dependente) 💉
Facilitação no financiamento de veículos 🚗
Cartão de crédito PAN com limite diferenciado 💳
Vale Transporte (desconto de apenas 4%) 🚆
Assistência Funeral 🤍


Assim como todas as nossas vagas, essa também é destinada à diversidade e inclusão. Independentemente de qualquer fator, perfil ou característica, Eleve sua carreira a PAN !

Para conhecer mais sobre nossos benefícios e cultura, acesse o Trabalhe Conosco:

https://www.bancopan.com.br/trabalhe-conosco/

Acesse também nossa página na Glassdoor e veja nossas avaliações:

https://www.glassdoor.com.br/Vis%C3%A3o-geral/Trabalhar-na-Banco-PAN-EI_IE1184444.13,22.ht
Show more
